original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says this and so forth.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul ni gang du sgro btags pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul ni gang du sgro btags pa byas pa ste /
translated: The object of desire is that to which superimposition is made.

original: de lta bas na yul dang dus gang dang 'brel pa glang po la sogs ba de dag yul de dang 'brel pa nyid du snang ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta bas na yul dang dus gang dang 'brel pa glang po la sogs ba de dag yul de dang 'brel pa nyid du snang ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, when the object and time related to an elephant and so on appear to be related to that object,

original: rang dang bral pa'i yul dang dus gzhan du ci'i phyir snang /
analyzed: rang dang bral pa'i yul dang dus gzhan du ci'i phyir snang /
translated: why do they appear in another place and time separate from themselves?

original: de lta bas na shes pa de dag ni don dam par ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa de dag ni don dam par ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Thus it is established that those consciousnesses are essentially unmixed and moving by nature,

original: res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: because they are intermittent.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu yang du ma nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu yang du ma nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Also, the person who is their nature is established as being multiple and impermanent.

original: 'di snyam du shes pa ni skyes bu de'i chos yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes pa ni skyes bu de'i chos yin la /
translated: If you think: Consciousness is a quality of that person.

original: des na de tha dad na yang skyes bu tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de tha dad na yang skyes bu tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though it is different, the person is not different,

original: de ni chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de ni chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: because it is the possessor of the quality.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: rtogs pa dang / sems pa can dang / blo dang / shes pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / sems pa can dang / blo dang / shes pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ‚Äúrealization,‚Äù ‚Äúthought,‚Äù ‚Äúmind,‚Äù and ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù are not different things.

original: ming tha dad pa tsam nyid kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin tha dad ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ming tha dad pa tsam nyid kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin tha dad ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Things are not different by virtue of their names alone.

original: gzhan yang ming tha mi dad na yang shes pa de dag gi sems pa can gyi bdag nyid gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bor 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ming tha mi dad na yang shes pa de dag gi sems pa can gyi bdag nyid gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bor 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, even if the names are not different, it is only asserted that those cognitions have a single nature as the possessor of thought.

original: sems pa can de tha mi dad pa na de'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa rnams kyang cha med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sems pa can de tha mi dad pa na de'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa rnams kyang cha med pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the possessor of thought is not different, then the cognitions that have that nature are also partless.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig tu tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig tu tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because they would have contradictory properties, they would certainly be different.

original: shes pa dmigs pa med bar bstan pa 'di nyid kyis blo mngon sum ma yin pa yang sun byung ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dmigs pa med bar bstan pa 'di nyid kyis blo mngon sum ma yin pa yang sun byung ba yin te /
translated: This very teaching that cognition is without an object refutes the non-Buddhist view that cognition is direct perception.

original: 'di ltar yongs su gsal ba'i rnam pa de ni phyi rol ma yin par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su gsal ba'i rnam pa de ni phyi rol ma yin par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is established that the aspect that is clearly manifest is not external.

original: de lta yin dang de ltar yongs su gsal ba'i rnam pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba nyid du rtogs pa na rang nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir blo rnams rang rig pa'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no //üîΩgang yang / dper na rang gi ngo bos me //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de ltar yongs su gsal ba'i rnam pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba nyid du rtogs pa na rang nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir blo rnams rang rig pa'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no // gang yang / dper na rang gi ngo bos me //
translated: If that is so, then when the mind realizes the nature of the aspect that is clearly manifest in that way, the mind becomes the nature of reflexive awareness, because it is the nature of clear manifestation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa /
translated: Someone says, ‚ÄúFor example, fire does not burn itself.‚Äù

original: de sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: To refute that,

original: 'di nyid du nye bar bsag pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid du nye bar bsag pa bstan pa ni /
translated: the following is taught right here:üîΩIf the mind were always present,

original: gal te blo ni rtag gnas dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te blo ni rtag gnas dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te blo'i gnas skabs don thams cad rtogs pa'i ngo bo dang rtag tu ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te blo'i gnas skabs don thams cad rtogs pa'i ngo bo dang rtag tu ba yin na /
translated: If the state of the mind, the nature of the realization of all objects, were permanent,

original: de'i tshe don thams cad du rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe don thams cad du rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that all objects would be cognized.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: blo ni sgra yi yul can gang //
analyzed: blo ni sgra yi yul can gang //
translated: The mind that is the object of sound,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i yul can sgra'i rnam @207b ba can gang yin pa de nyid ro dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i yul can sgra'i rnam @207b ba can gang yin pa de nyid ro dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can yin gyi /
translated: Thus, that which is the object of sound and has the aspect of sound is the object of taste, form, etc.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not another.

original: de lta yin dang don gcig nyams su myong ba'i dus na don thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang don gcig nyams su myong ba'i dus na don thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, when one object is experienced, it would follow that all objects would be experienced,

original: de la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi blo thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang yang ; blo gcig gis ni du ma yi //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi blo thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro // gang yang ; blo gcig gis ni du ma yi //
translated: because the cognition that has the nature of perceiving that would be present in all.üîΩAnd also,

original: rnam shes de ni cig car nyid //üîΩkhyad par med phyir rim gyis kyang //
analyzed: rnam shes de ni cig car nyid // khyad par med phyir rim gyis kyang //
translated: One cognition does not simultaneouslyüîΩperceive many objects.üîΩBecause they are not different, it does not do so sequentially either,

original: mi 'gyur de khyad med phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur de khyad med phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: This is what is explained.üîΩIf you say that is not so,

original: min zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te sgra'i yul can gyi blo de nyid kyi ro la sogs pa'i spyod yul can du khas len par mi byed na /
analyzed: min zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te sgra'i yul can gyi blo de nyid kyi ro la sogs pa'i spyod yul can du khas len par mi byed na /
translated: if you do not accept that the cognition that is the object of sound is also the domain of taste, etc.,

original: de lta na blo rnams kyi tha dad pa khyod kyi rang gi tshig nyid kyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na blo rnams kyi tha dad pa khyod kyi rang gi tshig nyid kyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: then your statement that the cognitions are different would be undermined by your own words.

original: med dper byas pa nyid gang yin pa de yang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med dper byas pa nyid gang yin pa de yang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: me yang bsreg bya ma lus pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: me yang bsreg bya ma lus pa'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Fire does not always burn,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that it burns without fuel.

original: bsreg par bya ba thams cad sreg pa'i rang bzhin gyis sreg par byed pa rtag tu gnas ba ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba thams cad sreg pa'i rang bzhin gyis sreg par byed pa rtag tu gnas ba ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not the case that the fire, whose nature is to burn, always abides, burning all that is to be burned.

original: / de lta ma yin na bsreg bya mtha' dag thal bar byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na bsreg bya mtha' dag thal bar byas par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were, then all that is to be burned would be reduced to ashes,

original: sreg par byed pa 'bar ba dang 'brel pa'i bsreg par bya ba bzhin du rang sreg par byed pa nyid du rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sreg par byed pa 'bar ba dang 'brel pa'i bsreg par bya ba bzhin du rang sreg par byed pa nyid du rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fire would always be in contact with that which is to be burned, just as it is in contact with the fire that is burning.

original: yang gi sgras ni blo don thams cad rtog pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni blo don thams cad rtog pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only is the mind not the nature of the apprehension of all objects.

original: gal te de lta na mi rtag tu sreg par byed pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mi rtag tu sreg par byed pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur na /
translated: If it were not so, then it would not always have the nature of burning.

original: 'o na ji ltar don nye ba yang sreg par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar don nye ba yang sreg par byed ce na /
translated: But how does it burn when it is in contact with its object?

original: bsreg par bya don nye nyid na //
analyzed: bsreg par bya don nye nyid na //
translated: It burns only when it is in contact with the object to be burned.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu brjod pa'i don khas blangs pa na /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu brjod pa'i don khas blangs pa na /
translated: If it were so, i.e., if one accepted the meaning just stated,

original: don thams cad cig car sreg par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don thams cad cig car sreg par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: it would not follow that all objects would be burned simultaneously.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the absurd consequence does not occur.

original: gang yang dper na me long dang ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa la /
analyzed: gang yang dper na me long dang ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa la /
translated: Now, in regard to the statement, ‚ÄúFor example, a clear mirror, etc.,‚Äù

original: me long la sogs pa de yang rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo nyid yin na mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩautpala sngon po sogs 'brel las //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa de yang rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo nyid yin na mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir / autpala sngon po sogs 'brel las //
translated: it is unreasonable to maintain that the mirror, etc., are permanent and of a unitary nature.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe blue lotus, etc., are related,‚Äù etc.

original: shel dang me long la sogs ba skad cig re rer 'jig ba yin na autpala sngon po la sogs pa dang phrad pas phyin ci log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shel dang me long la sogs ba skad cig re rer 'jig ba yin na autpala sngon po la sogs pa dang phrad pas phyin ci log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the crystal, mirror, etc., were destroyed at every moment, they would be related to the blue lotus, etc., and the erroneous cognition would arise.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te skad cig ma ma yin pa de'i gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur na /üîΩde'i tshe nye bar bsgyur @208a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te skad cig ma ma yin pa de'i gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur na / de'i tshe nye bar bsgyur @208a * //
translated: If it were not so, if the reflection of that nonmomentary object were apprehended,üîΩthen at that time, the state with the prefix would be just the state without the prefix,

original: pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de kho na de nye bar sgyur ba med pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar sgyur ba dang bral ba la yang sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan yang dag par dmigs par 'gyur
analyzed: pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de kho na de nye bar sgyur ba med pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar sgyur ba dang bral ba la yang sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan yang dag par dmigs par 'gyur
translated: and therefore the reflection of blue, etc., would be perceived even without the prefix blue, etc.,

original: te / sngar gyi ngo bo yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / sngar gyi ngo bo yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previous form would not be relinquished.

original: yang na nye bar bsgyur ba'i gnas skabs na yang sngon bo la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral bar mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na nye bar bsgyur ba'i gnas skabs na yang sngon bo la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral bar mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, even in the state with the prefix, it would be seen as devoid of the aspect of blue, etc.,

original: sngar gyi ngo bo dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi ngo bo dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not differ from the previous form.

original: 'dis ni skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la spyir shel dang me long la sogs pa thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan rtogs pa bstsal pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la spyir shel dang me long la sogs pa thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan rtogs pa bstsal pa yin no //
translated: This refutes in general the position that the reflection of all things such as crystal and mirrors is nonmomentary.

original: da ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin ba dag gis phyogs la gzugs brnyan rtogs pa re re sel bar byed pa ni brtan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin ba dag gis phyogs la gzugs brnyan rtogs pa re re sel bar byed pa ni brtan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to refute the understanding of a reflection by means of a partless moment or non-moment, he says, ‚ÄúBecause it is stable, etc.‚Äù

original: brtan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is stable,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir sngar bzhin du me long gi ngos kyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes 'brel te ;
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir sngar bzhin du me long gi ngos kyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes 'brel te ;
translated: because it is not momentary, it does not apprehend the reflection in the mirror as before.

original: skad cig ma ma yin na yang cha med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin na yang cha med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Even if it were not momentary, it would not apprehend because it is partless.

original: 'di ltar khron pa'i nang du chud pa'i chu bzhin du me long gi ngos la gzugs brnyan nang du chud par dmigs na me long gi ngos la bu ga yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khron pa'i nang du chud pa'i chu bzhin du me long gi ngos la gzugs brnyan nang du chud par dmigs na me long gi ngos la bu ga yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if the reflection were observed to enter into the mirror, like water entering a well, there would be a hole in the mirror.

original: dbyibs kyi yan lag ches bar mtshams med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi yan lag ches bar mtshams med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not so, because the parts of the shape are not interrupted.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a delusion.

original: yang na med pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs sna tshogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na med pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs sna tshogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Or else, non-existence is the non-existence of the various states of the prior and subsequent limits.

original: 'di la rgyu ni bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ni bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause of that, he says:

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of the absence of a part.

original: des na don 'di yin te /üîΩbstan pa nyid kyis cha med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te / bstan pa nyid kyis cha med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, this is the meaning:

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because of the absence of a part, because of the absence of a prior and subsequent state.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / lus can ldan cig mi gnas phyir //üîΩme long ngos kyi gzugs brnyan dag /'dzin pa ma yin zhes sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lus can ldan cig mi gnas phyir // me long ngos kyi gzugs brnyan dag /'dzin pa ma yin zhes sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: because embodied beings do not abide together.üîΩThe reflection of a form in a mirror is not grasped as being in the mirror,

original: 'di ltar me long gi ngos la yul de kho nar ril sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar me long gi ngos la yul de kho nar ril sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan dmigs te /
translated: because the reflection of a form, such as a pot, is perceived in the mirror, but not in the mirror itself.

original: lus can gyi dngos po rnams ni nam yang yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus can gyi dngos po rnams ni nam yang yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, embodied entities never exist in the same place,

original: bdag nyid gcig tu thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig tu thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the consequence would be that they would be one and the same entity.

original: 'di yang skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i thun mong gi sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i thun mong gi sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: This is a refutation common to both the momentary and non-momentary.

original: shel la yang yang dag par nye bar bsgyur ba'i gzugs brnyan rtogs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: shel la yang yang dag par nye bar bsgyur ba'i gzugs brnyan rtogs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the reflection is not perceived in the crystal.

original: zur gnyis @208b na ni gnas pas kyang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zur gnyis @208b na ni gnas pas kyang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even though the crystal is situated in two places,üîΩThe crystal is perceived as very clear, not as a part.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe rtogs pa po mdun na gnas pas thang gi padma dang phrad pas shel dmar por dmigs pa kho na'i tshe gang dag zur gnyis na gnas pa de dag gi shel rdo mtha' dag shin tu dkar bar dmigs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe rtogs pa po mdun na gnas pas thang gi padma dang phrad pas shel dmar por dmigs pa kho na'i tshe gang dag zur gnyis na gnas pa de dag gi shel rdo mtha' dag shin tu dkar bar dmigs kyi /
translated: Thus, when the perceiver is situated in front and the crystal is perceived as red by contact with the lotus on the ground, at that time the crystal is perceived as very clear by those situated in the two directions.

original: cha shas kyis ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: cha shas kyis ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not perceived as a part.

original: / de lta yin dang gal te de'i gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mdun na gnas pa'i skyes bu bzhin du zur gnyis na gnas pa'i rtogs pa po dag gis kyang dmar por snang ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta yin dang gal te de'i gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mdun na gnas pa'i skyes bu bzhin du zur gnyis na gnas pa'i rtogs pa po dag gis kyang dmar por snang ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the reflection were apprehended in that way, then the reflection would be apprehended by the perceivers situated in the two directions as it is apprehended by the person situated in front.

original: 'di yang skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa dag la yang thun mong ba'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa dag la yang thun mong ba'i skyon yin no //
translated: This is a general fault for both the momentary and nonmomentary.

original: gal te gzugs brnyan de 'dzin pa la sogs pas ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyogs kyi skyon bshad de /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan de 'dzin pa la sogs pas ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyogs kyi skyon bshad de /
translated: If you say that the error of the position of momentariness is explained by the apprehension of a reflection, etc.,

original: gal te don dam par shel la sogs pa'i yul gyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par shel la sogs pa'i yul gyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur na /
translated: then if the reflection of an object such as a crystal is apprehended ultimately,

original: de'i tshe go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i yul gyi gzugs brnyan rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir gcig gi bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i yul gyi gzugs brnyan rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir gcig gi bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, the reflections of the object that arise in sequence would not be of the same nature, because their natures are different.

original: de bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi shel la sogs pa la yang bsgyur bya dang / sgyur byed la so so'i sgyur byed tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi shel la sogs pa la yang bsgyur bya dang / sgyur byed la so so'i sgyur byed tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, in the case of a crystal, etc., that is of their nature, the transformation and the transformer would be different.

original: gal te yang 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhes khas len par byed na de'i tshe 'di nyid la nyes pa 'di med do zhes shes par byed pa'i don du de nyid du yod na zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te yang 'di 'khrul pa yin no zhes khas len par byed na de'i tshe 'di nyid la nyes pa 'di med do zhes shes par byed pa'i don du de nyid du yod na zhes smos so //
translated: But if you accept that this is an error, then in order to show that this error does not exist in this case, he says, ‚ÄúIf it exists there.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir yang de ltar phyogs gnyis ka la yang gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang de ltar phyogs gnyis ka la yang gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa mi 'thad de /
translated: But in either case, the apprehension of a reflection is untenable.

original: de phyir 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de phyir 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that this is an error.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir shel la sogs pa kho na la 'khrul pa der 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir shel la sogs pa kho na la 'khrul pa der 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is so, why does that error occur only in regard to crystal, etc.,

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin zhe na /üîΩde phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin zhe na / de phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i //
translated: and not in regard to walls, etc.?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúthe various inconceivable powers.‚Äù

original: sna tshogs ni rnam pa du ma bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa dag gang dag bkod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni rnam pa du ma bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa dag gang dag bkod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The various are the many kinds of inconceivable powers. That which is arranged is called that.

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: The individual determinations of the powers of things are not to be disputed.

original: de ni rang gi rgyu brgyud bas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi rgyu brgyud bas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are produced by their own individual causes.

original: cha 'di la khyed cag dang rtsod pa med de /
analyzed: cha 'di la khyed cag dang rtsod pa med de /
translated: There is no dispute with you about this point.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: me ni sreg byed nam mkha' min //üîΩ'di la brtsad du ci zhig yod //
analyzed: me ni sreg byed nam mkha' min // 'di la brtsad du ci zhig yod //
translated: Fire burns, but not space.

original: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: What is there to dispute about this?

original: gal te de lta na 'o na blo la yang yul gyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin mod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na blo la yang yul gyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin mod /
translated: If that is so, then it is indeed the case that the reflection of the object is grasped by the deluded mind.

original: gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that the reflection is grasped.

original: @209a * // blo 'khrul ngo bo yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @209a * // blo 'khrul ngo bo yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe deluded mind, etc.‚Äù

original: blo la 'khrul pa srid par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo la 'khrul pa srid par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the mind is deluded.

original: yang gi sgras ni /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù

original: gzugs brnyan 'dzin par mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan 'dzin par mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya'o //
translated: means that it is not only unreasonable to grasp the reflection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha dad pa dang bral phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang bral phyir te /
translated: Because it is free from being different.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different.

original: shel la sogs pa dag la ni 'khrul par rigs te /
analyzed: shel la sogs pa dag la ni 'khrul par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that delusion exists in relation to crystal, etc.,

original: de dag las tha dad pa'i 'khrul pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa'i 'khrul pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind of delusion exists that is different from them.

original: de bzhin du blo la 'khrul pa'i ngo bo'i blo gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo la 'khrul pa'i ngo bo'i blo gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te //
translated: In the same way, the mind of delusion does not exist as another entity in the mind,

original: 'di ltar blo gcig kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo gcig kho nar 'dod do //
translated: because it is asserted that there is only one mind.

original: blo ni rang nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i ngo bor skye'o zhes brjod par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: blo ni rang nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i ngo bor skye'o zhes brjod par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also incorrect to say that the mind itself arises in the nature of error.

original: blo rtog pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo rtog pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that the mind is conceptual.

original: gang yang rtag pa nyid dang gcig pu nyid bsgrub pa'i don du //üîΩde la rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du //
analyzed: gang yang rtag pa nyid dang gcig pu nyid bsgrub pa'i don du // de la rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du //
translated: Moreover, in order to prove that it is permanent and unitary,üîΩyou say,

original: blo ni ngo shes par byed de //
analyzed: blo ni ngo shes par byed de //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is recognized as having the nature of cognition.‚Äù

original: zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de la /
translated: In response to that, we say:

original: rtogs med ngo bo las ldog pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtogs med ngo bo las ldog pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The nature of cognition is not different from that which lacks conceptualization.

original: ngo bo shes pa 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo shes pa 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: This cognition of the nature is uncertain.

original: 'di ltar rtogs ba med pa'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa las ldog ba tha dad pa sgro btags nas blo thams cad ni sna tshogs pa yin na yang ngo shes pa 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs ba med pa'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa las ldog ba tha dad pa sgro btags nas blo thams cad ni sna tshogs pa yin na yang ngo shes pa 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, having imputed a difference, a distinction, from a pot, etc., which lacks conceptualization, all minds are indeed various, but it is not contradictory for recognition to occur.

original: gang sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa ngo shes pa 'di ni rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi za bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa ngo shes pa 'di ni rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi za bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the recognition of the very diversity is due to the reason of the exclusion of the dissimilar.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa kho na bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid ma yin pa kho na bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is no diversity at all.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa'i sgro btags pa'i blo la don tha dad pa la mi rten na yang ngo mi shes pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa'i sgro btags pa'i blo la don tha dad pa la mi rten na yang ngo mi shes pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, in the case of a cognition that is a superimposition without an object, even though it does not depend on different objects, there is still nonrecognition.

original: de la gang kho na la glang po'i blo 'gyur ba de nyid la rta dang shing rta'i blor 'gyur ba de lta bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang kho na la glang po'i blo 'gyur ba de nyid la rta dang shing rta'i blor 'gyur ba de lta bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the cognition of an elephant is the same as the cognition of a horse or chariot.

original: blo 'di dag ni dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes bsgrubs zin pas yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: blo 'di dag ni dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes bsgrubs zin pas yang mi brjod do //
translated: We have already established that these cognitions are without objects, so we will not elaborate further.

original: des na gang /
analyzed: des na gang /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the following statement is unestablished:

original: tha dad don la mi rten par //
analyzed: tha dad don la mi rten par //
translated: Without depending on different objects,

original: ngo shes med pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes smras pa de ni ma grub bo zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo shes med pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes smras pa de ni ma grub bo zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: nonrecognition does not exist.

original: gzhan yang gal te khyed cag gis rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo'i bdag 'dod pa de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa khas len na'o na 'di ni rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid khas blang par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te khyed cag gis rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo'i bdag 'dod pa de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad par mi 'gyur ro // 'on te bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa khas len na'o na 'di ni rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid khas blang par mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, if you assert a self that is of the nature of permanent and unitary, then it would not be different in terms of the states of pleasure and so on.üîΩBut if you accept that it is different in terms of the states of pleasure and so on, then you should not accept that it is permanent and unitary.

original: gcig la tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang @209b bzhin rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang @209b bzhin rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical for a single thing to have a nature that is both different and not different, since these are mutually exclusive.

original: rtsod pa 'di spang ba'i don du gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa gang yin pa de re zhig sun dbyung ba'i phyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di spang ba'i don du gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa gang yin pa de re zhig sun dbyung ba'i phyir bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to refute the meaning of this objection, the following is stated to refute the response of KumƒÅrila:

original: gnas skabs tha dad tha dad pas //
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad tha dad pas //
translated: Because of being different in terms of states,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is not permanent.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams kyi tha dad pa ste /üîΩsna tshogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams kyi tha dad pa ste / sna tshogs pa nyid de /
translated: The different states of pleasure and so onüîΩare its diversity.

original: des tha dad pa skyes bu sna tshogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: des tha dad pa skyes bu sna tshogs pa nyid de /
translated: Because of being different in terms of that, it is diverse.

original: des sdong zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: des sdong zhes bsdu'o //
translated: The word and is used to include the other two.

original: gnas skabs sna tshogs pa yin na yang rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas skabs sna tshogs pa yin na yang rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that although there are various states, there is one nature.

original: 'di la rgyu bstan pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu bstan pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, the word own-nature is used to indicate the cause.

original: brtan pa brtag pa'i bdag nyid de rang bzhin gyi bdag gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: brtan pa brtag pa'i bdag nyid de rang bzhin gyi bdag gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the nature of the own-nature of the investigation of the stable is called that.

original: yang na gnas skabs tha dad pa ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: yang na gnas skabs tha dad pa ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par te /
translated: Or, the difference in states is the difference in states,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as pleasure, etc.

original: de dag las mtha' gcig tu tha dad pa ste logs shig pa'i ngo bo des stong pa ste de dang tha mi dad pa yin na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag las mtha' gcig tu tha dad pa ste logs shig pa'i ngo bo des stong pa ste de dang tha mi dad pa yin na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is empty of that which is different from them, that is, of a nature that is separate from them. The meaning is that although it is not different from them.

original: yongs su brtags pa de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that which is imagined?

original: bde sdug la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde sdug la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says pleasure, pain, etc.

original: rtogs pa yin na yang zhes bya ba shes pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: rtogs pa yin na yang zhes bya ba shes pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is cognition means even though it is consciousness.

original: mi zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: The person is the self.

original: sems can rdzas yod nyid sogs la //
analyzed: sems can rdzas yod nyid sogs la //
translated: The substantial existence of the sentient being, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sogs pa'i sgras shes bya nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i chos gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras shes bya nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i chos gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates the general properties of being an object of knowledge, being an object of activity, being an agent, being a consumer, and so on.

original: khyad par gyi chos shin tu chad pa yang ma yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par gyi chos shin tu chad pa yang ma yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the specific properties are not completely cut off, he says,

original: gnas skabs gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe other states . . .‚Äù

original: snga ma zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: snga ma zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe previous‚Äù refers to the states of pleasure, and so on.

original: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ci'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa mi myong zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ci'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa mi myong zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then why is suffering, and so on, not experienced in the states of pleasure, and so on?üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: phyi ma'i rjes su mthun bya'i phyir //
analyzed: phyi ma'i rjes su mthun bya'i phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to conform to the later . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas skabs na phyis kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs mi 'byung bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas skabs na phyis kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs mi 'byung bas de'i phyir /
translated: Because suffering, and so on, do not occur in the state of pleasure, and so on, by their own intrinsic nature,üîΩ.

original: sems pa can dang rdzas la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi'i bdag la de thim pa yin te /
analyzed: sems pa can dang rdzas la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi'i bdag la de thim pa yin te /
translated: The general self, which is the characteristic of all sentient beings and substances, etc., is dissolved into that, because it is consistent with the subsequent arising of the state of suffering.

original: phyis kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs skye ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur bas de'i don du de de la thim pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs skye ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur bas de'i don du de de la thim pa yin no //
translated: For that purpose, it is dissolved into that.

original: gal te de lta yin na gnas skabs gzhan bzhin du spyi'i bdag la yang gnas skabs thim pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na gnas skabs gzhan bzhin du spyi'i bdag la yang gnas skabs thim pa mi rigs te /
translated: If that is so, just as in other states, it is not logical that the general self is dissolved into the state,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la gnas @210a * //üîΩskabs rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la gnas @210a * // skabs rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: because of contradiction.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that qualm, he says, ‚ÄúThe state is not dissolved into the state, because of its own nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bos gnas skabs rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir phan tshun thim par mi rigs so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bos gnas skabs rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir phan tshun thim par mi rigs so //
translated: Because the states are mutually contradictory by their own nature, such as pleasure and pain, etc., it is not logical that they are mutually dissolved.

original: gang gis 'di de la mi 'gyur ba gnas skabs can spyi'i bdag la ni thim pa la 'gal ba ci yod ;
analyzed: gang gis 'di de la mi 'gyur ba gnas skabs can spyi'i bdag la ni thim pa la 'gal ba ci yod ;
translated: Since that is not so for the general self, which has the states, what contradiction is there in its being dissolved into that?

original: 'di ltar spyi'i bdag 'di gnas skabs thams cad du 'gal ba med bar rjes su 'jug par mthong ste gnas skabs thams cad la sems pa can la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi'i bdag 'di gnas skabs thams cad du 'gal ba med bar rjes su 'jug par mthong ste gnas skabs thams cad la sems pa can la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in all circumstances, the universal self is seen to be without contradiction, because the mind and so on are observed in all circumstances.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúIf the self were one with the body,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te skyes bu las gnas skabs rnams nges par tha dad par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu las gnas skabs rnams nges par tha dad par mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert that the body and so on are different from the person in terms of their states,

original: de'i tshe de dag skye ba dang 'jig pa na ste /üîΩgnas skabs de dag skye ba dang 'jig pa yin na skyes bu 'di la yang de dag ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag skye ba dang 'jig pa na ste / gnas skabs de dag skye ba dang 'jig pa yin na skyes bu 'di la yang de dag ste /
translated: then when they arise and disintegrate,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: the person would also arise and disintegrate.

original: gcig tu zhes bya ba'i tshig ni cung zad tha mi dad pa yin yang gnas skabs bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig par thal ba bzlog par dka'o zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu zhes bya ba'i tshig ni cung zad tha mi dad pa yin yang gnas skabs bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig par thal ba bzlog par dka'o zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù in the root text is meant to indicate that, even though the person and the body and so on are not different in the slightest, it is still difficult to avoid the absurd conclusion that the person arises and disintegrates just as its states do.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha mi dad pa de ni de skye ba dang 'jig pa na skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha mi dad pa de ni de skye ba dang 'jig pa na skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever is not different from something else is the same as that other thing in arising and ceasing,

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i de dag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i de dag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the very essence of pleasure, etc.

original: skyes bu la yang bde ba la sogs pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu la yang bde ba la sogs pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the essence of a person is not different from pleasure, etc. This is a syllogism based on the nature of things.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that this reason is not indeterminate, he says,üîΩIf one accepts that a person

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan na ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: has contradictory properties,

original: gal te gnas skabs dag kho na skye ba dang 'jig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs dag kho na skye ba dang 'jig pa yin gyi /
translated: If one accepts that the states alone arise and cease,

original: skyes bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu skye ba dang mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa khas len na /
analyzed: skyes bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu skye ba dang mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa khas len na /
translated: but not the person, and that the person has the contradictory properties of arising and not arising,

original: de'i tshe tha dad par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe tha dad par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that the person and the states are different.

original: dper na skyes bu mang po rnams kyi phan tshun rang nyid so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis phan tshun tha dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu mang po rnams kyi phan tshun rang nyid so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis phan tshun tha dad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the mutual difference of many persons by their own individual natures.

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam du zang pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgong sa pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam du zang pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgong sa pa yin no //
translated: The reason for the convention of difference is just this much.

original: skyes bu yang dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bos phan tshun tha dad pa med pas de'i phyir bsgrub bya ma tshang ba bzlog pa'i ched du bdag nyid so sor nges pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu yang dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bos phan tshun tha dad pa med pas de'i phyir bsgrub bya ma tshang ba bzlog pa'i ched du bdag nyid so sor nges pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since the person is not mutually different by the nature of entities and so on, therefore, in order to avoid the incompleteness of the probandum, he says ‚Äúindividually ascertained.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid so sor nges pa'i ngo bo 'di dag ni nges par tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid so sor nges pa'i ngo bo 'di dag ni nges par tha dad pa yin te /
translated: These things with individually ascertained natures are certainly different.

original: de lta ma yin na nyams su myong ba dang dran pa la sogs pa so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa @210b 'chol par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyams su myong ba dang dran pa la sogs pa so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa @210b 'chol par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no individual ascertainment of experience, memory, and so on, and the arrangement would be confused.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa de ni de dang lhan cig tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa de ni de dang lhan cig tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not established and does not have the same nature as something else is not nondifferent from it.

original: dper na phan tshun so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bos skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phan tshun so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bos skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a person whose nature is to be mutually exclusive.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyang skyes bu dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyang skyes bu dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The situation of pleasure, etc. is also different from the person in being established and having the same nature. This is a nonobservation of a pervasion.üîΩAlso, the opponent says:

original: gang yang / gnas skabs gzhan ni skye 'gyur tshe //
analyzed: gang yang / gnas skabs gzhan ni skye 'gyur tshe //
translated: When another situation arises,

original: snga ma gtan du 'jig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma gtan du 'jig mi 'gyur //
translated: the former does not completely perish.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: To this we reply:üîΩIf your person

original: gal te khyod kyi skyes bu la //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩspyi'i gnas skabs la thim pa na rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi skyes bu la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / spyi'i gnas skabs la thim pa na rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis sam /
translated: is completely destroyed,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos thim pa yin grang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos thim pa yin grang /
translated: when a general situation dissolves, does it dissolve by its own nature or by the nature of another?

original: de la gal te rang gi ngo bos yin na de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa 'byung na yang ste /
analyzed: de la gal te rang gi ngo bos yin na de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa 'byung na yang ste /
translated: If it is by way of its own nature, then even when pleasure and so on arise,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nyams su myong ba na yang de sdug bsngal la sogs par nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nyams su myong ba na yang de sdug bsngal la sogs par nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: when the state of pleasure and so on is experienced, it would be experienced as pain and so on,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would have the character of the object.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: But if it is by way of another nature,

original: de la gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúIf it is by way of another nature, then it would not be the self.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang skyes bu la sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'pho ba de'i bdag nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu la sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'pho ba de'i bdag nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, if the self is the transmigrator, it would be the self of the person.

original: de lta yin dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, then like pain and so on, it would not be different from them.

original: bdag de skyes na skye ldan te //
analyzed: bdag de skyes na skye ldan te //
translated: If the self were produced, it would be produced.

original: skye ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be endowed with production.

original: gang la ; skyes bu byed po za po ni //
analyzed: gang la ; skyes bu byed po za po ni //
translated: But it was said that the person, the agent and experiencer,

original: gnas skabs la ni mi rten zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: gnas skabs la ni mi rten zhes smras pa de la /
translated: does not depend on states.

original: gal te byed po za ba po //
analyzed: gal te byed po za ba po //
translated: If the agent is the experiencer,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above passage.

original: gal te byed pa po nyid la sogs pa skyes bu kho na la rten par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po nyid la sogs pa skyes bu kho na la rten par gyur na /
translated: If the person alone were the basis of such things as the agent,

original: de ni snga ma'i ngo bo ma ma btang ba'i bdag la srid pa ma yin no //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig byed pa po dang za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs yongs su ma btang ba de ni byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni snga ma'i ngo bo ma ma btang ba'i bdag la srid pa ma yin no // sbyor ba ni gang zhig byed pa po dang za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs yongs su ma btang ba de ni byed pa ma yin la /
translated: then it would be impossible for the self to exist without relinquishing its prior nature.

original: za ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: za ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not relinquish the state of being a non-agent and a non-experiencer is neither an agent nor an experiencer,

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.üîΩAnd the person does not relinquish the state of being a non-agent and a non-experiencer at all times.

original: skyes bu yang thams cad du byed pa po dang za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs yongs su ma btang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o ;
analyzed: skyes bu yang thams cad du byed pa po dang za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs yongs su ma btang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o ;
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: / slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis /üîΩskyes bu'i blo ni skye ba na //
analyzed: / slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis / skyes bu'i blo ni skye ba na //
translated: The master Dignaga says:üîΩIf the mind of the person

original: gal te 'gyur na mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na mi rtag nyid //
translated: arose and ceased, it would be impermanent.

original: 'on te 'gyur ba ma yin na //
analyzed: 'on te 'gyur ba ma yin na //
translated: But if it does not change,

original: bdag gzhan 'jal byed mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bdag gzhan 'jal byed mi dmigs so //
translated: then it cannot be observed as the experiencer of self and other.

original: zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: This is what he said.

original: de la gzhon nu ma len gyis /üîΩmi rtag sgra yi @211a * //
analyzed: de la gzhon nu ma len gyis / mi rtag sgra yi @211a * //
translated: To this, Kumarila replied:

original: brjod bya nyid //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù

original: bdag ni zlog par byed ma yin //
analyzed: bdag ni zlog par byed ma yin //
translated: is not denied by me.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba tsam brjod phyir //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba tsam brjod phyir //
translated: Because it is said to be merely a transformation,

original: de tsam gyis 'di chad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'di chad mi 'gyur //
translated: it is not annihilated by that alone.

original: zhes smras te //
analyzed: zhes smras te //
translated: This is what he said.

original: de 'dir mjug bsdu pa'i thabs kyis skyon bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir mjug bsdu pa'i thabs kyis skyon bshad pa'o //
translated: Here, the fault is explained by way of a summary.

original: de ste de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ste de'i phyir /
translated: If that is so,

original: rtag pa'i sgra'i brjod bya nyid kho bos ma bzlog ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i sgra'i brjod bya nyid kho bos ma bzlog ste /
translated: then the meaning of the word ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is not denied by me,

original: rang gi nye bar len pa sngon du song ba'i skad cig re rer 'jig pa'i sems pa can 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa sngon du song ba'i skad cig re rer 'jig pa'i sems pa can 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mind that is momentary, that is destroyed at every instant, that is preceded by its own appropriation, that is not interrupted as long as cyclic existence continues.

original: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: However, its own nature,

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ldan phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ldan phyir te /
translated: its essence, is transformed,

original: nges pa snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su btang nas rang bzhin gzhan skye ba'i phyir chad pa ste 'di'i 'jig pa gsal rab pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su btang nas rang bzhin gzhan skye ba'i phyir chad pa ste 'di'i 'jig pa gsal rab pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is certain that it gives up its previous nature and generates another nature. Therefore it is annihilated, and its destruction is clearly evident.

original: gang yang sbrul la sogs pa dpe nyid du blangs pa de yang rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang sbrul la sogs pa dpe nyid du blangs pa de yang rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the example of the snake, etc. is taken up, in order to demonstrate that it is not established as having the nature of the permanent and the singular.

original: sbrul yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩji ltar skyes bu bstan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbrul yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ji ltar skyes bu bstan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúThe snake, etc.‚ÄùüîΩJust as it is not logical for a person to have another state arise because he is of the nature of a single person,

original: gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sprul la yang mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sprul la yang mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: in the same way, it is not logical for a snake.

original: gang gi tshe yang 'di skad cig ma 'jig par 'gyur ba'i tshe gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ba rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'di skad cig ma 'jig par 'gyur ba'i tshe gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ba rigs pa yin te /
translated: When it is destroyed moment by moment, it is logical for another state to arise,

original: gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gzhan skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gzhan skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristic of the arising of another state is the arising of another nature.

original: gang yang ngas /üîΩrig ces bya ba'i bdag gi blos //
analyzed: gang yang ngas / rig ces bya ba'i bdag gi blos //
translated: Also, it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúThe self‚Äôs cognition called ‚Äòawareness‚Äô

original: shes pa po nyid rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa po nyid rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: is realized to be the knower.‚Äù

original: zhes smras pa de la ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i gnas skabs dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de la ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i gnas skabs dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúThat is not established,‚Äù the context is indicated by ‚Äúbecause of the absence of any object whatsoever.‚Äù

original: nga rgyal 'di la ni gang gis 'di'i yul shes pa po yin par 'gyur ba don dam par dmigs pa cung zad yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal 'di la ni gang gis 'di'i yul shes pa po yin par 'gyur ba don dam par dmigs pa cung zad yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In this pride, there is not even the slightest object that is ultimately existent, by virtue of which one could be a knower of that object.

original: gal te de lta na 'di skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is the reason for its arising?

original: thog med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thog med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe beginningless seeds of the view of sentient beings as real.‚Äù

original: sems can du lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: sems can du lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the perishable collection is the view of sentient beings as real.

original: de'i sa bon ni bag chags te nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i sa bon ni bag chags te nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The seeds of that are the habitual propensities, which means the potentialities.

original: thog ma med pa yang de yin la sems can du lta ba'i sa bon yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa yang de yin la sems can du lta ba'i sa bon yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The beginningless seeds of the view of sentient beings as real is a compound.

original: de'i stobs ni bdag po'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni bdag po'o //
translated: Its power is its dominance.

original: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid du nges pa nyid kyi skye mched drug la'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid du nges pa nyid kyi skye mched drug la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some‚Äù refers to the six sense bases that are definitely internal.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir thams cad du mi 'jug ce na /
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir thams cad du mi 'jug ce na /
translated: But why does it not occur in all cases?

original: 'du byed 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'du byed 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the determination of the nature of some formations.‚Äù

original: de yi ngo bor nges byas la //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor nges byas la //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving determined its nature‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su 'jug pa'i shes pa po'i ngo bo nges pa'i nga rgyal @211b la'o ;
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su 'jug pa'i shes pa po'i ngo bo nges pa'i nga rgyal @211b la'o ;
translated: that the nature of the knower is determined in the prior and subsequent moments.

original: / kun du zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: / kun du zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all cases‚Äù means in other continua and in pots, etc.

original: gzhan yang nga rgyal gyi dmigs pa bdag yin na yang ci'i phyir bdag gzhan la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang nga rgyal gyi dmigs pa bdag yin na yang ci'i phyir bdag gzhan la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: Moreover, if the object of the conceit ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the self, why does it not occur in regard to another? The objection and analysis are the same.

original: nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because of the determination of the capacity,üîΩwe reply,

original: gla te de lta na kho bo cag la yang nus pa nges pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po 'ga' zhig kho na la 'jug gi / thams cad la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad 'chol ba med pa nyid do //üîΩ'di snyam du rnam bar gzhag pa 'di yin la rag mod /
analyzed: gla te de lta na kho bo cag la yang nus pa nges pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po 'ga' zhig kho na la 'jug gi / thams cad la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad 'chol ba med pa nyid do // 'di snyam du rnam bar gzhag pa 'di yin la rag mod /
translated: If it is so, then for us also, since the capacity is ascertained, the establishment of all things is not confused, since they operate only in regard to some internal things and not in regard to all.

original: 'on kyang 'di'i dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar 'grub snyam du sems na /üîΩrtag par dmigs pa'i phyogs la ni //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di'i dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar 'grub snyam du sems na / rtag par dmigs pa'i phyogs la ni //
translated: Even though this is the establishment, still, how is the non-existence of its objective support established?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'di ltar 'di'i dmigs par 'gyur ba rtag pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar 'di'i dmigs par 'gyur ba rtag pa'am /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn the case of a permanent objective support,‚Äù etc.

original: mi rtag pa zhig yin grang /üîΩgal te rtag pa yin na de'i tshe nga rgyal thams cad de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhig yin grang / gal te rtag pa yin na de'i tshe nga rgyal thams cad de /
translated: Thus, is its objective support permanent or impermanent?

original: nga rgyal rnams cig car du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnams cig car du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is permanent, then at that time all forms of pride would be simultaneous,

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause would be complete.

original: rgyu ma yin ba ni dmigs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin ba ni dmigs par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that a non-cause is the objective support,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absurdity of over-extension.

original: nus pa'i rgyu ni lhan cig byed pa dag la ltos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni lan cig ma yin par dpyad zin to //
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu ni lhan cig byed pa dag la ltos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni lan cig ma yin par dpyad zin to //
translated: The cause of potency does not depend on the cooperating conditions. This has been analyzed more than once.

original: nga rgyal 'di ni gcig kho na yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: nga rgyal 'di ni gcig kho na yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that there is only one type of pride.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis du ma nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis du ma nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established as being multiple by virtue of being intermittent.

original: 'di ltar gnyid stug po log pa dang / myos pa dang / brgyal ba'i gnas skabs su nga rgyal rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyid stug po log pa dang / myos pa dang / brgyal ba'i gnas skabs su nga rgyal rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, pride is not reasonable in the states of deep sleep, intoxication, and fainting.

original: yang gzhan gyi tshe rigs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad du ma dmigs pas 'di res 'ga' nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi tshe rigs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad du ma dmigs pas 'di res 'ga' nyid du grub bo //
translated: But it is reasonable in other states. Therefore, since it is not observed in all states, it is established as being intermittent.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis kyang du ma yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis kyang du ma yin no //
translated: And by virtue of being intermittent, it is established as being multiple.

original: de'i phyir nga rgyal thams cad de yod pa tsam na yod pa rnams cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga rgyal thams cad de yod pa tsam na yod pa rnams cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all types of pride would arise simultaneously when its mere existence exists.

original: yang mi rtag pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: yang mi rtag pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: If the object of pride is impermanent, then the pride would be impermanent.

original: de'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du nga rgyal thams cad ches gsal bar snang bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du nga rgyal thams cad ches gsal bar snang bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, it would follow, absurdly, that all of the manas would appear very clearly, just like the eye consciousness and so on,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po dngos su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po dngos su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be directly apprehending the entity that is its object.

original: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa mu stegs byed pa dag gis shes pa'i skad cig de'i yul du ci zhig rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i dmigs pa brgal zhing brtag pa don med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa mu stegs byed pa dag gis shes pa'i skad cig de'i yul du ci zhig rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i dmigs pa brgal zhing brtag pa don med do //
translated: The others, the tirthikas such as the Vatsiputriyas, are pointless in their objections and analyses of the object of that consciousness, such as what is it that is conceived by the mind.

original: de la nga rgyal 'di ni dmigs pa med pa kho @212a * //üîΩna yin te /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal 'di ni dmigs pa med pa kho @212a * // na yin te /
translated: In this regard, this manas is only devoid of an object.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis 'khrul pa 'jug pa yin no zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis 'khrul pa 'jug pa yin no zhes gang smras pa /
translated: It is said that it operates through the power of the latent potentialities of the view of the transitory collection that have been deposited since beginningless time.

original: 'di la gzhon nu ma len gyis brjod pa'i sun 'byin pa 'dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gzhon nu ma len gyis brjod pa'i sun 'byin pa 'dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Here, the Vatsiputriyas make the following objections.

original: shes pa po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says,

original: bag chags ni shes pa po'i yul la ngo shes pa'i byed pa por 'os kyi /üîΩde min la ste /
analyzed: bag chags ni shes pa po'i yul la ngo shes pa'i byed pa por 'os kyi / de min la ste /
translated: Habitual tendencies are suitable to be the agent of recognition of the object of the knower.üîΩBut not that which is not

original: shes pa po ma yin pa la /üîΩde zhes te shes pa po zhes shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa po ma yin pa la / de zhes te shes pa po zhes shes pa ste /
translated: the knower.

original: ngo shes pa'i bag chags byed pa por 'os pa ma yin no zhes sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i bag chags byed pa por 'os pa ma yin no zhes sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: That is, it is not suitable to be the agent of the habitual tendency of recognition, which is the knower.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the cause of error.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i rgyu yul gyi don nyid la shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i rgyu yul gyi don nyid la shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: But rather, it is the cause of experience, which is the object itself that generates consciousness.

original: 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not error. This is the meaning.

original: de lta bas na nga rgyal 'di ni bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir 'khrul par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nga rgyal 'di ni bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir 'khrul par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this pride is generated by habitual tendencies and since there is no valid cognition that refutes it, it is not reasonable to consider it to be an error.

original: gal te sgra ni gnod med phyir //
analyzed: gal te sgra ni gnod med phyir //
translated: If sound is not refuted,

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug thogs su rim pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug thogs su rim pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: this should be seen in sequence after this.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs pa yin no //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúNo‚Äù and so on.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pa ni /üîΩrtag pa dmigs pa'i phyogs la ni //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pa ni / rtag pa dmigs pa'i phyogs la ni //
translated: The reasoning just explained

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / gang yang /üîΩbag chags 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / gang yang / bag chags 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin //
translated: is stated in the lines ‚ÄúIf you say that the cause of error is a permanent thing . . .‚Äù

original: zhes smras pa /
analyzed: zhes smras pa /
translated: and ‚ÄúThe cause of error is not a latent impression.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ni ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdbang phyug sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / dbang phyug sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show that this is uncertain, it is said:

original: gal te bag chags 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bag chags 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the cause of error is not a latent impression,

original: de'i tshe dbang phyug skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad rgyu thams cad shes pa blo rtag pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa ji ltar bag chags tsam yong pas 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang phyug skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad rgyu thams cad shes pa blo rtag pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa ji ltar bag chags tsam yong pas 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: then how could errors such as ‚Äòƒ™≈õvara, who is born and possesses all causes, is the support of the eternal intellect‚Äô arise from mere latent impressions?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis kyang dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gro ba'i byed pa po yin pa bkag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis kyang dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gro ba'i byed pa po yin pa bkag pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus KumƒÅrila has refuted the idea that ƒ™≈õvara and so on are the creators of the world.

original: bag chags tsam gyi ngo bo las //
analyzed: bag chags tsam gyi ngo bo las //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of error is not a latent impression.üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la tsam smos pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tsam smos pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the above verse is to be understood as follows.üîΩ

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i don rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i don rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the verse is for the purpose of eliminating the object of the pride.

original: de lta bas na nga rgyal dmigs pa med pa'i phyir des gzung bar bya ba'i shes pa po 'ga' zhig grub pa yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir bdag grub pa ma yin no //üîΩgang yang / 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyis gzung bya //
analyzed: de lta bas na nga rgyal dmigs pa med pa'i phyir des gzung bar bya ba'i shes pa po 'ga' zhig grub pa yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir bdag grub pa ma yin no // gang yang / 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyis gzung bya //
translated: Therefore, since the pride has no object, there is no apprehension of an experiencer that is grasped by that pride. Thus, the self is not established.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it was said that the self is permanent because it is the object of the pride of the past.

original: de la de'i @212b phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la de'i @212b phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it was said, ‚ÄúIf the self is the object of the pride, etc.‚Äù

original: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i shes pa po dpe'i chos can yod pa ma yin pas dpe ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i shes pa po dpe'i chos can yod pa ma yin pas dpe ma grub bo //
translated: ‚ÄúAny‚Äù means that since there is no example that is a permanent or impermanent experiencer, the example is not established.

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba dang po dang gyis pa dag la chos can ma grub pa'i dpe'i skyon yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba dang po dang gyis pa dag la chos can ma grub pa'i dpe'i skyon yin te /
translated: Thus, the first and second syllogisms have the fault of the example being unestablished with respect to the subject.

original: da ltar dang khar tshang gi nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i shes pa po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
