analyzed: da ltar dang khar tshang gi nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i shes pa po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no knower whatsoever who is known by my consciousness now or in the past.

original: sbyor ba gsum pa la yang blo gcig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba yin te /üîΩmngon bar 'dod pa nyid gyi blo gcig rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po nga'i shes pan yid dam /
analyzed: sbyor ba gsum pa la yang blo gcig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba yin te / mngon bar 'dod pa nyid gyi blo gcig rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po nga'i shes pan yid dam /
translated: In the third syllogism, the example ‚Äúlike a single cognition‚Äù is not established as having the probandum and the logical reason.üîΩThis is because a single cognition that is desired to be manifest is not established as a single continuum or as a knower that is ‚Äúmy consciousness,‚Äù

original: yul cig / nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul cig / nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or as a single object.

original: de bas na chos gnyis ma grub pa'i sgo nas 'di yang ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na chos gnyis ma grub pa'i sgo nas 'di yang ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this [syllogism] is also shown to be unestablished by way of the nonestablishment of the two properties.

original: ji ltar rigs pa bstan pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa bstan pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it that the reason is taught?

original: bstan pa ni sngar nye bar bkod pa'i gtan tshigs gang dag yin pa de dag ji ltar rigs par te /
analyzed: bstan pa ni sngar nye bar bkod pa'i gtan tshigs gang dag yin pa de dag ji ltar rigs par te /
translated: The teaching is that whatever reasons were previously set forth, they are not established as the property of the subject.üîΩHow is that?

original: ji ltar srid pa gzhi ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa gzhi ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that the basis is not established.

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba dang po dang gnyis pa dag la gtan tshigs gsum ka yang gzhi ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba dang po dang gnyis pa dag la gtan tshigs gsum ka yang gzhi ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in the first and second syllogisms, all three reasons are unestablished,

original: nga'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba'i chos can shes pa po 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba'i chos can shes pa po 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the subject, the object apprehended by my consciousness, is not established as any knower at all.

original: sbyor ba gsum pa la ni chos can shes pa rnams grub pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba gsum pa la ni chos can shes pa rnams grub pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: In the third syllogism, the subject, consciousnesses, is established, and thus it is not the case that the reason is unestablished.

original: 'on kyang de dag la rgyud gcig dang ma 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i yul nyid kyis khyad par ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag la rgyud gcig dang ma 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i yul nyid kyis khyad par ma grub ste /
translated: However, the property of the subject is not established, because they are not related to a single continuum, and the object of a knower is not established.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has already been proven that they are without an object.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rigs par zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rigs par zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that ‚Äúas is fitting.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las dpyod pa bas kun du brtags pa'i bdag brtag pa ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las dpyod pa bas kun du brtags pa'i bdag brtag pa ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the eighth chapter, having the name ‚ÄúExamination of the Self Invented by the Enumerators,‚Äù of the Light for the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: // / da ni grangs can gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni grangs can gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the self imagined by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, it is said:

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Others say that the self is the experiencer,

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni grangs can rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni grangs can rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù refers to the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: de dag ni sems pa can bdag gi rang gi ngo bo blo las tha dad par rtog par byed de ;
analyzed: de dag ni sems pa can bdag gi rang gi ngo bo blo las tha dad par rtog par byed de ;
translated: They imagine that the conscious self is a nature that is different from the intellect.

original: 'di ltar blo ni gtso bo'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo ni gtso bo'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Thus, the intellect is the nature of the primary nature.

original: sems pa can ni skyes bu nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gzhung lugs yin no //
analyzed: sems pa can ni skyes bu nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gzhung lugs yin no //
translated: The conscious self is the nature of the person. This is their doctrine.

original: skyes bu de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu gtso bos drangs pa'i za ba po yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu gtso bos drangs pa'i za ba po yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that person is the experiencer of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, which are impelled by the primary nature.

original: las rnams kyi byed pa po ni ma yin te /üîΩ'gro ba @213a * //
analyzed: las rnams kyi byed pa po ni ma yin te / 'gro ba @213a * //
translated: But it is not the agent of actions.

original: thams cad kyi yongs su 'gyur ba ngo bo'i rang bzhin nyid byed pa bo nyid du 'dod ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi yongs su 'gyur ba ngo bo'i rang bzhin nyid byed pa bo nyid du 'dod ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the primary nature is asserted to be the agent of the transformation of all beings.

original: 'dir yang tshad ma dag ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshad ma dag ston pa ni /
translated: Here, the proofs are presented.

original: gang zhig 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po yin ba de ni gzhan gyi don byed bar mthong ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po yin ba de ni gzhan gyi don byed bar mthong ste /
translated: Whatever is an entity by the nature of an aggregation is seen to perform a function for something else.

original: dper na mal cha dang stan la sogs ba'i yan lag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mal cha dang stan la sogs ba'i yan lag bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the limbs of a bed, a seat, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa yang bsags pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang bsags pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The eyes, etc. are also of the nature of an aggregation. This is a natural inference.

original: gzhan gang yin pa de yang shugs kyis bdag yin no zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa de yang shugs kyis bdag yin no zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam ba'o //
translated: Whatever else there is, that also is the self by implication. This is the opponent's opinion.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig dam bca' ba'i don sun 'byin bar byed de /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig dam bca' ba'i don sun 'byin bar byed de /
translated: In response to that, he says, etc. He refutes the meaning of the thesis.

original: 'di ltar sems ba can skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes smra ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems ba can skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes smra ba na /
translated: Thus, when one says that the nature of the sentient being is the person,

original: sems pa can rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya bar dam bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems pa can rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya bar dam bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: it is as if one were to maintain that the sentient being is of the nature of the permanent and the unitary,

original: rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo'i skyes bu las de tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo'i skyes bu las de tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the person is not different from the sentient being of the nature of the permanent and the unitary.

original: 'di yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This also contradicts direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i sems rang rig pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa dang ldan pa rang bzhin tha dad pa ches gsal bar shin tu gsal ba nyid du rig ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i sems rang rig pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa dang ldan pa rang bzhin tha dad pa ches gsal bar shin tu gsal ba nyid du rig ste /
translated: is very clearly known to have a different nature from the essence of reflexive awareness.

original: de yang sems pa can gcig yin na 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems pa can gcig yin na 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not tenable if there is a single cognizer.

original: khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar yang bstan pa'i phyir sems ba can gyi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar yang bstan pa'i phyir sems ba can gyi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the contradiction with what has been accepted, he says, ‚ÄúIf the essence of the cognizer is one,‚Äù etc.

original: bdag ngo bo gcig pa yang yin la /
analyzed: bdag ngo bo gcig pa yang yin la /
translated: The self is one essence,üîΩand it is the experiencer of various objects.

original: don rnam ba sna tshogs pa'i za zab po yang yin no zhes ji ltar phan tshun 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: don rnam ba sna tshogs pa'i za zab po yang yin no zhes ji ltar phan tshun 'gal ba yin te /
translated: How is it contradictory?

original: za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from the state of not being an experiencer.

original: blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is no contradiction in the self possessing the desire to see, etc.,

original: blta 'dod la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blta 'dod la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe desire to see, etc.,‚Äù etc.

original: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa la lta bar 'dod pa dang nyan bar 'dod pa la sogs pa de'i phan tshun tha dad pa la longs spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du brtags ba de dag kyang bdag 'di la 'gyur ba min te /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa la lta bar 'dod pa dang nyan bar 'dod pa la sogs pa de'i phan tshun tha dad pa la longs spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du brtags ba de dag kyang bdag 'di la 'gyur ba min te /
translated: Those who desire to see forms and so on, who desire to hear and so on, are imagined to be the basis of the mutual difference of enjoyment. But that is not the case for this self.

original: 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise.

original: gal te 'byung na de'i tshe de ltar de tha dad par skye ba yin na ni skyes bu skye ba dang ldan pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'byung na de'i tshe de ltar de tha dad par skye ba yin na ni skyes bu skye ba dang ldan pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it did arise, then it would arise as different from them, and in that case the person would be born with birth,

original: blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different from them, like the desire to see and so on.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed ba ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed ba ni //
translated: This is clarified:

original: sems ba can las ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: sems ba can las ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Apart from the mind,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni 'di 'di'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni 'di 'di'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: If it were different, the relation of this to that would be untenable,

original: 'brel @213b pa'i rgyu mtshan phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel @213b pa'i rgyu mtshan phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no basis for the relation of benefit.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This refers to arising and ceasing.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rnam par 'jog ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pas de'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rnam par 'jog ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pas de'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: If something has no reason for being posited as the nature of something else, then the one who has understanding does not posit it as the nature of that other thing.

original: nam mkha' lus can nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' lus can nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, space is not a body.

original: skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa la yang za ba por 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa la yang za ba por 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And in the case of a person who desires to see and so on, there is no reason for positing him as the experiencer. This is the nonapprehension of the reason.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: And this reason is not unestablished, as has been proven.

original: byed ba po med pa'i phyir de'i za ba po 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed ba po med pa'i phyir de'i za ba po 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, since there is no agent, this experiencer is also not tenable, he says:

original: gal te dge dang mi dge'i las //
analyzed: gal te dge dang mi dge'i las //
translated: If there were no virtuous or nonvirtuous karma,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: ma byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu longs spyod pa ni 'ga' yang yod ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu longs spyod pa ni 'ga' yang yod ba ma yin te /
translated: There is no one who experiences the effect of karma that was not done.

original: ma byas pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the error of encountering what one has not done and so on would ensue.

original: 'di la yang gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩgal te 'dod dang rjes mthun par //
analyzed: 'di la yang gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni / gal te 'dod dang rjes mthun par //
translated: Here, anticipating a response from the opponent, he says:üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúIn accordance with desire,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.‚Äù

original: skyes bu las rnams kyi byed pa po ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: skyes bu las rnams kyi byed pa po ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the person is not the agent of the actions,

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin 'di'i ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don gtod par byed pa de la 'di longs spyod do zhes bya bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin 'di'i ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don gtod par byed pa de la 'di longs spyod do zhes bya bas nyes pa med do //
translated: since it is said that ‚Äúhe enjoys the results of this nature just as he desires,‚Äù there is no error.

original: 'on te rang bzhin sems pa can ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin sems pa can ma yin na /
translated: But if you say that this nature is not conscious,

original: gang gis 'di ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skyes bu la sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: gang gis 'di ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skyes bu la sgrub par byed la /
translated: how is it that it causes the person to obtain the results of actions just as he desires?

original: ji ltar dge ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi byed pa por 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde dag zha bo long ba bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi byed pa por 'gyur zhe na / de dag zha bo long ba bzhin //
translated: How is it that it becomes the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúThey are like a blind man and a mute,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: etc.

original: ji ltar long ba mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dang 'brel ba las don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du chen po la sogs pa thim par 'gyur ba sems pa can gyi skyes bu dang phrad pa las sems pa can bzhin du chos la sogs pa'iüîΩ'bras bu la nges par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la skyon med do //
analyzed: ji ltar long ba mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dang 'brel ba las don la 'jug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du chen po la sogs pa thim par 'gyur ba sems pa can gyi skyes bu dang phrad pa las sems pa can bzhin du chos la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la nges par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la skyon med do //
translated: certain, just like the person who has mind, when the great elements, etc., dissolve.üîΩThus, there is no fault in this.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is also explained:üîΩFor the sake of seeing the person,

original: skyes bu mthong ba'i don du dang // de bzhin gtso bo 'ba' zhig don //
analyzed: skyes bu mthong ba'i don du dang // de bzhin gtso bo 'ba' zhig don //
translated: and likewise, for the sake of the principal alone,

original: zha long bzhin du gnyi ga'i yang //
analyzed: zha long bzhin du gnyi ga'i yang //
translated: like a blind person,

original: 'brel pa de yis 'khor ba byas//üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩgal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: 'brel pa de yis 'khor ba byas// zhes bshad pa yin no // gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed do //
translated: both are engaged in cyclic existence by that connection.üîΩIf, as you say, the person is the experiencer of the result of karma, then the person would be the agent of karma.üîΩIf the person were the agent of karma, then the person would be the appropriator of karma.üîΩIf the person were the appropriator of karma, then the person would be the experiencer of the result of karma.

original: gal te rang bzhin ni ma byas pa'i yang las kyi mngon par 'dod pa 'bras bu gtod par byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin ni ma byas pa'i yang las kyi mngon par 'dod pa 'bras bu gtod par byed par 'gyur na /
translated: If the person were the experiencer of the result of karma, then the person would be the agent of karma.üîΩIf the person were the agent of karma, then the person would be the appropriator of karma.üîΩIf the person were the appropriator of karma, then the person would be the experiencer of the result of karma.üîΩIf the person were the experiencer of the result of karma, then the person would be the agent of karma.üîΩIf the person were the agent of karma, then the person would be the appropriator of karma.üîΩIf the person were the appropriator of karma, then the person would be the experiencer of the result of karma.üîΩIf the person were the experiencer of the result of karma, then the person would be the agent of karma.üîΩIf the person were the agent of karma, then the person would be the appropriator of karma.üîΩIf the person were the appropriator of karma, then the person would be the experiencer of the result of karma.üîΩIf the person were the experiencer of the result of karma, then the person would be the agent of karma.üîΩIf the person were the agent of karma, then the person would be the appropriator of karma.üîΩIf the person were the appropriator of karma, then the person would be the experiencer of the result of karma.üîΩIf the person were the experiencer of the result of karma, then the person would be the agent of karma.üîΩIf the person were the agent of karma

original: de'i tshe thams cad du 'dod pa don du gnyer ba na skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don thams cad ci'i phyir @214a * //üîΩ'grub par mi 'gyur /üîΩ'di snyam du de'i rgyu chos med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad du 'dod pa don du gnyer ba na skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don thams cad ci'i phyir @214a * // 'grub par mi 'gyur / 'di snyam du de'i rgyu chos med pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, when all seek what they desire, why would the desired aims of persons not be accomplished?

original: 'grub par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'grub par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThey are not accomplished because the cause of those does not exist,‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir na rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then why is it that the nature of things is not always seen?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúThe nature of things is not always seen,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu ni chos yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu ni chos yin te /
translated: The result of nature is a phenomenon.

original: de yang de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa nyid yin pas mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa nyid yin pas mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, because it is not different from that, it always exists, and therefore it would be the desired result.

original: 'di ltar thams cad ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: In this way, everything is just this,

original: 'di lta ste rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag go //
translated: that is, just nature and persons.

original: de dag kyang rtag tu nye bas des na rtag tu 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtag tu nye bas des na rtag tu 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are always near, therefore the result would always exist.

original: gzhan yang gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyis ster bar byed pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir mi 'dod pa ster bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyis ster bar byed pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir mi 'dod pa ster bar byed /
translated: Moreover, if the desired nature gives, then why does it give the undesired?

original: mi 'dod ba ni 'ga' yang don du gnyer ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dod ba ni 'ga' yang don du gnyer ba ma yin no //
translated: No one pursues what is undesirable.

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin gyis 'di la don gtod par byed ba med kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin gyis 'di la don gtod par byed ba med kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that this is naturally the appropriator of objects.

original: 'on kyang 'di za ba po nyid du rigs pa ma yin te 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di za ba po nyid du rigs pa ma yin te 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: But it is not logical that it is the experiencer, because it is unchanging.

original: don longs spyod dus rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs ba ste /
analyzed: don longs spyod dus rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs ba ste /
translated: The meaning of this is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe object is always experienced.‚Äù

original: gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pas sim pa dang / yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i 'gyur ba ster bar mi byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pas sim pa dang / yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i 'gyur ba ster bar mi byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it does not give rise to the transformation of the nature of pleasure and pain, and so on, and the experience of satisfaction and frustration, and so on,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du 'di zab po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du 'di zab po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be the experiencer, just like space.

original: rang bzhin phan byed mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin phan byed mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be the benefactor.

original: zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is supplied.

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa yin na phan pa bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa yin na phan pa bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is unchanging by nature, it cannot be the benefactor.

original: ci ste 'gyur ba nyid du khas len na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur ba nyid du khas len na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you accept that it does change, then it follows that it would not be permanent.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid la de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa nyid du smra ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid la de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa nyid du smra ba na /
translated: Thus, when you say that impermanence is not the state of that,

original: de yang 'gyur ba na yod pas ji ltar 'di rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'gyur ba na yod pas ji ltar 'di rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: and that also changes, how could that be permanent?

original: rtag pa nyid ni de'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ni de'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because permanence is the nature of its state.

original: gal te yul gyi rnam can blo ;
analyzed: gal te yul gyi rnam can blo ;
translated: If cognition has the aspect of an object,

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis rnam pa gzhan du zab po nyid du dogs pa bsu ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis rnam pa gzhan du zab po nyid du dogs pa bsu ste /
translated: and so on, he anticipates the qualm that the other system is more profound in terms of the aspect.

original: 'di rnam par 'gyur bar gyur nas za ba po nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnam par 'gyur bar gyur nas za ba po nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not asserted that the enjoyer becomes transformed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: blos nges par byas pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i sgo nas shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blos nges par byas pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i sgo nas shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is known through the appearance of the form of the object ascertained by cognition.

original: 'di ltar blo'i me long la zhugs pa'i gzugs brnyan me long gnyis pa lta bu'i skyes bu la 'pho ba de nyid 'di'i za ba po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo'i me long la zhugs pa'i gzugs brnyan me long gnyis pa lta bu'i skyes bu la 'pho ba de nyid 'di'i za ba po yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the reflection that enters the mirror of cognition is transferred to the person who is like a second mirror. That is the enjoyer.

original: rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not transformed.

original: gzugs brnyan tsam 'pho ba na yang skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo 'dor ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan tsam 'pho ba na yang skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo 'dor ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But when the mere reflection is transferred, the person‚Äôs own nature is not abandoned,

original: me long bzhin du de'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long bzhin du de'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is like a mirror.

original: des na za ba @214b bo ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi las khyad par med pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na za ba @214b bo ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi las khyad par med pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this syllogism, ‚ÄúThe action of the non-eater is not distinguished,‚Äù the reason is not established.

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
translated: He replies with ‚ÄúThe reflection . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo'i me long la zhugs pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan me long gnyis pa lta bu'i skyes bu la skye ba gang yin pa de yin no zhes bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: blo'i me long la zhugs pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan me long gnyis pa lta bu'i skyes bu la skye ba gang yin pa de yin no zhes bya bar 'dod de /
translated: The reflection of the object that enters the mirror of the mind is born in the person who is like a second mirror.

original: de gal te skyes bu las tha mi dad pa de'i tshe de ma thag tu bshad ba'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin te /
analyzed: de gal te skyes bu las tha mi dad pa de'i tshe de ma thag tu bshad ba'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin te /
translated: If that is not different from the person, then the absurd consequence that it has arising and disintegration, as was just explained, still stands.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from that, like the nature of a reflection that possesses arising.

original: ci ste tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe za ba po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe za ba po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if the position is that it is different, then at that time it would not be the experiencer,

original: zab po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la khyad par cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la khyad par cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is not the slightest difference in the state of being not an experiencer.

original: skyes bu don gyi gzugs brnyan dang lhan cig 'brel pa las za ba po nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu don gyi gzugs brnyan dang lhan cig 'brel pa las za ba po nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical that the experiencer is the person in relation to the form of the object,

original: phan tshun phan par byed pa ma yin pa dag ni 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun phan par byed pa ma yin pa dag ni 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those that do not mutually benefit each other are not established as being in relation.

original: gzhan yang gal te gtso bos skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa shes na de'i tshe de de dang rjes su mthun par skyes bu don la 'jug par rigs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gtso bos skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa shes na de'i tshe de de dang rjes su mthun par skyes bu don la 'jug par rigs na /
translated: Moreover, if the principal knows the desire to see and so on of the person, then at that time it is logical that the person engages in the object in accordance with that.

original: ji srid du bems po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid du bems po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But that is not so, because it is an inanimate thing.

original: sems pa can dang 'brel pa yod na yang zha bo dang long ba bzhin du 'jug par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sems pa can dang 'brel pa yod na yang zha bo dang long ba bzhin du 'jug par mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not reasonable that it functions like a lame or blind person, even though it is related to a sentient being.

original: 'di ltar long bas lam ma dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar long bas lam ma dmigs mod kyi /
translated: In this way, although a blind person does not perceive a path,

original: 'on kyang 'di zha bo'i brjod par 'dod pa rigs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di zha bo'i brjod par 'dod pa rigs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: it is not reasonable that a lame person should desire to travel on it,

original: de ni sems dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has a mind.

original: de ltar gtso bo ni skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo ni skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, it is not reasonable that pradhƒÅna desires to see and so on,

original: de ni sems ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of being mindless.

original: phan tshun du phan pa byed pa ma yin pa de dag ni zha bo dang long ba bzhin du 'brel ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun du phan pa byed pa ma yin pa de dag ni zha bo dang long ba bzhin du 'brel ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And they do not have a relationship like a lame person and a blind person, because they do not mutually benefit each other.

original: ci ste gtso bo ni skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa rigs pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de lta na yang 'di za ba po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gtso bo ni skyes bu'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa rigs pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de lta na yang 'di za ba po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you assert that it is reasonable that pradhƒÅna desires to see and so on, then it follows it is an enjoyer.

original: byed pa nyid du shes pa gang yin pa de ji ltar za ba yang shes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa nyid du shes pa gang yin pa de ji ltar za ba yang shes par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is known to be an agent not also be known to be an enjoyer?

original: de lta bas na byed ba shes pa za ba mi shes so zhes bya ba 'di las mi rigs pa gzhan ci yod de /
analyzed: de lta bas na byed ba shes pa za ba mi shes so zhes bya ba 'di las mi rigs pa gzhan ci yod de /
translated: Therefore, what is unreasonable about saying that the one who knows how to do something does not know how to eat?

original: cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Nothing at all!

original: byan po tshod ma la sogs pa'i byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: byan po tshod ma la sogs pa'i byed pa po yin la /
translated: The cook is the agent of the cooking of vegetables, etc.

original: de za bar ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de za bar ni mi shes pa ste /
translated: But he does not know how to eat.

original: za ba nyid du mi shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: za ba nyid du mi shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is that he does not know how to eat.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba'i sgra zhig khong nas @215a * //üîΩdbyung ngo // gtso bo blo dang ldan pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba'i sgra zhig khong nas @215a * // dbyung ngo // gtso bo blo dang ldan pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the puru·π£a.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni lta bar 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni lta bar 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to the activities that are in accord with the desire to see.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The following is taught:

original: gtso bo sems pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: gtso bo sems pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de lta mod kyi /
translated: Although the puru·π£a is not of the nature of the mind,

original: 'on kyang nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo dang ldan pa'i phyir skyes bu la gnas pa'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa shes nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo dang ldan pa'i phyir skyes bu la gnas pa'i blta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa shes nas /
translated: But because it is endowed with the cognition of the nature of certainty, it is aware of the desire to see, etc. that is present in the person.

original: 'jug par 'gyur bas de'i phyir thams cad 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur bas de'i phyir thams cad 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: And so it engages in activity. Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: de la lan smras pa ni /
analyzed: de la lan smras pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: blo ldan nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: blo ldan nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: If it is intelligent, etc.

original: gal te gtso bo blo dang ldan par khas len par byed na /
analyzed: gal te gtso bo blo dang ldan par khas len par byed na /
translated: If you accept that the primal substance is intelligent,

original: de'i tshe 'di skyes bu bzhin du sems pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di skyes bu bzhin du sems pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that it is sentient like a person,

original: blo la sogs pa rnams ni sems pa can gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa rnams ni sems pa can gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because intelligence, etc. are synonyms for sentience.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis rang rig pa'i ngo bo gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos pa de ni sems pa can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis rang rig pa'i ngo bo gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos pa de ni sems pa can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, that which, by its very nature, is manifest and whose essence is self-awareness, which is not dependent on another manifest entity, is called sentient.

original: de la ni blo la yang yod pa'i phyir de sems pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni blo la yang yod pa'i phyir de sems pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it exists in intelligence, it becomes the essence of sentience.

original: gang gis de las tha dad pa'i skyes bu 'grub par 'gyur ba kho bo cag gi blo las ma gtogs pa'i sems pa'i ngo bo gzhan dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de las tha dad pa'i skyes bu 'grub par 'gyur ba kho bo cag gi blo las ma gtogs pa'i sems pa'i ngo bo gzhan dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But apart from the mind, we do not perceive any other nature of volition.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi blo sems kyi ngo bo las tha dad pa sgrub pa'i phyir /üîΩsgra dri ro la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi blo sems kyi ngo bo las tha dad pa sgrub pa'i phyir / sgra dri ro la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: Here, in order to prove that the mind is different from the nature of volition,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúLike sound, smell, taste, etc.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de ni sems pa med pa can yin te ro la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de ni sems pa med pa can yin te ro la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is endowed with the properties of arising, ceasing, etc., is devoid of volition, like taste, etc.

original: blo yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: blo yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The mind is also like that. This is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: rang rgyud sgrub par byed bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang rgyud sgrub par byed bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs pa yin te /
translated: He replies, ‚ÄúIf you wish to prove the existence of the mind by itself, etc.‚Äù

original: res 'ga' 'di rang rgyud kyis sgrub par byed dam /
analyzed: res 'ga' 'di rang rgyud kyis sgrub par byed dam /
translated: Sometimes he proves the existence of the mind by itself.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed bas yin grang /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed bas yin grang /
translated: Sometimes he proves it by reductio.

original: de la gal te rang rgyud kyis na de'i tshe gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te rang rgyud kyis na de'i tshe gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If it is autonomous, then it is not established in any of the logical alternatives.

original: 'di ltar snga na med pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa ji lta bu'i skye ba dang ldan pa dang / gtan nas 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa nyid sangs rgyas pa la grags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni khyed cag grangs can la ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar snga na med pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa ji lta bu'i skye ba dang ldan pa dang / gtan nas 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa nyid sangs rgyas pa la grags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni khyed cag grangs can la ma yin te /
translated: For, the kind of arising that has the characteristic of arising from a prior nonexistence and the kind of cessation that has the nature of complete annihilation are not accepted by you Enumerators in the way that they are accepted by the Buddhists.

original: de dag ni khyed cag gis yongs su 'gyur ba dang / mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni khyed cag gis yongs su 'gyur ba dang / mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that they are the transformation of something and that they have an unclear nature.

original: khyed cag gis ji lta ba de lta @215b bu ni sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba lam grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag gis ji lta ba de lta @215b bu ni sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba lam grub pa yin no //
translated: Since that kind of arising and cessation is not established for the Buddhists in the way that it is for you, therefore any of the logical alternatives is not established.

original: sgra tsam grub pa na gtan tshigs grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra tsam grub pa na gtan tshigs grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that when mere words are established, the reason is established.

original: dngos po las dngos po 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po las dngos po 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because a thing is not established from a thing.

original: dngos po kho na gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po kho na gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because only an existent is a logical reason.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid 'khrul la sogs yin na //
analyzed: de nyid 'khrul la sogs yin na //
translated: If it is mistaken and so on,

original: sgra ni 'khrul ba med na yang //
analyzed: sgra ni 'khrul ba med na yang //
translated: then even if the word is not mistaken,

original: sgrub byed skyon ldan shes bya ste //
analyzed: sgrub byed skyon ldan shes bya ste //
translated: the probandum is known to be faulty,

original: dngos las dngos po grub phyir ro //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩci ste thal ba la bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe yang bsgrub bar bya ba la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos las dngos po grub phyir ro // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // ci ste thal ba la bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe yang bsgrub bar bya ba la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because an existent is established from an existent.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: If the reductio is the position of the probandum, then in that case, because the opposite of the probandum has not been shown to be undermined by a valid cognition, the reason is indeterminate.

original: gang sems pa can la skye ba dang ldan pa dang 'jig pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'brel ba ci zhig yod /üîΩgang yang / 'di rtog pa /üîΩji ltar 'o ma shes pa med na yang //
analyzed: gang sems pa can la skye ba dang ldan pa dang 'jig pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'brel ba ci zhig yod / gang yang / 'di rtog pa / ji ltar 'o ma shes pa med na yang //
translated: What is the connection between the statement ‚Äúfor one who has a mind, arising and ceasing would not occur‚Äù and the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is not perceived‚Äù?üîΩAnd what is the connection between the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is not perceived‚Äù and the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is perceived‚Äù?üîΩAnd what is the connection between the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is perceived‚Äù and the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is not perceived‚Äù?üîΩAnd what is the connection between the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is not perceived‚Äù and the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is not perceived‚Äù?

original: be'u 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa ltar //üîΩde ltar gtso bo skyes bu rnam grol ba'i //
analyzed: be'u 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa ltar //üîΩde ltar gtso bo skyes bu rnam grol ba'i //
translated: And what is the connection between the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is not perceived‚Äù and the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the effect, the cause is perceived‚Äù?

original: rgyu mtshan nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and the reason is the cause of the effect.

original: zhes bya ba de yang rtog pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yang rtog pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: This is not a mere theory.

original: 'o ma ni rang dbang du be'u 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma ni rang dbang du be'u 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Milk is not the reason for the growth of the calf, independently.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩso sor nges pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / so sor nges pa'am /
translated: What is it then?

original: res 'ga' ba'i rang gi rgyu dang rkyen dag las skye ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i rang gi rgyu dang rkyen dag las skye ste /
translated: It is produced from its own causes and conditions, which are specific and occasional.

original: de ba skyes pa na be'u skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba yin pas shes pa med kyang 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ba skyes pa na be'u skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba yin pas shes pa med kyang 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: When it is produced, it becomes the reason for the growth of the calf. Thus, even though it is not conscious, it functions.

original: de ltar gtso bo 'jug pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo 'jug pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, the evolution of the primal substance is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa'i phyir dang / de las gzhan pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa'i phyir dang / de las gzhan pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is permanent and because there is no cause other than it.

original: re zhig res 'ga' ba'i rgyu nye ba la rag las pa de'i nus pa res 'ga' ba rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: re zhig res 'ga' ba'i rgyu nye ba la rag las pa de'i nus pa res 'ga' ba rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not reasonable that the power of that which is dependent on the occasional proximity of a cause is occasional.

original: rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a nature.

original: rgyu mtshan ba med pa rtag tu nye ba nyid kyis mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skyes bu'i don thams cad cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste yang blo dang sems pa can tha mi dad pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ba med pa rtag tu nye ba nyid kyis mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skyes bu'i don thams cad cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // ci ste yang blo dang sems pa can tha mi dad pa yin du chug mod /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that all of a person's goals would be simultaneously achieved, since the cause would always be present and would have the characteristics of both high status and the auspicious.

original: de lta na yang 'di'i bdag ma bkag pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di'i bdag ma bkag pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Suppose one said that although the intelligent one and the self are not different, still the self is not refuted.

original: sems pa can la bdag gi sgrar //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems pa can la bdag gi sgrar // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The intelligent one is designated by the term self

original: kho bo cag gis sems pa can la bdag gi sgras 'dogs pa tsam ni ma bkag go /'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis sems pa can la bdag gi sgras 'dogs pa tsam ni ma bkag go /'o na ci zhe na /
translated: We do not refute the mere designation of the intelligent one by the term self.

original: de la rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du sgro btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de bkag go //
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du sgro btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de bkag go //
translated: What we do refute is the superimposition of the quality of permanence onto that.

original: @216a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @216a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang bo dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang bo dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the faculties, the objects, and the mental processes have results.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te sems pa can rtag pa brtan par gyur na de'i tshe dbang po la sogs pa 'bras bu med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sems pa can rtag pa brtan par gyur na de'i tshe dbang po la sogs pa 'bras bu med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If the sentient being were permanent and stable, then the faculties and so on would be completely without result.

original: de dag ni de skyed pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa yang skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de skyed pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa yang skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are for the purpose of producing that, and because it is impossible for a permanent thing to be produced.

original: 'di nyid la dpe bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dpe bshad pa /
translated: An example is explained right here:

original: gal te me ni rtag gyur na //
analyzed: gal te me ni rtag gyur na //
translated: If fire were permanent,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te me rtag par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te me rtag par gyur na /
translated: If fire were permanent,

original: de'i tshe skye bo me'i don du bud shing sogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe skye bo me'i don du bud shing sogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then people would not collect fuel for the purpose of fire.

original: de lta bas na sems pa can rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems pa can rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for the sentient being to be permanent and of a single nature.üîΩAs it was said, ‚ÄúWhatever has the nature of being compounded is seen to be for the sake of another,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad du 'dus pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi don du mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin par 'dod ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du 'dus pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi don du mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin par 'dod ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says,

original: mal cha stan gyi dpe dang ni //
analyzed: mal cha stan gyi dpe dang ni //
translated: The example of bedding and seats,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: bya ba'i khyad par du 'dod pa yin nam /
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par du 'dod pa yin nam /
translated: Is it the specific activity that is asserted to be the difference?üîΩ

original: yang na bya ba'i khyad par ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang na bya ba'i khyad par ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or is it that it is not a transformation because it is not a transformation by way of its own nature, not being a transformation by way of its specific activity?üîΩOr, in another way, is it that in general the mere benefit of others is to be accomplished, as long as it is not examined, because it is pleasant?

original: rnam pa gcig tu na spyir gzhan gyi don tsam ma brtags na nyams dga' ba bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na spyir gzhan gyi don tsam ma brtags na nyams dga' ba bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three ways of conceiving this.

original: de la phyogs dang po yin na grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po yin na grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: If the first position is the correct one, then it is established,

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa de dag kho bo cag gis rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa de dag kho bo cag gis rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par 'dod de /
translated: because we do indeed assert that those such as the eye benefit consciousness.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nas /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,

original: lus dang rig bya la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang rig bya la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the body consciousness arises in dependence on the body and tangible objects.‚ÄùüîΩBut if the second position is the correct one, then the reason is contradictory.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phan pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba la sogs ba smos te /üîΩ'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phan pa nyid // ces bya ba la sogs ba smos te / 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: The benefit is unchanging.

original: rtag pa'i phan pa nyid ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phan pa nyid ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phan pa nyid do //
translated: The benefit is unchanging.

original: de mig la sogs pas sgrub na dpe la bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs la khyab pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid do //üîΩ'di ltar mal cha dang stan la sogs pa de dag ni g-yo ba nyid de /
analyzed: de mig la sogs pas sgrub na dpe la bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs la khyab pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid do // 'di ltar mal cha dang stan la sogs pa de dag ni g-yo ba nyid de /
translated: If one establishes that by means of the eye, etc., then the reason is contradictory because of the pervasion of the probandum by the opposite of the probandum in the example.

original: mi rtag pa khon phan ba rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa khon phan ba rigs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, beds, seats, etc., are just moving, impermanent, and reasonable for benefit.

original: 'gyur ba med pa la bogs dbyung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa la bogs dbyung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to improve that which is unchanging.

original: ci ste spyir bya ba'i khyad par dang / bya ba'i khyad par ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas gzhan gyi @216b don tsam grub pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste spyir bya ba'i khyad par dang / bya ba'i khyad par ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas gzhan gyi @216b don tsam grub pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum pa yin na /
translated: But if, having eliminated the concepts of the general and the particular, it is a third position called ‚Äúthe establishment of mere other‚Äôs purpose,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: then in that case also it is the establishment of what is already established.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams sems la phan 'dogs par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams sems la phan 'dogs par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye, etc. are held to be helpful to the mind.

original: ji ste ji ltar rigs pa can gyis khas blangs pa bzhin du sems kyang bsgrub bya'i chos can nyid du khas len par byed ba de lta na yang khyed cag gi 'dod pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ji ste ji ltar rigs pa can gyis khas blangs pa bzhin du sems kyang bsgrub bya'i chos can nyid du khas len par byed ba de lta na yang khyed cag gi 'dod pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: But even if the mind is accepted as the subject of the proposition, as the NaiyƒÅyikas maintain, your thesis is not established,

original: bdag sems las tha dad du mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag sems las tha dad du mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is not accepted as being different from the mind.

original: rigs pa can gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: rigs pa can gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang ma grub ste /
translated: The meaning that the NaiyƒÅyikas maintain is also not established,

original: phan tshun phan pa byed pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan la phan 'dogs pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun phan pa byed pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams gzhan la phan 'dogs pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye, etc. are held to be helpful to others by virtue of their mutual helpfulness.

original: gzhan nyid ni pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin du ltos pa can yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin du ltos pa can yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherness is relative, like this side and the other side.

original: sems ni rgyu du mas byas pa'i phan pa 'dzin ba nyid kyis skye ba'i phyir dang / 'dus pa nyid ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sems ni rgyu du mas byas pa'i phan pa 'dzin ba nyid kyis skye ba'i phyir dang / 'dus pa nyid ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The reason is also not established, because the mind arises by virtue of its holding the help that is produced by many causes, and because the collection itself is imagined.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus ba'i dka' 'grel las ser skya bas kun du brtags pa'i bdag brtag pa ste dgu ba'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus ba'i dka' 'grel las ser skya bas kun du brtags pa'i bdag brtag pa ste dgu ba'o /
translated: This concludes the examination of the self imagined by Kapila, the ninth chapter of the treatise Discerning the Middle Way from the Middle Way.

original: // / nam mkha'i gos can gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag dgag pa'i don du /üîΩrgyal dpog pa bzhin rgyal ba pa //
analyzed: // / nam mkha'i gos can gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag dgag pa'i don du / rgyal dpog pa bzhin rgyal ba pa //
translated: To refute the imagined self of the sky-clad,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúLike the Jaina, the Vaisnava,üîΩthe Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka, and the LokƒÅyata,üîΩthe sky-clad are also refuted.‚Äù

original: rgyal ba pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i gos can dag go //
analyzed: rgyal ba pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i gos can dag go //
translated: The ‚ÄúVaisnava‚Äù are the sky-clad.

original: de dag ni 'di skad du bdag ni sems kyi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du bdag ni sems kyi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúThe self is only the characteristic of mind.

original: de yang rdzas kyi ngo bos gnas skabs tha dad la gnas skabs can tha mi dad pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang rdzas kyi ngo bos gnas skabs tha dad la gnas skabs can tha mi dad pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, since it is a substance, it is an identity that is uniform in different states, and it is an identity that is not different in different states.

original: rnam grangs kyi ngo bos ni gnas skabs re re la tha dad pa'i phyir log pa'i bdag nyid yin par smra'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi ngo bos ni gnas skabs re re la tha dad pa'i phyir log pa'i bdag nyid yin par smra'o //
translated: By way of its nominal identity, it is an identity that is different in each state.‚Äù

original: bdag gi tshul gnyis po 'di yang mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul gnyis po 'di yang mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: Since these two modes of the self are established by direct perception, they are not established by other valid cognitions.

original: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad kyang gnas skabs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'i sems pa can gnas skabs thams cad la dmigs pa de ni rdzas yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad kyang gnas skabs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'i sems pa can gnas skabs thams cad la dmigs pa de ni rdzas yin no //
translated: Thus, although the states of pleasure, etc., are different, the self that is the nature of the states, which is the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù is a substance.

original: rnam grangs ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dang ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam grangs ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dang ba rnams so //
translated: The synonyms are the different states of pleasure, etc., which occur in sequence.

original: de dag kyang mngon sum gyis grub po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mngon sum gyis grub po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs opinion is that these are established by direct perception.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di la phyogs gnyis te /üîΩsems pa can gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa'i rdzas te /
analyzed: 'di la phyogs gnyis te / sems pa can gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa'i rdzas te /
translated: There are two positions:üîΩThe substance that is the nature of the self is related to the synonyms,

original: rnam grangs dag dang 'brel pa na res 'ga' 'gyur ba med @217a * //üîΩba ste / sngar yod pa mdor ba'i sems pa can la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel ba yin nam /
analyzed: rnam grangs dag dang 'brel pa na res 'ga' 'gyur ba med @217a * // ba ste / sngar yod pa mdor ba'i sems pa can la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel ba yin nam /
translated: sometimes it is unchanging,üîΩand sometimes it is changing.üîΩIs the self related to its own nature, which existed previously and is now contracted?

original: sngar gyi ngo bo dor ba dang 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: sngar gyi ngo bo dor ba dang 'brel pa yin /
translated: Or is it related to the abandonment of its previous nature?

original: de la gal te phyogs phyi ma yin na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs phyi ma yin na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the latter, then it follows that it would be impermanent,

original: gnas skabs can 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gnas skabs can 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it would not be anything that endures.

original: / ci ste mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag de la khyab par te /
analyzed: / ci ste mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag de la khyab par te /
translated: But if the first position is maintained, that its nature is unchanging, then the earlier and later states would pervade it,

original: gzhan nyid du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they would exist as different.

original: sems pa nges yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'gyur zhes mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: sems pa nges yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'gyur zhes mi 'thob ste /
translated: It is not possible to say that consciousness does not change,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because change is defined as becoming different.

original: yongs su 'gyur bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: It is maintained that there is change.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs su khyad par med pa de ni yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'gyur te nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs su khyad par med pa de ni yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'gyur te nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: The argument is this: That which is not different in the earlier and later states does not change, like space.

original: sems pa can gang gnas skabs thams cad du khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o//
analyzed: sems pa can gang gnas skabs thams cad du khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o//
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe sentient being is not differentiated in any situation‚Äù is a non-observation of a p.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dag / ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dag / ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúin terms of place, time, and nature‚Äù is a response to the doubt that the reason in the opponent‚Äôs system is not established.

original: 'di ltar gal te gcig tu rnam grangs dag las rdzas tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gcig tu rnam grangs dag las rdzas tha dad pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if the enumerations are substantially different from the one,

original: de'i tshe khyad par med par 'gyur na ji srid du yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gcig tu 'dod la /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyad par med par 'gyur na ji srid du yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gcig tu 'dod la /
translated: then they would be differentiated. But as long as they are not differentiated in terms of place, time, and nature, they are asserted to be one in substance and enumeration.

original: grangs la sogs pa'i bye brag ni tha dad de /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa'i bye brag ni tha dad de /
translated: The distinctions of number and so on are different.

original: de la grangs ni gcig dang mang po nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la grangs ni gcig dang mang po nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus number is such things as one and many.

original: 'di ltar rdzas ni grangs gcig dang ldan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas ni grangs gcig dang ldan la /
translated: Thus substance possesses the number one.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni grangs du ma'i khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni grangs du ma'i khyad par can yin no //
translated: Such things as pleasure possess the number many.

original: mtshan nyid kyang tha dad pa yin te ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang tha dad pa yin te ;
translated: The characteristics are also different.

original: 'di ltar rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ni rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ni rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of substance is the common property,

original: rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid ni ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid ni ldog pa yin no //
translated: and the characteristic of enumeration is the specific property.

original: ming ni ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni ming du btags pa'o //
translated: Name is the nominal designation.

original: don ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: don ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The object is the effect.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos dang chos can tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos dang chos can tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: The property and the possessor of the property are not different, because of non-difference of place, time, and nature.

original: grangs dang / ming dang mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir na tha dad de /
analyzed: grangs dang / ming dang mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir na tha dad de /
translated: They are different, because of difference of number, name, characteristic, and effect.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams bum pa lta bu'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams bum pa lta bu'o zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said that form, etc. are like a pot.

original: 'di ltar bum pa las gzugs la sogs pa de dag yul la sogs pa dag gis tha mi dad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa las gzugs la sogs pa de dag yul la sogs pa dag gis tha mi dad de /
translated: Thus, form, etc. are not different from a pot by way of place, etc.

original: bum pa'i yul dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gzugs la @217b sogs pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i yul dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gzugs la @217b sogs pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The place and nature of a pot are just those of form, etc.

original: grangs la sogs pa dag gis ni bum pa la sogs pa las de dag tha dad ba yin te /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa dag gis ni bum pa la sogs pa las de dag tha dad ba yin te /
translated: But they are different from a pot, etc. by way of number, etc.

original: 'di ltar bum ba ni gcig yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum ba ni gcig yin la /
translated: Thus, a pot is one,

original: gzugs la sogs ba ni mang po yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ba ni mang po yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs tha dad pa'o //
translated: but form and so on are many. This is different in number.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ni rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ni rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The substance of a pot and so on is characterized by inclusion,

original: gzugs la sogs ba'i rnam grangs ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ba'i rnam grangs ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o //
translated: but the enumeration of form and so on is characterized by exclusion. This is different in characteristic.

original: bum pas chu len pa'i bya ba byed la /
analyzed: bum pas chu len pa'i bya ba byed la /
translated: A pot performs the function of holding water,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni gos dmar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tha dad ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni gos dmar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tha dad ba'o //
translated: but form and so on are red cloth and so on. This is different in effect.

original: de bzhin du sems pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag gi rdzas dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs ba rnam grangs dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag gi rdzas dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs ba rnam grangs dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the substance of the self that has a mind, and to the enumeration of pleasure, pain, and so on.

original: 'bras bu tha dad ba ni 'di ltar rtogs bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad ba ni 'di ltar rtogs bar bya ste /
translated: Different effects should be understood in the following way.

original: sems ba can gyis ni don nyams su myong bar byed la /
analyzed: sems ba can gyis ni don nyams su myong bar byed la /
translated: That which has a mind experiences objects,üîΩbut form and so on do not. This is different in effect.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni phan ba dang gnod pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni phan ba dang gnod pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Benefit and harm are pleasure, etc.

original: de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of that is:

original: gzugs sogs bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs sogs bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe pot, etc. are form, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe difference is in number and name.

original: grangs dang ming ni tha dad nyid //üîΩces bya ba ni rdzas dang rnam grangs dag ces 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel zhing /
analyzed: grangs dang ming ni tha dad nyid // ces bya ba ni rdzas dang rnam grangs dag ces 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel zhing /
translated: The difference is in substance and enumeration, as will be explained.üîΩThe difference is in the effect, in following and in stopping.üîΩThe difference is in the characteristic.

original: 'bras bu rjes 'jug ldog pa dag / mtshan nyid don gyi tha dad nyid //üîΩces bya ba ni ci rigs su sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rjes 'jug ldog pa dag / mtshan nyid don gyi tha dad nyid // ces bya ba ni ci rigs su sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The difference in the effect, the difference in the object, and the difference in following and stopping are the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.

original: 'bras bu'i tha dad pa ste don gyi tha dad pa nyid dang / rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog ba dag ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩrdza dang rnam grags dag ces bya ba 'dir bcad do //üîΩde ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tha dad pa ste don gyi tha dad pa nyid dang / rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog ba dag ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o // rdza dang rnam grags dag ces bya ba 'dir bcad do // de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: The difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.

original: de ltar byas na rdzas ni gcig tu khyad par med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar byas na rdzas ni gcig tu khyad par med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The difference in substance and enumeration is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in the effect is the difference in the object.üîΩThe difference in following and stopping is the difference in the characteristic.üîΩThe difference

original: 'on kyang rnam grangs kyi ngo bo tha dad pas khyad par du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam grangs kyi ngo bo tha dad pas khyad par du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: However, they are distinguished by having different enumerations.

original: des na rnam grangs dag las rdzas gcig tu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin na //
analyzed: des na rnam grangs dag las rdzas gcig tu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin na //
translated: Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause they are not different in substance from the enumerations‚Äù is not established.
