original: rang bzhin dbyer med ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin dbyer med ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: The response is given by ‚ÄúTheir natures are inseparable‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te rdzas dang rnam grangs dag tha mi dad par khas len par byed na de'i tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis tha mi dad pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te rdzas dang rnam grangs dag tha mi dad par khas len par byed na de'i tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis tha mi dad pa yin du chug mod /
translated: If you accept that substances and enumerations are not different, then they must be inseparable in all ways.

original: de las bzlog pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could they be different in the opposite way?

original: gcig la gcig gi cho sgrub pa dang dgag pa phan tshun 'gal ba regs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig gi cho sgrub pa dang dgag pa phan tshun 'gal ba regs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable for mutually exclusive affirmations and denials to apply to one thing.

original: 'di ltar gcig ces bya ba 'dis tha dad pa bkag pa med na mi 'byung ba'i rang bzhin tha dad pa brjod @218a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig ces bya ba 'dis tha dad pa bkag pa med na mi 'byung ba'i rang bzhin tha dad pa brjod @218a * //
translated: In this way, if the term ‚Äúone‚Äù does not exclude difference, it expresses a nature that is not inseparable from difference.

original: do ; / rang bzhin tha mi dad pa de yin na de nyid kyi tshe ji ltar de bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: do ; / rang bzhin tha mi dad pa de yin na de nyid kyi tshe ji ltar de bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: If they are not intrinsically different, then at that time how could they be different in the sense of being mutually exclusive?

original: sbyor ba ni gang la tha dad pa med pa de la /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la tha dad pa med pa de la /
translated: The argument is as follows: If two things are not different,

original: de las bzlog pa'i tha dad pa'i go skabs rnyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i tha dad pa'i go skabs rnyed pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is impossible for them to be mutually exclusive.

original: dper na rnam grangs de dag nyid dang / so sor nges pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'i rdzas gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam grangs de dag nyid dang / so sor nges pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'i rdzas gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the substance that is the individual, intrinsic identity of the enumerated things is not different from the nature of those enumerated things.üîΩAnd the classification of substance and enumeration is also not different.

original: rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas dang rnam grangs dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory attribute that is inconsistent with the way things are.

original: de lta yin dang don dam par rdzas dang rnam grangs dag tha mi dad na mtshan nyid tha dad par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang don dam par rdzas dang rnam grangs dag tha mi dad na mtshan nyid tha dad par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If that were the case, then if ultimately substance and enumeration are not different, then they would also not have different characteristics.

original: de ltar rdzas dang rnam grangs dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar rdzas dang rnam grangs dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the same way, substance and the enumerated are .

original: gang ldog pa'i ngo bo dang tha dad pa'i rang bzhin de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang ldog pa'i ngo bo dang tha dad pa'i rang bzhin de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: That which is not different from the nature of the excluded is endowed with the excluded,

original: rnam grangs dag gi rang bzhin bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs dag gi rang bzhin bzhin no //
translated: like the nature of the enumerated.

original: rdzas kyang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rdzas kyang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And substance is not different from the nature of that which is endowed with the excluded. This is a natural inference.

original: yang na gang zhig rjes su 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa de ni rjes su 'jug pa'i bdag nyid yin te rdzas kyi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gang zhig rjes su 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa de ni rjes su 'jug pa'i bdag nyid yin te rdzas kyi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: Or, that which is not different from the nature of the entity that is the nature of the included is the nature of the included, like the nature of substance.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnam grangs rnams kyang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnam grangs rnams kyang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na'o //
translated: And the enumerated, such as pleasure, are not different from the nature of the entity that is the nature of the included. This is a natural inference.

original: de lta ma yin na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then pleasure and so on would be different from substance.

original: tha dad pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not be different at all.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig yin na tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig yin na tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: And if something has the property of being contradictory, and is also one, then the convention of non-difference would be destroyed. This is the authoritative refutation of the opposite.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: In the passage beginning ‚ÄúTherefore . . . ,‚Äù he concludes.

original: bdag la sogs pa kho nar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras bum pa dang 'bru la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa kho nar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras bum pa dang 'bru la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúonly in terms of self . . . ‚Äù and so on refer to such things as pots and grains.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba bsgrub pa'i gnyis pa'i 'bras bu 'chad de /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba bsgrub pa'i gnyis pa'i 'bras bu 'chad de /
translated: In the passage beginning ‚Äúarising and destruction . . . ,‚Äù he explains the second consequence of the proof.

original: rdzas de yang rnam grangs kyi ngo bos skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas de yang rnam grangs kyi ngo bos skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that substance is asserted to have the nature of being enumerated as having arising and destruction.

original: de'i phyir thal bar bsgrub pa bsgrub bya ma tshang bar 'gyur du dogs pas nges pa'i bdag nyid bzhin zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir thal bar bsgrub pa bsgrub bya ma tshang bar 'gyur du dogs pas nges pa'i bdag nyid bzhin zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, fearing that the proof of the consequence would be incomplete, he says, ‚Äúlike the nature of a definite . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThis is definite,

original: 'di ni nges pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa yang yin la /
translated: and it is a nature.

original: rdzas la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag ste rang bzhin yang yin no zhes khyad par bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag ste rang bzhin yang yin no zhes khyad par bsdu ba'o //
translated: The self is the essence of substance, etc., and is also the intrinsic reality.üîΩTherefore, the summary statement is:

original: de'i phyir rjes 'gro med 'jig pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes 'gro med 'jig pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no concomitance with it.‚ÄùüîΩThe summary statement is:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug @218b sdud par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug @218b sdud par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no concomitance with it.‚Äù

original: rnam grangs las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir rdzas kyi ngo bo'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam grangs las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir rdzas kyi ngo bo'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the self not established as having the nature of concomitance with the essence of substance, etc.,

original: 'di las kyang ste rnam grangs las tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrnam grangs rjes 'gro'i bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: 'di las kyang ste rnam grangs las tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / rnam grangs rjes 'gro'i bdag nyid kyi //
translated: but also because of the non-apprehension of that which is characterized by the apprehension of that which is distinct from the synonyms, it is the object of the expression ‚Äúnon-existent.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe self is the intrinsic reality of the concomitance with the synonyms.‚Äù

original: des na rjes su 'jug pa'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid mngon sum nyid kyis grub po zhes gang smras pa de ma grub ste /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'jug pa'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid mngon sum nyid kyis grub po zhes gang smras pa de ma grub ste /
translated: Thus, the statement ‚ÄúThe self is established by direct perception as having the nature of the substance that is concomitant with it‚Äù is not established.

original: mngon sum du 'dod pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig la rnam grangs las tha dad pa'i lus so sor snang ba rjes su 'jug pa ro gcig pa'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid ni snang bar mi mngon no //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'dod pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig la rnam grangs las tha dad pa'i lus so sor snang ba rjes su 'jug pa ro gcig pa'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid ni snang bar mi mngon no //
translated: In some cognitions that are accepted as direct perception, the substance that is the single essence of the body that appears separately from the enumeration is not evident.

original: gal te de lta yin na gang gi tshe rnam grangs las tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad pa ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na gang gi tshe rnam grangs las tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad pa ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: If that is so, then when the substance that is separate from the enumeration does not exist, at that time how is the difference of the enumeration and so on established?

original: rnam pa sna tshogs don byed rung //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs don byed rung // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The various aspects are able to perform a function.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam grangs rnams ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs pa du ma'i rnam pa'i don byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam grangs rnams ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs pa du ma'i rnam pa'i don byed pa yin no //
translated: The various enumerations such as form and so on are many aspects that perform a function that is both common and uncommon.

original: de la thun mong ba ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la thun mong ba ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Among them, the common is the characteristic of holding water and so on.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni gos kha bsgyur ba dang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni gos kha bsgyur ba dang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The uncommon is the characteristic that produces the consciousness of the dyed cloth and the eye, etc.üîΩThe suitable is the capacity.

original: der rung ba ni nus pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩde la thams cad cig car thun mong ba'i 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir thams cad rgyu nyid du shes par bya'i don du tha mi dad pa'i rdzas kyi ngo bo med na yang tha dad pa de dag nyid bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: der rung ba ni nus pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // de la thams cad cig car thun mong ba'i 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir thams cad rgyu nyid du shes par bya'i don du tha mi dad pa'i rdzas kyi ngo bo med na yang tha dad pa de dag nyid bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: The words are to be connected in this way.

original: pa'i sgras grangs gcig gi khyad par brjod do //
analyzed: pa'i sgras grangs gcig gi khyad par brjod do //
translated: There, in order to know that all are causes, because they are all applied to the effect of the cloth, even though there is no substance that is undifferentiated, those that are different are expressed by the word ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù etc., as having the distinction of a single number.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu nye bar sbyor ba nyid brjod par 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu nye bar sbyor ba nyid brjod par 'dod pa la ni /
translated: For the one who wishes to express the application to the uncommon effect,

original: grangs sna tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: grangs sna tshogs pa ni /
translated: the various numbers

original: de dag la grangs tha dad pa dang 'bras bu tha dad pa yang gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la grangs tha dad pa dang 'bras bu tha dad pa yang gzhag par bya'o //
translated: are to be posited as having different numbers and different effects.

original: 'o na ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well, how is there a difference in characteristics?

original: mtshungs sogs shes bya'i rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: mtshungs sogs shes bya'i rgyur gyur pa //
translated: The cause of the object of knowledge, such as the similar, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrjen pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu skad cig re rer 'jig na yang dbyibs kyi khyad par 'dra ba nyid du skye ba na rtog pa med pas nyams su myong ba'i yul nyams su myong nas gnas skabs thams cad du bum pa zhes
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / rjen pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu skad cig re rer 'jig na yang dbyibs kyi khyad par 'dra ba nyid du skye ba na rtog pa med pas nyams su myong ba'i yul nyams su myong nas gnas skabs thams cad du bum pa zhes
translated: He says:üîΩEven though it is destroyed in each instant in the states of raw, cooked, etc., when it arises with a similar aspect of shape, it is the cause of the cognition of similarity, since it is not cognized.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dra ba'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //üîΩljang gu dang dmar po la sogs pa'i @219a * //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dra ba'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no // ljang gu dang dmar po la sogs pa'i @219a * //
translated: Having experienced the object of experience, it is the cause of the cognition of similarity, such as pot, in all states.üîΩWhen it arises with an dissimilar color, such as green, red, etc., it is the cause of dissimilar cognition.

original: kha dog mi mthun par skye ba na mi 'dra ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de lta na ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med na yang mtshungs pa dang / mi mtshungs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog mi mthun par skye ba na mi 'dra ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de lta na ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med na yang mtshungs pa dang / mi mtshungs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though there is no single entity that persists, there is a cause of similarity and dissimilarity.

original: rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul du rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul du rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is posited in the manner of engagement and disengagement. It is posited as having a different characteristic.

original: mtshungs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'dra ba'i shes pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: mtshungs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'dra ba'i shes pa gzung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same, etc.‚Äù refers to the apprehension of dissimilar cognitions.

original: 'o na ci ltar ming tha dad ce na /üîΩrnam pa de lta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar ming tha dad ce na / rnam pa de lta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If that is so, then how are the names different?üîΩThe response is ‚ÄúThe name is given to the object, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam pa de lta'i ste /üîΩrnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don byed par rung ba 'dra ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po bum pa zhes bya ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i brda gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta'i ste / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don byed par rung ba 'dra ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po bum pa zhes bya ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i brda gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The name is given to the object, etc.üîΩThe name is given to the object that is the cause of the cognition of the object that is suitable to perform a function in that way, i.e., in a variety of ways, such as the object called ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc., and the object called ‚Äúpot,‚Äù etc., to which the convention ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc., is applied.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i don gang la sgra dang shes pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i don gang la sgra dang shes pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The name is given to the object to which the word and the cognition are applied.

original: de dag gi spyod yul zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi spyod yul zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe domain of those‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: des na dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa mngon sum nyid kyis grub po zhes mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
analyzed: des na dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa mngon sum nyid kyis grub po zhes mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, the nonexistence of the self of phenomena is established by direct perception.

original: skye dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The summary is stated in ‚Äúarising and destruction,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam grangs dag ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs dag ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin terms of their categories‚Äù refers to the categories of form, etc., and to the categories of suffering, etc., which are of the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rdzas gcig gi ngo bo dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rdzas gcig gi ngo bo dang bral ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin and of themselves‚Äù means that they are devoid of the nature of a single substance that is not differentiated.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is contradictory for something that is permanent to function in relation to an object either gradually or instantaneously.

original: 'di dag skye ba dang mi skye ba'i chos can nyid yin /
analyzed: 'di dag skye ba dang mi skye ba'i chos can nyid yin /
translated: These are the characteristics of that which is produced and that which is not produced.

original: don bya ba byed pa nyid rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa nyid rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable to maintain that they function to accomplish a purpose.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa'i rtags las bdag med par rjes su dpag pa las kyang grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa'i rtags las bdag med par rjes su dpag pa las kyang grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is also established by inference that the self does not exist because of the evidence of its activity.

original: gang yang rdzas ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid snang ba med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rdzas ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid snang ba med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúThe substance is not perceived because it does not appear‚Äù is a statement of the opponent‚Äôs position. The response to this statement begins with the words ‚ÄúIf you think that the substance is not perceived because it does not appear.‚Äù

original: 'dres pa ni gcig gi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni gcig gi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúmixed‚Äù means that the substance is of the nature of a single entity.

original: de'i phyir rdzas kyi ngo bo yod du zin kyang rnam par phye na mi snang ngo snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas kyi ngo bo yod du zin kyang rnam par phye na mi snang ngo snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, even if the entity of substance exists, when it is analyzed, it does not appear.

original: 'dres pa nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni de'i phyir tshul gnyis cha med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni de'i phyir tshul gnyis cha med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the cause of the mixture is ‚Äúbecause it is devoid of the two modes.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir te bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po gang gi phyir tshul gnyis pa yin na yang mi'i seng ge bzhin du cha med par 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir te bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po gang gi phyir tshul gnyis pa yin na yang mi'i seng ge bzhin du cha med par 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, because any entity such as the self is twofold, it is asserted to be devoid of parts, like the lion of men.

original: de lta bas na cha med pa'i phyir de ni 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na cha med pa'i phyir de ni 'dres pa ste /
translated: Thus, because it is devoid of parts, it is a mixture.

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu mi dmigs so//
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu mi dmigs so//
translated: Because it is the entity of both, it is not observed separately.

original: @219b de 'di ni khyed kyis phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'on te tshul gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @219b de 'di ni khyed kyis phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / 'on te tshul gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is a contradiction, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúBut if it is devoid of the two modes.‚Äù

original: gal te cha med pa yin na de'i tshe tshul gnyis zhes bya ba 'di 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te cha med pa yin na de'i tshe tshul gnyis zhes bya ba 'di 'gal ba yin te /
translated: If it is devoid of parts, then it is contradictory to say ‚Äúthe two modes.‚Äù

original: tha snyad 'di ni don sna tshogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad 'di ni don sna tshogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this term has various meanings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul gyi sgras rang bzhin rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul gyi sgras rang bzhin rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúmode‚Äù expresses a nature.

original: 'di ltar tshul gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul gnyis te /
translated: There are two modes,

original: rang bzhin gnyis la yod pa de ni tshul gnyis kyi ngo bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis la yod pa de ni tshul gnyis kyi ngo bo zhes bya'o //
translated: and that which exists in two natures is called ‚Äúthe nature of two modes.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gcig la gnyis rigs pa ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig la gnyis rigs pa ma yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not logical for two to exist in one nature,

original: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault of the loss of oneness would follow.

original: khyed kyis rang bzhin gnyis bstan pa kho nar zad kyi /
analyzed: khyed kyis rang bzhin gnyis bstan pa kho nar zad kyi /
translated: You have merely taught two natures,

original: dngos po gcig la tshul gnyis yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la tshul gnyis yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: but there is not a single entity that has two modes,

original: gcig dang du ma nyid dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang yang mi'i seng ge de yang gcig pur te tshul gnyis su mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma nyid dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gang yang mi'i seng ge de yang gcig pur te tshul gnyis su mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: because oneness and plurality are characteristics that are mutually exclusive.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that the human lion also is not established as one or two, it is said:

original: mi'i seng ge yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi'i seng ge yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The human lion, etc.

original: yang gi sgras ni rtsod pa'i rgyu gzhir gyur pa mi 'thad ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni rtsod pa'i rgyu gzhir gyur pa mi 'thad ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the cause of the dispute is not only the non-establishment of the object.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mi'i seng ge'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mi'i seng ge'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the Lion of Men.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yan lag sna tshogs kyis ches rgya che ba'i yul gnod pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yan lag sna tshogs kyis ches rgya che ba'i yul gnod pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù means that the object is very extensive with various parts, and has the nature of being harmed.

original: gzhan du na de ltar snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na de ltar snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would not appear thus,

original: sbrang bu'i rkang rjes tsam gyis bsgribs na yang de'i rnam pa de lta bus bsgribs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbrang bu'i rkang rjes tsam gyis bsgribs na yang de'i rnam pa de lta bus bsgribs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it were obscured by something as small as the footprint of a bee, it would follow that it would be obscured in that way.

original: 'dis ni nor bu gzi'i kha dog sna tshogs pa la sogs pa yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni nor bu gzi'i kha dog sna tshogs pa la sogs pa yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the various colors of the peacock‚Äôs tail and so on.

original: 'di yang rgyas par yan lag can dgag par ston par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang rgyas par yan lag can dgag par ston par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: I think that this will be taught extensively in the refutation of the possessor of the parts.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las nam mkha'i gos can kyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag brtag pa ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las nam mkha'i gos can kyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag brtag pa ste bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the tenth chapter of the Commentary on the Compendium of Reality, the analysis of the imagined self of the sky-clad.

original: // / gzhan gnyis med par lta ba la dmigs pa'i gsang ba pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo shes pa rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin du rtog par byed de /
analyzed: // / gzhan gnyis med par lta ba la dmigs pa'i gsang ba pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo shes pa rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin du rtog par byed de /
translated: The Vedantins, who focus on the view of the nonexistence of the other two, imagine that consciousness, the nature of which is the transformation of earth and so on, is permanent and has the nature of being a single entity.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach their texts,üîΩthe root text says:

original: sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Earth and so on are consciousness.

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba nas la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo rtag pa dang / gcig pu'i shes pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba nas la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo rtag pa dang / gcig pu'i shes pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving that nature‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the nature of permanent, single consciousness that is the transformation of earth and so on.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gsang ba par smra ba dag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gsang ba par smra ba dag go //
translated: Others say that the VedƒÅntins

original: 'di'i tshad ma gang yin zhe na /üîΩgzung @220a * //
analyzed: 'di'i tshad ma gang yin zhe na / gzung @220a * //
translated: say that the valid knowledge of that is

original: ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the characteristics of the apprehended.

original: gang gis de dag snang bar 'gyur ba sa la sogs pa shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de dag snang bar 'gyur ba sa la sogs pa shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The characteristics of the apprehended that are other than consciousness do not exist.

original: yan lag can dang rdul phra rab rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag can dang rdul phra rab rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the whole and the subtle atoms do not exist.

original: de lta bas na shugs kyis sa la sogs pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo kho na yin no zhes nges par byed de /
analyzed: de lta bas na shugs kyis sa la sogs pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo kho na yin no zhes nges par byed de /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that these earth, etc., are just the nature of appearance in consciousness.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: These means earth, etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do /
translated: He replies to that with ‚Äúthose, etc.‚Äù

original: nyes pa chung ldan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes pa chung ldan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having a small fault means

original: shes pa tsam rigs pa dang ldan pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa tsam rigs pa dang ldan pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it is reasonable to accept mere consciousness.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir de la nyes pa chung du yang brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir de la nyes pa chung du yang brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, why is a small fault stated in regard to that?

original: rtag ba nyid brjod phyir zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: rtag ba nyid brjod phyir zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause permanence is stated.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir rtag pa nyid du khas blangs ba mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rtag pa nyid du khas blangs ba mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why is it unreasonable to accept permanence?

original: gzugs sgra la sogs zhes bya ba //
analyzed: gzugs sgra la sogs zhes bya ba //
translated: He says, ‚Äúform, sound, etc.‚Äù

original: la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúEtc.‚Äù means, etc.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas skabs la brjod la /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas skabs la brjod la /
translated: Permanence is stated in regard to that.

original: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa nyid do //üîΩrnam par shes pa'i gnas skabs gcig thams cad nyid du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa snang bar nyams su myong ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang rim gyis res 'ga' gzugs snang la /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa nyid do // rnam par shes pa'i gnas skabs gcig thams cad nyid du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa snang bar nyams su myong ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang rim gyis res 'ga' gzugs snang la /
translated: Impermanence is not the state of consciousness.

original: yang gzhan gyi tshe sgra la sogs pa snang ngo //
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi tshe sgra la sogs pa snang ngo //
translated: And it is not the case that the state of consciousness of all forms, sounds, and so on is experienced at the same time; rather, sometimes form appears gradually, and at another time sound and so on.

original: de'i phyir gal te sgra la sogs pa 'di dag rtag pa dang gcig pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i bdag nyid du gyur na de'i tshe gos khra bo snang ba bzhin du cig car snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te sgra la sogs pa 'di dag rtag pa dang gcig pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i bdag nyid du gyur na de'i tshe gos khra bo snang ba bzhin du cig car snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if these sounds and so on appear in a permanent and singular consciousness, then they would appear simultaneously, like the appearance of a multicolored cloth,

original: de snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the consciousness that is their appearance would always be present.

original: ci ste yang rim gyis sgra la sogs pa snang ba'i shes pa skye ba ni gnas skabs gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang rim gyis sgra la sogs pa snang ba'i shes pa skye ba ni gnas skabs gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: But if the arising of the consciousness that is the appearance of sound and so on is a different state,

original: des na cig car sgra la sogs pa rig par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: des na cig car sgra la sogs pa rig par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: then sound and so on would not be known simultaneously.

original: rtag na gnas skabs gzhan yang med //
analyzed: rtag na gnas skabs gzhan yang med //
translated: If it is permanent, it is not a different state.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: gnas skabs dag ni gnas skabs can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩgnas skabs bzhin du gnas skabs can yang skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gnas skabs dag ni gnas skabs can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir / gnas skabs bzhin du gnas skabs can yang skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because the states are not different from that which possesses the states,üîΩlike the states, that which possesses the states would also originate and be destroyed,

original: gnas skabs can bzhin du gnas skabs rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs can bzhin du gnas skabs rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or like that which possesses the states, the states would also be permanent.

original: gnas skabs rnams tha dad pa yin na yang 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs rnams tha dad pa yin na yang 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if the states are different, the relation of this to that is not established,

original: phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir dang rtag pa dang gcig pu'i shes pa tsam khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir dang rtag pa dang gcig pu'i shes pa tsam khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no benefit and because it contradicts the assertion that consciousness is merely permanent and singular.

original: gzhan yang shes pa'i bdag nyid rtag pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa'i bdag nyid rtag pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'am /
translated: Moreover, is the permanent nature of consciousness established by direct perception or is it proven by inference?üîΩFirst, it is not by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas sgrub par 'gyur grang re zhig mngon sum @220b gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas sgrub par 'gyur grang re zhig mngon sum @220b gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: gzugs la sogs pa rigs las shes //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rigs las shes //
translated: Consciousness arises from the elements of form and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: gang gis mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur ba rim gyis snang ba'i gzugs la sogs pa rigs pa las ma gtogs pa'i rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba ni med de /
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur ba rim gyis snang ba'i gzugs la sogs pa rigs pa las ma gtogs pa'i rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba ni med de /
translated: The consciousness that is the basis of the state of permanence and singularity, which is not included in reasoning, is not experienced in the gradual appearance of form and so on that is established by direct perception.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rigs pa de yang rim gyis nyams su myong bas skad cig re rer 'jig par grub na tha mi dad pa gzhan ci zhig yod ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rigs pa de yang rim gyis nyams su myong bas skad cig re rer 'jig par grub na tha mi dad pa gzhan ci zhig yod ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: And that reasoning of form and so on is established to disintegrate at every moment by the experience of gradualness. What else, which is not different from that, could there be?

original: de lta bas na rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, because the object that has the character of being observed as the nature of such a consciousness is not observed, it is thought that it is the object of the convention of nonexistence.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang mi grub po snyam ste /üîΩ'di ltar rjes su dpag pa yin na rang bzhin gyi rtags sam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang mi grub po snyam ste / 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa yin na rang bzhin gyi rtags sam /
translated: It is thought that it is not established by inference either.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags yin grang /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags yin grang /
translated: In that case, if it is an inference, is it a reason of nature or a reason of effect?

original: re zhig rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not a reason of nature.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pas de'i rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pas de'i rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since no such subject exists, its nature is not established.

original: chos can shes pa tsam grub na yang de la rtag pa nyid kyi bsgrub bya'i chos kyis 'ga' la yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can shes pa tsam grub na yang de la rtag pa nyid kyi bsgrub bya'i chos kyis 'ga' la yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the mere existence of the subject, consciousness, were established, the probandum, permanence, would not be established as being pervaded by it.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a reason of effect.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir dang / de las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir dang / de las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that a permanent thing functions sequentially or instantaneously, because it has no effect, and because we do not accept any other effect that is different from it.

original: des na de lta yin na de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na de lta yin na de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, if it were like that, there would be no valid cognition establishing such a consciousness.

original: gnod par byed pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa yod pas shes pa rtag pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin par mi rigs so ;
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa yod pas shes pa rtag pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin par mi rigs so ;
translated: Since there is direct perception and so on that contradicts it, it is not tenable that consciousness is permanent.

original: / gzhan yang phyogs 'di la bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: / gzhan yang phyogs 'di la bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, it shows that in this system, the presentation of bondage and liberation is not possible.

original: phyin ci log dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩgang gis skad cig re rer 'jig cing skyes bu so so'i shes pa du ma rgyud tha dad pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de'i phyogs la phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyun skye ba'i dbang gis bcings pa dang thar pa'i
analyzed: phyin ci log dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gang gis skad cig re rer 'jig cing skyes bu so so'i shes pa du ma rgyud tha dad pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de'i phyogs la phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyun skye ba'i dbang gis bcings pa dang thar pa'i
translated: [This is shown by the lines beginning with] ‚ÄúAnd how could there be bondage and liberation . . .‚Äù

original: rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: In the system of those who say that the person is momentary and that many different cognitions arise in the continuum of the person, it is not reasonable to present bondage and liberation in terms of the arising of a continuum of erroneous and nonerroneous cognitions.

original: rnam 'byor goms pa'i rims gyis kyang yongs su dag pa'i shes pa gong nas gong du skye ba'i phyir yongs su ma dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyun log pa las byang grol thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir thar pa thob par bya @221a * //
analyzed: rnam 'byor goms pa'i rims gyis kyang yongs su dag pa'i shes pa gong nas gong du skye ba'i phyir yongs su ma dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyun log pa las byang grol thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir thar pa thob par bya @221a * //
translated: This is because, through the force of repeated practice of yoga, a completely pure cognition arises in an increasingly greater way, and liberation is attained through the cessation of the continuum of impure cognition.

original: ba'i don gyi phyir 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i don gyi phyir 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effort to attain liberation is fruitful.

original: gang yang khyed cag gis bdag rtag pa dang gcig pu'i shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba do'i phyogs de la ni ji ltar shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyi skyes bu la bcings pa dang thar par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang khyed cag gis bdag rtag pa dang gcig pu'i shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba do'i phyogs de la ni ji ltar shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyi skyes bu la bcings pa dang thar par 'gyur /
translated: Also, in regard to your position that there is a self that is the nature of permanent, unitary cognition, how could there be bondage and liberation for a person who is of the nature of a single cognition?

original: 'di ltar gal te shes pa rtag tu phyin ci log gi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe gnas skabs gzhan logs shig pa med pa'i phyir thar pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te shes pa rtag tu phyin ci log gi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe gnas skabs gzhan logs shig pa med pa'i phyir thar pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If cognition is always of the nature of error, then liberation cannot be posited because there is no other state.

original: ci ste yang phyin ci ma log pa yin pa de'i tshe rtag tu yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcings par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang phyin ci ma log pa yin pa de'i tshe rtag tu yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcings par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is nonerroneous, then it is always completely pure, so it cannot be bound.

original: kho bo cag la ni rgyun tha dad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / dag pa rnams rnam par rig par 'dod de de'i phyir bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni rgyun tha dad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / dag pa rnams rnam par rig par 'dod de de'i phyir bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: We assert that the afflicted and the pure are consciousnesses that are different continua, so it is not reasonable to posit bondage and liberation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / de ni drir bcas dri ma med //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / de ni drir bcas dri ma med //
translated: Defiled and pure, it is both fragrant and stainless.

original: gal te nyon mongs de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs de ma gyur //
translated: If it were not defiled,

original: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
translated: all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
translated: If it were not pure,

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu me dpar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu me dpar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: endeavors would be fruitless.

original: ci ste yang bcings pa dang thar pa ni btags pa kho na yin mod /
analyzed: ci ste yang bcings pa dang thar pa ni btags pa kho na yin mod /
translated: If you think that bondage and liberation are only designations,

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: and not ultimate,

original: de la btags pa la yang rgyu mtshan brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de la btags pa la yang rgyu mtshan brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: then you must state the reason for the designation.

original: shes pa mi rtag pa'i phyogs la ni rgyu mtshan bstan zin to //
analyzed: shes pa mi rtag pa'i phyogs la ni rgyu mtshan bstan zin to //
translated: The reason for the position that consciousness is impermanent has already been explained.

original: de lta yin dang khyed cag byang grol thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'khor ba las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid sgom pa'i 'bad pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu ngal ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyed cag byang grol thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'khor ba las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid sgom pa'i 'bad pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu ngal ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ston pa ni /
translated: If that were so, then any effort to meditate on reality in order to attain liberation and nirvana would be fruitless.

original: rnal 'byor goms pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor goms pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe yogi‚Äôs meditation‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid bsgoms pas cung zad cig zlog pa'am 'jug par byed pa de'i tshe 'di 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid bsgoms pas cung zad cig zlog pa'am 'jug par byed pa de'i tshe 'di 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur na /
translated: If the yogi‚Äôs meditation on reality causes the cessation or engagement of something, then his effort would be fruitful.

original: 'di ltar re zhig 'di phyin ci log par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig 'di phyin ci log par mi byed de /
translated: But this is not so, because this error is not fabricated.

original: gang gi phyir phyin ci log 'di de'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyin ci log 'di de'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Because this error is of the nature of that.

original: shes pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i phyir spang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: shes pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i phyir spang bar mi nus te /
translated: Since consciousness is of the nature of permanence, it cannot be eliminated.

original: rtag pa ni mi 'jig pa nyid kyis 'dor ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni mi 'jig pa nyid kyis 'dor ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to eliminate the permanent, since it does not disintegrate.

original: de kho na nyid kyi shes pa bsgoms pas sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi shes pa bsgoms pas sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it established by the yogi‚Äôs meditation on reality.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is of the nature of that.

original: shes pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de kho na nyid kyi shes pa thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de kho na nyid kyi shes pa thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since consciousness is of the nature of permanence, it endures at all times when there is knowledge of reality.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni rigs @221b pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni rigs @221b pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this is not reasonable.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las gsang ba ba'i bdag brtag pa ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las gsang ba ba'i bdag brtag pa ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eleventh chapter, on the secret self, in the commentary on the Verses on the Essence of the Middle Way.

original: // / gnas ma'i bu bas kun du brtags pa'i gang zag dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / gnas ma'i bu bas kun du brtags pa'i gang zag dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the imputation of a person by the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas,

original: la la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: la la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says ‚Äúsome‚Äù and so on.

original: la la zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu pa dag go //
analyzed: la la zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù refers to the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid bde bar gshegs pa'i sras su rlom na yang bdag gang thag gi thabs kyis phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid bde bar gshegs pa'i sras su rlom na yang bdag gang thag gi thabs kyis phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa rtogs par byed do //
translated: Although they boast of themselves as sons of the Sugata, they realize the self to be inexpressible as the same as or different from the aggregates by means of the method of the questioner.

original: gang dag bcom ldan 'das bdag med pa gsung ba'i bde bar gshegs pa'i sras nyid du khas len pa de dag ji ltar de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir bzhad gad du byed pa'i tshig
analyzed: gang dag bcom ldan 'das bdag med pa gsung ba'i bde bar gshegs pa'i sras nyid du khas len pa de dag ji ltar de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir bzhad gad du byed pa'i tshig
translated: In order to show that those who accept themselves to be sons of the Sugata, who taught the selflessness of the BhagavƒÅn, would not cling to the view of a self that is not reality, the text uses

original: gis ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gis ston par byed pa ni /
translated: derisive words.

original: bde bar gshegs pa par rlom yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa par rlom yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the self is the agent of good and bad actions, the experiencer of the results of the actions done by itself, and that which transmigrates and is liberated by abandoning the former aggregates and appropriating other aggregates.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las tha dad pa rnams kyi byed pa po dang / rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i za ba po dang / gang yang phung po snga ma yongs su dor nas phung po gzhan len pas 'khor ba pa dang grol ba gang yin pa de bdag yin no zhes pa 'di ni bdag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las tha dad pa rnams kyi byed pa po dang / rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i za ba po dang / gang yang phung po snga ma yongs su dor nas phung po gzhan len pas 'khor ba pa dang grol ba gang yin pa de bdag yin no zhes pa 'di ni bdag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of the self.

original: 'di thams cad kyang gang zag la 'dod pa'i phyir ming la rtsod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang gang zag la 'dod pa'i phyir ming la rtsod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But all of this is just a dispute about names, because it is asserted that the person exists.

original: ci ste yang gang zag pa brjod du med pa nyid la rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gang zag pa brjod du med pa nyid la rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If the person is inexpressible, what is the logic of that?

original: mu stegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mu stegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe tƒ´rthikas . . . .‚Äù

original: de ni gang zag phung po dag las tha dad pa yin na de ni mu stegs byed kyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gang zag phung po dag las tha dad pa yin na de ni mu stegs byed kyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the person is different from the aggregates, then the view of the self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas would be correct.

original: de lta yin dang bdag rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bdag rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that the self is permanent.

original: bdag rtag pa ni byed pa po dang zab po la sogs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa ni byed pa po dang zab po la sogs par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that a permanent self is an agent or an experiencer,

original: de ni nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad du khyab par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad du khyab par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not omnipresent, like space.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bdag rtag pa'i mtha' bkag pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'gal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bdag rtag pa'i mtha' bkag pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'gal lo //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also refutes the extreme of a permanent self and declares, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are selfless,‚Äù and that contradicts your position.

original: 'o na gzhan ma yin pa yin la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan ma yin pa yin la rag mod ce na /
translated: Well then, it is not different.

original: du ma sogs 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ma sogs 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The many and so on would follow.

original: gal te gang zag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gang zag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If the person were the aggregates of form and so on,

original: de'i tshe phung po mang po dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gang zag du ma nyid du 'gyur na gcig tu yang 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe phung po mang po dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gang zag du ma nyid du 'gyur na gcig tu yang 'dod de /
translated: then because it would not be different from the many aggregates, like the nature of the aggregates, the person would be many. But it is asserted to be one.

original: ji skad du 'jig rten skye ba na gang zag gcig skye ste /
analyzed: ji skad du 'jig rten skye ba na gang zag gcig skye ste /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúWhen the world is born, a single person is born.

original: @222a * // 'di lta ste dper na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @222a * // 'di lta ste dper na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the TathƒÅgata.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include impermanence and so on.

original: de lta yin dang gang zag kyang phung po bzhin du chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang zag kyang phung po bzhin du chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the person would be annihilated, just like the aggregates.

original: de lta bas na byas pa chud zos par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na byas pa chud zos par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that the person‚Äôs actions would perish.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chad pa smra pa dgag pa mdzad pas de'i phyir brjod du med pa'i gang zag yod do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chad pa smra pa dgag pa mdzad pas de'i phyir brjod du med pa'i gang zag yod do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also refutes the annihilationists. Therefore, it is established that the inexpressible person exists.üîΩIn response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúIf you say that the person is inexpressible in these ways, your own words show that the person does not exist as a thing.‚Äù

original: de dag la brjod ces bya ba la sogs pas khyed cag gis brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rang gi tshig nyid kyis gang zag dngos por yod pa ma yin par bstan pa yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: de dag la brjod ces bya ba la sogs pas khyed cag gis brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rang gi tshig nyid kyis gang zag dngos por yod pa ma yin par bstan pa yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no ;
translated: The root text explains that the words ‚Äúinexpressible‚Äù in the statement ‚ÄúThe person is inexpressible‚Äù show that the person does not exist as a thing.

original: / sbyor ba ni gang zhig dngos po las de nyid dang / gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin te nam mkha'i padma bzhin no //
analyzed: / sbyor ba ni gang zhig dngos po las de nyid dang / gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin te nam mkha'i padma bzhin no //
translated: The application is this: that which is not to be expressed as either the same or different from an entity is not an entity, like a sky-lotus.

original: gang zag kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The person also is not to be expressed. This is the non-apprehension of a distinguishing feature.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar instance is feeling, etc.

original: yang ji ltar 'di la khyab pa grub ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di la khyab pa grub ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is the pervasion established here?

original: dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdngos po ni dngos po las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dngos po ni dngos po las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid las mi 'da' ste /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAn entity is not different, etc.

original: go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An entity does not go beyond being the same or different from an entity, because there is no other possibility.

original: de lta ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun brjod du med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun brjod du med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even form, etc. would not be mutually inexpressible.

original: de lta bas na ngo bo med pa rang bzhin med pa la brjod du med par brtags kyi dngos po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngo bo med pa rang bzhin med pa la brjod du med par brtags kyi dngos po la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-existent, the natureless, is imagined to be inexpressible, not an entity.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: tha dad tha dad med rnam rtog / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med rnam rtog / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe concepts of difference and non-difference‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po nyid la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa rten gyi /
analyzed: dngos po nyid la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa rten gyi /
translated: The concepts of difference and non-difference are based on entities.

original: dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not apply to non-entities.

original: des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs par brjod du med pa ni dngos med nyid la ste /
analyzed: des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs par brjod du med pa ni dngos med nyid la ste /
translated: Therefore, the inexpressibility of identity and difference, etc. applies only to non-entities.

original: rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid la rigs kyi dngos po la ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs par bstan du med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes sprel te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid la rigs kyi dngos po la ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs par bstan du med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes sprel te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that entities are inexpressible in terms of identity and difference, etc. because they are devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: de la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag las go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag las go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other possibility besides difference and non-difference.

original: yang ji ltar go skabs gzhan med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar go skabs gzhan med ce na /
translated: Again, how is there no other possibility?

original: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were different‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar gang zag gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni de la med ces dgag pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag las gzhan nyid du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni de la med ces dgag pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag las gzhan nyid du brjod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the negation ‚ÄúThe person is not the intrinsic reality of form, etc.,‚Äù is the expression of the person as something different from form, etc.

original: dngos po la dngos po gzhan dgag pa ni rang bzhin gzhan @222b sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la dngos po gzhan dgag pa ni rang bzhin gzhan @222b sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of one thing as the intrinsic reality of another thing is invariably concomitant with the establishment of the other thing as something different.

original: sbyor ba ni dngos po gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba de ni de las gzhan yin te tshor ba la gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dngos po gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba de ni de las gzhan yin te tshor ba la gzugs bzhin no //
translated: The argument is as follows: Any thing that is devoid of the intrinsic reality of another thing is different from it, like feeling is from form.

original: gang zag tu brjod pa'i dngos po yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gang zag tu brjod pa'i dngos po yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The thing called ‚Äúperson‚Äù is devoid of the intrinsic reality of form, etc. This is an argument from the nature of things.

original: gang yang dngos 'di de nyid min pa bkag pa ni de'i ngo bo ma yin pa bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dngos 'di de nyid min pa bkag pa ni de'i ngo bo ma yin pa bkag pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the negation of this thing as not that reality is the negation of its being something other than that.

original: de ni de nyid dang tha mi dad pa kho na brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni de nyid dang tha mi dad pa kho na brjod pa yin te /
translated: Because that is invariably concomitant with the expression of its being not different from that.

original: dngos po yod pa la don gzhan bkag pa ni de nyid sgrub pa me dpar mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la don gzhan bkag pa ni de nyid sgrub pa me dpar mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when an existent thing is negated as being something else, that very thing is established.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te de ni rang bzhin 'ga' yang brjod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin thams cad bkag pa'i phyir dngos po med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te de ni rang bzhin 'ga' yang brjod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin thams cad bkag pa'i phyir dngos po med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, then if it were not the case that any intrinsic reality at all is expressed, then, because all intrinsic reality would be negated, it would be just nonexistence.

original: dngos po med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin thams cad bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsbyor ba ni dngos po gang zhig gang las /
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin thams cad bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro // sbyor ba ni dngos po gang zhig gang las /
translated: For, the definition of nonexistence is the negation of all intrinsic reality.

original: don gzhan nyid bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi de nyid yin pa de ni de kho na yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi de nyid yin pa de ni de kho na yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúThat thing which is the intrinsic reality of the negation of being something else is just that,

original: dper na gzugs rang gi rang bzhin las don gzhan nyid bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi de nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs rang gi rang bzhin las don gzhan nyid bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi de nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, like form, which is the intrinsic reality of the negation of being something else than its own intrinsic reality.

original: gang zag kyang gzugs la sogs pa las don gzhan nyid bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gang zag kyang gzugs la sogs pa las don gzhan nyid bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The person also is the intrinsic reality of the negation of being something else than form, etc.‚Äù This is an inference based on intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po ni dngos po de las de nyid dang gzhan nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po de las de nyid dang gzhan nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa grub po //
translated: Because an entity does not transcend being the same as or different from itself, the pervasion of the root reason is established.

original: de ltar re zhig brjod du med pa nyid du khas blangs pa na gang zag rtags su yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig brjod du med pa nyid du khas blangs pa na gang zag rtags su yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that if one accepts that the person is inexpressible, then the person would be a non-thing.

original: de ni gang zag dngos po nyid du khas len na yang brjod du med par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gang zag dngos po nyid du khas len na yang brjod du med par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If one accepts that the person is a thing, then it is not reasonable to say that the person is inexpressible.üîΩIf it were, then the thesis would contradict your own words.

original: de lta ma yin na dam bcas pa rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas mjug sdud par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dam bcas pa rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas mjug sdud par byed pa ni /
translated: Thinking this, he concludes:

original: gang zag phung po las gzhan min //
analyzed: gang zag phung po las gzhan min //
translated: The person is not different from the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag gang zag brjod du med pa yin no zhes smra ba na /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag gang zag brjod du med pa yin no zhes smra ba na /
translated: Moreover, when you say that the person is inexpressible,üîΩthe words clearly imply that the person is different from the aggregates.

original: gang zag phung po dag las gzhan nyid du ches gsal por 'thon pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang zag phung po dag las gzhan nyid du ches gsal por 'thon pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa ni //
translated: To be related to contradictory properties

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zag phun tshun spangs te gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zag phun tshun spangs te gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The application is as follows: those persons who possess mutually exclusive properties are mutually different.

original: dper na lus can dang lus can ma yin pa'i chos ldan pa'i gzugs dang tshor bdag lta bu'o //üîΩphung po dang gang zag dag kyang brjod par bya ba dang brjod du med @223a * //
analyzed: dper na lus can dang lus can ma yin pa'i chos ldan pa'i gzugs dang tshor bdag lta bu'o // phung po dang gang zag dag kyang brjod par bya ba dang brjod du med @223a * //
translated: For example, form and feeling possess the properties of being corporeal and incorporeal, respectively.

original: pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The aggregates and the person possess mutually exclusive properties, such as being expressible and inexpressible, respectively. This is the natural reasoning.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'di ltar tshor ba la sogs las //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / 'di ltar tshor ba la sogs las //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this reasoning is not unestablished, he says:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because they are inexpressible as identical to or different from feeling, etc.üîΩBecause they are inexpressible as identical to or different from feeling, etc.

original: 'di ltar gang zag ni tshor ba dang 'du shes la sogs pa dag las de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod du med par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag ni tshor ba dang 'du shes la sogs pa dag las de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod du med par 'dod la /
translated: Thus, the person is asserted to be inexpressible as identical to or different from feeling, perception, etc.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa de dag las phan tshun gzhan nyid du brjod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa de dag las phan tshun gzhan nyid du brjod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Form, feeling, etc. are mutually different from those feelings, etc. Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di las kyang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa grub bo zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa grub bo zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show that this also proves the possession of contradictory properties,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe aggregates of form, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is said that all conditioned things are impermanent, form, etc. are said to be impermanent.

original: gang zag ni de ltar mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang zag ni de ltar mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod de /
translated: But the person is not said to be impermanent in that way.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inexpressible in every way.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason uncertain,

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason for the convention of difference is limited to just this.

original: de lta ma yin na sna tshogs pa thams cad dngos po gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sna tshogs pa thams cad dngos po gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then all varieties would be one entity.

original: de lta yin dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that they would be born and destroyed together.

original: de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod du med pa'i phyir gang zag dngos po ma yin no zhes bstan pa 'ba' zhig du ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod du med pa'i phyir gang zag dngos po ma yin no zhes bstan pa 'ba' zhig du ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it shown that the person is not an entity because it cannot be said to be identical with or different from the aggregates,

original: 'di las kyang ste /
analyzed: 'di las kyang ste /
translated: but also

original: mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because it cannot be said to be impermanent, it is shown that it is not an entity.

original: yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'di nyid ni yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di nyid ni yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of existenceüîΩis the ability to perform a function.üîΩThis is the characteristic of existence.

original: dngos po nyid kyi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the nature of an entity.

original: 'di lta ste don byed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste don byed par nus pa'o //
translated: It is the ability to perform a function.

original: dngos po med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can ni dngos po nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can ni dngos po nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The defining characteristic of non-entity is the absence of all ability, and the implication of this is that entity is that which has the defining characteristic of being able to perform a function.

original: don byed pa de yang skad cig ma rnams kho na la nges pa yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa de yang skad cig ma rnams kho na la nges pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the performance of a function is ascertained only in momentary entities.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that it is pervaded by momentariness.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is contradictory for permanent entities to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.
