original: de'i phyir de ltar skad cig ma nyid du gang zag brjod du med na dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skad cig ma nyid du gang zag brjod du med na dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, if the person is not described as momentary, it does not exist as an entity.

original: de la de'i khyab par byed pa skad @223b cig ma nyid ldog pa'i phyir shing nyid log pa na shing sha pa nyid ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la de'i khyab par byed pa skad @223b cig ma nyid ldog pa'i phyir shing nyid log pa na shing sha pa nyid ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: This is because the pervasion of the person by momentariness is reversed, just as the pervasion of a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ by being a tree is reversed.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: mi rtag nyid du brjod min gang //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid du brjod min gang //
translated: That which is not described as impermanent

original: de ni 'ga'i yang rgyu ma yin //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'ga'i yang rgyu ma yin //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: is not the cause of anything.

original: gal te 'di snyam du gang zag rtag par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du gang zag rtag par gyur na /
translated: If you think that the person is permanent,

original: de'i tshe de ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal bar gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal bar gyur na /
translated: then it is contradictory that it performs functions gradually or instantaneously,

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa de ltar rtag par yang yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa de ltar rtag par yang yin pas so //
translated: because it is inexpressible as impermanent in that way, and it is permanent in that way.

original: de'i phyir 'di don dam par nus pa 'gal ba med pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di don dam par nus pa 'gal ba med pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, there is no contradiction in its ability.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gnyis ka dang bral ba'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gnyis ka dang bral ba'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not logical that the intrinsic reality of things is free from both aspects.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because permanence and impermanence are characteristics that are mutually exclusive.

original: dngos po'i rnam pa gcig gtong ba dang yongs su len pa dag ni de las gzhan gyi rnam pa yongs su gzung ba dang btang ba med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa gcig gtong ba dang yongs su len pa dag ni de las gzhan gyi rnam pa yongs su gzung ba dang btang ba med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because giving up and taking on one aspect of a thing do not occur without taking on and giving up its other aspects.

original: kho bo cag gis ni gang zag brjod du med pa'i sgrar mngon par zhen pa na ma bkag ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni gang zag brjod du med pa'i sgrar mngon par zhen pa na ma bkag ste /
translated: We do not refute the mere expression of the inexpressible person.

original: rang dbang can 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa ni sus kyang dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on kyang gang zag ces bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin thams cad du yod dam /
analyzed: rang dbang can 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa ni sus kyang dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // 'on kyang gang zag ces bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin thams cad du yod dam /
translated: For no one can refute the mere assertion of an independent person.

original: 'on te med ces bya ba dngos po'i rang bzhin 'di 'dir dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te med ces bya ba dngos po'i rang bzhin 'di 'dir dpyad par bya'o //
translated: But the nature of the person, whether it exists or not, is to be investigated here.

original: gal te yod na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te yod na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it exists, then it is permanent.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin te /
translated: For there is no other so-called permanence.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin rtag tu gnas pa 'jig pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin rtag tu gnas pa 'jig pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Rather, that which is by nature always present and never destroyed is called permanent.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe wise call that permanent

original: gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa //üîΩde la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod //üîΩces bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa // de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod // ces bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: whose nature is never destroyed.

original: ci ste med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe 'di mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe 'di mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: If the position is that it does not exist, then it is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristic of impermanence is the nature of non-endurance.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa dag las ma gtogs pa'i phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa dag las ma gtogs pa'i phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Therefore, since there is no other aggregate of things apart from momentary and non-momentary,

original: skad cig ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid kyis don bya ba byed pa nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa la khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid kyis don bya ba byed pa nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa la khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: and since it is contradictory for a momentary thing to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously, it is established that momentary existence is pervaded by the characteristic of being able to perform a function.

original: gang zag la skad cig ma nyid log pa na yod pa ldog par grub po //üîΩgal te gang zag med pa de lta yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srog gang yin pa de lus @224a * //
analyzed: gang zag la skad cig ma nyid log pa na yod pa ldog par grub po // gal te gang zag med pa de lta yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srog gang yin pa de lus @224a * //
translated: Therefore, when the momentariness of the person is refuted, existence is refuted.

original: yin nam / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan yin zhes zhus pa la /
analyzed: yin nam / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan yin zhes zhus pa la /
translated: If the person does not exist, why did the BhagavƒÅn say, ‚ÄúIs the life-force the same as the body or is the life-force one thing and the body another?‚Äù

original: 'di ni lung du mi ston pa yin no zhes gsungs /
analyzed: 'di ni lung du mi ston pa yin no zhes gsungs /
translated: and then say, ‚ÄúThis is not to be taught‚Äù?

original: gang gi phyir med pa nyid do zhes ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa nyid do zhes ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why did he not say, ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist‚Äù?

original: lung dang 'gal ba dag la ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba dag la ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: because the person is not a real entity.

original: gal te chos can gang zag grub par gyur na de'i tshe de'i chos de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa lung bstan par 'os na ji tsam du chos can de nyid ma grub na de ji ltar med pa de'i chos ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te chos can gang zag grub par gyur na de'i tshe de'i chos de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa lung bstan par 'os na ji tsam du chos can de nyid ma grub na de ji ltar med pa de'i chos ston par 'gyur /
translated: If the person as a real entity were established, then its attributes such as being identical to or different from the aggregates could be declared. But since the person as a real entity is not established, how can its attributes be taught as nonexistent?

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la ni gang gis 'di lung bstan par 'gyur ba rno ba la sogs pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la ni gang gis 'di lung bstan par 'gyur ba rno ba la sogs pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The attributes of a nonexistent such as the horns of a rabbit are not possible, such as being sharp or dull.

original: de'i phyir gang zag brtags su yod pa nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni lung du mi ston pa yin no zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag brtags su yod pa nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni lung du mi ston pa yin no zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: Therefore, the Lord did not declare the person to be inexpressible in order to clarify that the person exists as a nominal reality.

original: med do zhes ni ma gsungs te /
analyzed: med do zhes ni ma gsungs te /
translated: He did not declare the person to be nonexistent.

original: gzhan gyi chos can gyi rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos can gyi rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the person as a subject is different from that of other subjects.

original: yang na brtags su yod pa yang med pa mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i don du stong pa nyid bstan pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo'i bsam pa la ltos nas med do zhes de skad du ma gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na brtags su yod pa yang med pa mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i don du stong pa nyid bstan pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo'i bsam pa la ltos nas med do zhes de skad du ma gsungs so //
translated: Or else, in order to eliminate the manifest clinging to non-existence, the emptiness of non-existence is taught, in consideration of the thought of disciples who are not fortunate enough to be taught emptiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩIn consideration of the fact that views are like the teeth of a saw,

original: lta ba'i mche bas smas pa dang // las rnams 'jig pa la ltos nas //
analyzed: lta ba'i mche bas smas pa dang // las rnams 'jig pa la ltos nas //
translated: and that actions are destroyed,üîΩthe Victor taught the Dharma

original: stag mos phru gu khyer ba ltar //üîΩrgyal bas chos rnams bstan pa mdzad //
analyzed: stag mos phru gu khyer ba ltar // rgyal bas chos rnams bstan pa mdzad //
translated: like a tigress carrying her cubs.

original: ces bya ba de lta bu slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas mdzod dang don dam pa bdun cu pa la sogs par dgongs pa gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba de lta bu slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas mdzod dang don dam pa bdun cu pa la sogs par dgongs pa gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the master Vasubandhu and others have clarified the intention of the scriptures in the Abhidharmako≈õa, the Sata≈õƒÅstra, and so on.

original: brtson pa byas pa yin na de'i phyir rtogs pa de nyid du go bar bya'o //
analyzed: brtson pa byas pa yin na de'i phyir rtogs pa de nyid du go bar bya'o //
translated: If you make an effort, you will understand that very point.

original: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs nas ma bris so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs nas ma bris so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Fearing too great an expansion of this work, I have not written more.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzus te byung ba'i sems can yod do zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: How can it be said that there are sentient beings who are spontaneously born?

original: med pa dag dgag pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa dag dgag pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to refute the non-existence of sentient beings,üîΩthe Buddha said, ‚ÄúThere are sentient beings.‚Äù

original: sems can yod par brjod pa brtse ba dang ldan pa sna tshogs pa ston pa ni 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sems can yod par brjod pa brtse ba dang ldan pa sna tshogs pa ston pa ni 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere are sentient beings‚Äù is not contradictory to the teaching of the various kinds of compassion.

original: sems kyi rgyud gang las sems can btags pa de ni 'khor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gang las sems can btags pa de ni 'khor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha said, ‚ÄúThere are sentient beings,‚Äù intending the continuity of the mind-stream, which is the basis for the designation of sentient beings, to be uninterrupted in cyclic existence.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig ldog pa med pa brgyud pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang med par go ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med pas 'jig rten pha rol ma grub @224b po zhes gdul bya med par blta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig ldog pa med pa brgyud pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang med par go ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med pas 'jig rten pha rol ma grub @224b po zhes gdul bya med par blta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since the continuity of the aggregates, which is the uninterrupted succession of cause and effect, would not exist, the disciples would understand that there is no world beyond and would view the world beyond as non-existent.üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, I will teach you the burden,

original: 'o na dge slong dag khur yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na dge slong dag khur yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: the carrier of the burden,

original: khur len pa dang khur 'dor ba dang / khur khyer ba yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: khur len pa dang khur 'dor ba dang / khur khyer ba yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: The burden, the bearer of the burden, the laying down of the burden, and the one who lays down the burden are taught.

original: de la khur ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: de la khur ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams so //
translated: The burden is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: khur len pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: khur len pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: The taking up of the burden is becoming.

original: khur 'dor ba ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: khur 'dor ba ni thar pa'o //
translated: The laying down of the burden is liberation.üîΩThe bearer of the burden is the person.

original: khur khyer ba ni gang zag go zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar drang /
analyzed: khur khyer ba ni gang zag go zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar drang /
translated: How is this passage to be interpreted?

original: khur nyid khur khyer bar rigs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khur nyid khur khyer bar rigs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable that the burden itself is the bearer of the burden.

original: tshogs pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshogs pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The aggregates and so on are said to be

original: de la tshogs pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa dus mtshungs pa'i phung po rnams kho na tshogs pa'i tha snyad rten pa yin te /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de dag nyid cig car mi 'byung ba la rgyun zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de la tshogs pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa dus mtshungs pa'i phung po rnams kho na tshogs pa'i tha snyad rten pa yin te / rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de dag nyid cig car mi 'byung ba la rgyun zhes bstan te /
translated: The aggregates and so on are said to be the bearer of the burden because they are the basis of the convention of the bearer of the burden.üîΩThe aggregates and so on are said to be the burden because they are the basis of the convention of the burden.üîΩThe aggregates and so on are said to be the laying down of the burden because they are the basis of the convention of the laying down of the burden.

original: rnam pa gcig tu rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i rgyun dang tshogs pa dag gi sgras bstan pas des na tshogs pa la sogs pa'i thugs kyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i rgyun dang tshogs pa dag gi sgras bstan pas des na tshogs pa la sogs pa'i thugs kyis te /
translated: The aggregates and so on are said to be the one who lays down the burden because they are the basis of the convention of the one who lays down the burden.

original: tshogs pa la sogs pa'i dgongs pas khur dang de khyer pa la sogs pa bstan pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa la sogs pa'i dgongs pas khur dang de khyer pa la sogs pa bstan pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is this: there is no contradiction in teaching the burden, the bearer of the burden, etc. in the intention of the collection, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra dang pos rgyun la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra dang pos rgyun la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The first ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the continuum, etc.

original: gnyis pas ni khur la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni khur la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the burden, etc.

original: de la phung po tshogs pa de dag nyid rgyun la sogs pa'i ngo bos brjod par 'dod pas gang zag khur khyer ba zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de la phung po tshogs pa de dag nyid rgyun la sogs pa'i ngo bos brjod par 'dod pas gang zag khur khyer ba zhes bstan te /
translated: There, the aggregates, the collection, are called the person who bears the burden, because they are the basis of the continuum, etc.

original: de nyid la 'jig rten na gang zag tu rlom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la 'jig rten na gang zag tu rlom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the world conceives of the person in that way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis khur khyer ba'i gang zag gang yin zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis khur khyer ba'i gang zag gang yin zhes smras pa la /
translated: Therefore, when the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúWhat is the person who bears the burden?üîΩ‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang zag 'di'i rigs ni 'di lta bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang zag 'di'i rigs ni 'di lta bu /
translated: the venerable one replied, ‚ÄúThe person of this kind,

original: rus ni 'di lta bu /
analyzed: rus ni 'di lta bu /
translated: of this clan,

original: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: who eats this kind of food,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /
translated: who experiences this kind of pleasure and pain,

original: 'di ltar tshe ring zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe ring zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag bstan pa yin no //
translated: who remains in this world for a long time, etc.‚Äù

original: phung po tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid la ci nas kyang btags par yod pa shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: phung po tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid la ci nas kyang btags par yod pa shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The defining characteristics of the assembly of the aggregates are to be understood as being the mere imputations of the self.üîΩ

original: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rtag pa rdzas su yod pa gzhan ni shes par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rtag pa rdzas su yod pa gzhan ni shes par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that the person is to be understood as existing only as a nominal designation for the mere collection of aggregates, and not as a permanent, substantial entity imagined by other schools.

original: gdon mi za bar de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: One must understand it in this way,

original: de lta ma yin na khur len pa yang phung po dag las logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir gang zag bzhin du phung po'i nang du ma gtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khur len pa yang phung po dag las logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir gang zag bzhin du phung po'i nang du ma gtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise, since the bearer of the burden would be taught as something separate from the aggregates, it would not be included among the aggregates, like the person.

original: de'i phung po gzhan de dag bskyed par bya bar 'jug pa'i phyir phung po snga ma de dag nyid khur zhes bya bar gsungs la /
analyzed: de'i phung po gzhan de dag bskyed par bya bar 'jug pa'i phyir phung po snga ma de dag nyid khur zhes bya bar gsungs la /
translated: The former aggregates are called the ‚Äúburden‚Äù because they are the aggregates that are to be generated as the other aggregates of the bearer of the burden.

original: gang dag 'bras bur gyur pa'i skye ba de dag ni khur khyer ba zhes gsungs pas 'di ni shes @225a * //
analyzed: gang dag 'bras bur gyur pa'i skye ba de dag ni khur khyer ba zhes gsungs pas 'di ni shes @225a * //
translated: The latter aggregates are called ‚Äúthe bearing of the burden‚Äù because they are the aggregates that are the result.

original: par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not an explanatory sutra.

original: gsal bar byed par smras pa /
analyzed: gsal bar byed par smras pa /
translated: The opponent replies that it is an explanatory sutra.

original: bdag khas mi len na de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di don dang ldan par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: bdag khas mi len na de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di don dang ldan par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: If one does not accept the self, one cannot posit the meaning of the statements of the TathƒÅgata.

original: gang gi phyir btsun pa gzugs bdag ma lags /
analyzed: gang gi phyir btsun pa gzugs bdag ma lags /
translated: Venerable sir, form is not the self.

original: btsun pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang ; rnam par shes pa bdag ma lags /
analyzed: btsun pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang ; rnam par shes pa bdag ma lags /
translated: Venerable sir, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are not the self.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag gzugs 'di ni khyod ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag gzugs 'di ni khyod ma yin /
translated: Similarly, monks, this form is not yours,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni khyod ma yin zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni khyod ma yin zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are not yours.

original: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nga rgyal gyi yul nyid bkag la 'di ni khyad par bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nga rgyal gyi yul nyid bkag la 'di ni khyad par bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: This passage refutes the aggregates of form and so on as objects of the view of the self. It refutes their being specific selves,

original: spyi bkag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi bkag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not refute their being general selves.

original: bdag khas mi len na yang spyi nyid dgag par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag khas mi len na yang spyi nyid dgag par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Even if one does not accept the self, it is the general self that is to be refuted.

original: khyod nyid dang / bdag nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: khyod nyid dang / bdag nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The refutation of the specific self is not independent, but is established in dependence on the refutation of the general self.

original: dper na mig g-yon pas mi mthong ngo zhes brjod pa na g-yas pas mthong ngo zhes go ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na mig g-yon pas mi mthong ngo zhes brjod pa na g-yas pas mthong ngo zhes go ba nyid yin no //
translated: For example, when it is said, ‚ÄúThe left eye does not see,‚Äù it is understood that the right eye does see.

original: des kyang mi mthong na g-yon pa smos pa don med de mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba kho na brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang mi mthong na g-yon pa smos pa don med de mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba kho na brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the right eye also did not see, then it would be pointless to mention the left eye, for it would be as if one said, ‚ÄúIt does not see.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang gzugs bdag ma yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang gzugs bdag ma yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa na /
translated: In the same way, when it is said here, ‚ÄúForm is not the self, up to consciousness is not the self,‚Äù

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i bdag yod do zhes ston  par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i bdag yod do zhes ston  par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be as if one were to say, ‚ÄúThe self that is not like that exists.‚Äù

original: de yang brjod du med pa'am gzhan yin du chug mod /
analyzed: de yang brjod du med pa'am gzhan yin du chug mod /
translated: And that self would have to be inexpressible or different.

original: thams cad du bdag yod do zhe'o //
analyzed: thams cad du bdag yod do zhe'o //
translated: But it is said that the self exists in all cases.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: khyad par dag ni dgag pa yang //
analyzed: khyad par dag ni dgag pa yang //
translated: The refutation of distinctions

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba blo gros ngan pa rnams la 'jug pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba blo gros ngan pa rnams la 'jug pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The twenty high peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection, which are the entryways for those with bad intellects, are as follows:

original: gzugs bdag yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag yin pa'i bar dang / gzugs la bdag gnas pa nas rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas pa'i bar dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa nas bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: gzugs bdag yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag yin pa'i bar dang / gzugs la bdag gnas pa nas rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas pa'i bar dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa nas bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i bar dang /
translated: The self is form, up to the self is consciousness, the self is based on form, up to the self is based on consciousness, the self possesses form, up to the self possesses consciousness,

original: gzugs bdag gi yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: form is the self‚Äôs, up to consciousness is the self‚Äôs.

original: de la lta ba dang po lnga dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lta ba dang po lnga dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the first five views,

original: de'i lta ba can la khyad par gyi tshul gyis bkag pa mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i lta ba can la khyad par gyi tshul gyis bkag pa mdzes pa yin no //
translated: it is beautiful to refute them in a special way for those who have those views.

original: gzugs bdag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lta ba de dag gang dag la yod pa de dag ni de'i lta ba can te /
analyzed: gzugs bdag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lta ba de dag gang dag la yod pa de dag ni de'i lta ba can te /
translated: Those who have the views ‚ÄúThe self is form,‚Äù etc., are those who have those views.

original: @225b blo gros blun po'i dogs pa'i gnas gang kho na yin pa de kho na rjes su brjod nas bzlog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @225b blo gros blun po'i dogs pa'i gnas gang kho na yin pa de kho na rjes su brjod nas bzlog pa yin gyi /
translated: The very thing that is the object of doubt for a fool is just what is to be stated and then refuted.

original: 'di la sgrub pa 'ga' zhig bzhed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la sgrub pa 'ga' zhig bzhed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, there is no assertion of any proof.

original: de lta ma yin na nyan pa po legs par mi sbyor ba'i tshig smra ba na ston pa po rtog pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyan pa po legs par mi sbyor ba'i tshig smra ba na ston pa po rtog pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, when the teacher speaks words that are not well-formed, he would not be considered a thinker.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las gnas ma'i bu pa'i bdag brtag pa ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las gnas ma'i bu pa'i bdag brtag pa ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the twelfth chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Examination of the Person,‚Äù from the root text of the Compendium of Reality.

original: // / g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove the particularity called ‚Äúmovement,‚Äù

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúor‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig mar 'jig pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa dngos po mtha' dag gi tshogs sgrub pa gcig gis gsal ba yin na yang kho bo cag gis gzhung shin
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig mar 'jig pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa dngos po mtha' dag gi tshogs sgrub pa gcig gis gsal ba yin na yang kho bo cag gis gzhung shin
translated: By proving that all things are momentary and disintegrate, the other imagined natures, such as ƒ™≈õvara, are also clarified by the single proof that all things are a collection.

original: tu rgyas par bkod pas tshig re re nas brjod nas sun 'byin pa rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni ngal bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: tu rgyas par bkod pas tshig re re nas brjod nas sun 'byin pa rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni ngal bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: However, since we have set forth our text in a very extensive way, to refute it by stating each of our words would be nothing but exhausting.

original: thabs sla la nyung ba nyid kyis de sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs sla la nyung ba nyid kyis de sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that since the method is easy and brief, it refutes that.

original: 'di ltar gzhan kha cig dag gis rang bzhin la sogs pa thams cad ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'am rjes su 'gro ba med par bkag pa'i chos can du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan kha cig dag gis rang bzhin la sogs pa thams cad ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'am rjes su 'gro ba med par bkag pa'i chos can du mi 'dod do //
translated: In this way, some others do not assert that all intrinsic natures and so on are phenomena that are refuted as disintegrating immediately after arising or as lacking continuation.

original: de lta bas na 'di dang dngos po mtha' dag gi khyab par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig mar 'jig pa bsgrubs pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dang dngos po mtha' dag gi khyab par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig mar 'jig pa bsgrubs pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Therefore, since the refutation of that is established by the proof of momentariness, which is the characteristic that pervades all things, it is eliminated.

original: kho bo cag gis rang bzhin la sogs pa nas gang zag gi mthar thug pa bshad zin pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs dang / yon tan dang / rdzas la sogs pa dang sgra dang / don dag dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya dag dang /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rang bzhin la sogs pa nas gang zag gi mthar thug pa bshad zin pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs dang / yon tan dang / rdzas la sogs pa dang sgra dang / don dag dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya dag dang /
translated: Having thought that, we have already explained intrinsic natures and so on up to the person, and we will explain the categories, qualities, substances, and so on, as well as sound, objects, valid knowledge, objects of comprehension, and so on.

original: nor bu'i gzi lta bur kha dog sna tshogs pa'i dngos po dang / dus gsum du 'jug pa'i ngo bo dang / tshu rol mdzes pa pas khas blangs pa'i 'byung ba bzhi dang / rgyal dpog pas 'dod pa'i rig byed kyi sgra'i tshogs khyad par med par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir skad cig mar 'jig pa bsgrub par bya'o ;
analyzed: nor bu'i gzi lta bur kha dog sna tshogs pa'i dngos po dang / dus gsum du 'jug pa'i ngo bo dang / tshu rol mdzes pa pas khas blangs pa'i 'byung ba bzhi dang / rgyal dpog pas 'dod pa'i rig byed kyi sgra'i tshogs khyad par med par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir skad cig mar 'jig pa bsgrub par bya'o ;
translated: and things of various colors like a rainbow, and the nature of the three times, and the four elements accepted by the LokƒÅyata, and the collection of Vedic sounds accepted by the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka, are established as momentary in order to clarify them without distinction.

original: / gsal bar zhes bya ba ni de sgrub par byed pa'i tshul gsum pa'i gtan tshigs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gsal bar zhes bya ba ni de sgrub par byed pa'i tshul gsum pa'i gtan tshigs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúClarify‚Äù is stated in order to show the trimodal logical reason that establishes that.

original: de'i phyir bstan pa'i dngos po brtags pa 'di nyid la bstan bcos mtha' dag gi don yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa'i dngos po brtags pa 'di nyid la bstan bcos mtha' dag gi don yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the meaning of the entire treatise is completely contained in this very examination of the presented entity.

original: 'di ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /üîΩbyas dang ma byas nyid sgo @226a * //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na / byas dang ma byas nyid sgo @226a * //
translated: How is this established?

original: nas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is stated, ‚ÄúThrough the produced and unproduced, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rigs pa can la sogs rnams skad cig ma'i dngos po gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa na /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa can la sogs rnams skad cig ma'i dngos po gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa na /
translated: This is because the NaiyƒÅyikas and others think that not even a single momentary thing exists.

original: byas pa dang ma byas pa nyid kyi sgo nas dngos po rnams phung po gnyis kho nar rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: byas pa dang ma byas pa nyid kyi sgo nas dngos po rnams phung po gnyis kho nar rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: They posit that things are only of two kinds, in terms of being produced or unproduced.

original: de la kha cig ni byas pa yin te bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni byas pa yin te bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, some are produced, like a pot, etc.

original: la la ni ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: la la ni ma byas pa yin te /
translated: Some are unproduced,

original: rdul phra rab dang nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like atoms, space, etc.

original: gzhan dag gis te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis te /
translated: Others,

original: gnas ma'i bu pa la sogs pa dag gis ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams phung po gnyis su 'dod de /
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu pa la sogs pa dag gis ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams phung po gnyis su 'dod de /
translated: the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas, etc., assert that things are of two kinds, in terms of being momentary or nonmomentary.

original: 'di ltar de'i 'dod pas blo dang sgra dang me lce la sogs pa skad cig ma dag yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i 'dod pas blo dang sgra dang me lce la sogs pa skad cig ma dag yin la /
translated: Thus, according to their assertion, the mind, sound, a flame, etc., are momentary.

original: sa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa dag ni skad cig ma ma yin pa dag yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: sa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa dag ni skad cig ma ma yin pa dag yin no zhe'o //
translated: Earth, space, etc., are nonmomentary.

original: de'i phyir de ltar lta ba'i dbye bas gnas pa na re zhig gang dag byas pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag phyogs su byas nas tshad ma brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar lta ba'i dbye bas gnas pa na re zhig gang dag byas pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag phyogs su byas nas tshad ma brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the measure of proof is to be stated by way of the division of such views, he says,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that regard,‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad kyi 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis mtshan nyid gsum pa'i gtan tshigs ston to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis mtshan nyid gsum pa'i gtan tshigs ston to //
translated: ‚Äú Because of the absence of dependence on another cause for the destruction of everything‚Äù demonstrates the reason for the third characteristic.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that, he says,

original: dngos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag dngos po gang la ltos pa med pa de dag ni de'i ngo bor nges pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag dngos po gang la ltos pa med pa de dag ni de'i ngo bor nges pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not dependent on another is ascertained as its own nature,

original: dper na de ma thag pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs pa rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de ma thag pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs pa rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la nges pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the collection of the immediately preceding conditions is ascertained to produce its own effect.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'i byas pa'i dngos po rnams kyang 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'i byas pa'i dngos po rnams kyang 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And things that are produced, which have arising, also do not depend on destruction. This is a reason based on nature.

original: rgyu gzhan zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gtan tshigs de yang ni skyed par byed pa las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gtan tshigs de yang ni skyed par byed pa las tha dad pa'o //
translated: And that reason based on nature, ‚Äúanother cause,‚Äù is different from the producer.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu smras pa /
translated: The certainty is stated as the reason.

original: de ltar rang gi rgyu las skye'i //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi rgyu las skye'i //
translated: Thus, it arises from its own cause.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni der nges pa'i ngo bos skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni der nges pa'i ngo bos skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus means that it arises by the nature of being determined in that way. This is the meaning.

original: yang na gang dag gang du yang ma nges pa de dag ni de la ltos pa med pa yang ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gang dag gang du yang ma nges pa de dag ni de la ltos pa med pa yang ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, those that are not determined in any way are not without depending on that.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa so ma btang ba so btang ba dag la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa so ma btang ba so btang ba dag la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: For example, it is like unbaked and baked pots and so on. This is the dissimilar example here.

original: 'on te gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt this reason itself indeterminate?

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams 'jig pa la rgyu gzhan la ltos pa med pa de lta yang @226b yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams 'jig pa la rgyu gzhan la ltos pa med pa de lta yang @226b yin mod kyi /
translated: It is true that the destruction of things does not depend on another cause.

original: 'on kyang gnas nas yul dang dus gzhan du dngos po 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas nas yul dang dus gzhan du dngos po 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is possible that a thing would be destroyed in another place and time while remaining where it is.

original: 'di dag skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa ma grub pa'o //
translated: You have not established that they are destroyed immediately upon being born.

original: gal te 'di ni ltos med na //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni ltos med na //
translated: If this is not dependent,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: This refers to destruction.

original: de la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not dependent on another place and time, it is not dependent.

original: gang zhig gang la ltos pa med pa de ni 'ga' zhig tu 'am res 'ga' 'gyur na de'i tshe de'i yul dang dus la ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la ltos pa med pa de ni 'ga' zhig tu 'am res 'ga' 'gyur na de'i tshe de'i yul dang dus la ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: If something is not dependent on something else, it would be so in some cases or at some times. Then, because it would depend on that place and time,

original: ltos pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be independent.

original: de'i phyir ga las ma 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir ga las ma 'khrul pa yin /
translated: So how could it be nonerroneous?

original: 'di ltar yul dang dus gcig yongs su spangs nas yul dang dus la sogs pa gzhan du 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang dus gcig yongs su spangs nas yul dang dus la sogs pa gzhan du 'jug pa na /
translated: Thus, if it is said that it is not dependent because it is not seen to be dependent on another thing,

original: ji ltar mi ltos pa zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mi ltos pa zhes bya ba yin /
translated: how could it be said that it is not dependent?

original: 'di ltar de'i ltos pa ni de ltar gnas pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i ltos pa ni de ltar gnas pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: For its dependence is just its existence,

original: 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not its desire,

original: de ni bsam pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsam pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of intention.

original: 'o na gal te rnam pa thams cad du ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rnam pa thams cad du ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin par 'dod na /
translated: But if you accept that the meaning of the reason is that it is not dependent in any way,

original: 'o na gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'o na gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: then the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig dag 'jig pa la thob pa la sogs pa la ltos par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig dag 'jig pa la thob pa la sogs pa la ltos par mthong ste /
translated: For some things are seen to be dependent on obtaining destruction,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, for example.üîΩAnd those things that are known to be independent, like cognition, sound, and so on,

original: gang yang blo dang sgra la sogs pa ltos pa med pa nyid du grags pa de dag kyang gal te tho ba la sogs pa la mi ltos pa de lta na yang yul dang dus la ltos pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes dogs
analyzed: gang yang blo dang sgra la sogs pa ltos pa med pa nyid du grags pa de dag kyang gal te tho ba la sogs pa la mi ltos pa de lta na yang yul dang dus la ltos pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes dogs
translated: if they are not dependent on a hammer, and so on, then they are dependent on place and time. Therefore you should not fear that the reason is not established.

original: par byas nas lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: par byas nas lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and then you should respond.

original: skye ba can kun 'jig pa la //
analyzed: skye ba can kun 'jig pa la //
translated: In order to respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúAll things that are produced are destroyed without a cause.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The above is stated.üîΩ

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus la sogs pa thams cad du skye ba dang ldan pa rnams 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus la sogs pa thams cad du skye ba dang ldan pa rnams 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means in all places, times, etc. Things that are produced are destroyed without relying on a cause of destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa rnams cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa rnams cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those that are accepted as causes of destruction do not perform any function at all.

original: phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not benefit.

original: phan mi 'dogs pa yang ltos par mi rigs te /
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs pa yang ltos par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that that which does not benefit is relied upon.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is utterly absurd.

original: ji ltar cung zad kyang mi byed pa yin zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar cung zad kyang mi byed pa yin zhe na / 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How is it that they do not perform any function at all?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not tenable that things that are produced are destroyed.

original: 'jig pa byed na res 'ga' dngos po 'am dngos po med pa yin grang /
analyzed: 'jig pa byed na res 'ga' dngos po 'am dngos po med pa yin grang /
translated: ‚Äù If destruction is produced, is it sometimes a thing or sometimes a nonthing?

original: de la gal te dngos po yin na de'i tshe 'jig pa dang ldan pa 'di dngos po las don gzhan du ma gyur pa byed dam /
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po yin na de'i tshe 'jig pa dang ldan pa 'di dngos po las don gzhan du ma gyur pa byed dam /
translated: If it is a thing, then is this which possesses destruction different or not different from a thing?

original: don gzhan du gyur pa byed /üîΩdngos po yod pa la ni rnam par rtog pa @227a * //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa byed / dngos po yod pa la ni rnam par rtog pa @227a * //
translated: If it is a thing, then is this which possesses destruction generated as something different from a thing, or is it generated as not different from a thing?

original: gnyis las mi 'da' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis las mi 'da' ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is a thing, then one cannot escape the two alternatives.

original: gnyi ga'am gnyig ma yin pa'i phyogs ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'am gnyig ma yin pa'i phyogs ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The position that it is neither is not logical,

original: dngos po gcig gtong ba dang yongs su len pa dag ni de las gzhan yongs su gtong ba dang len pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig gtong ba dang yongs su len pa dag ni de las gzhan yongs su gtong ba dang len pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relinquishment and acceptance of one thing do not occur without the relinquishment and acceptance of something else.

original: gcig la sgrub dang dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gcig la sgrub dang dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that it is not possible to affirm and negate one and the same thing.

original: de la re zhig don gzhan du gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig don gzhan du gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs ni ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, the position that it is not different from a thing is not tenable,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyu kho na las skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyu kho na las skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the nature of a thing is generated only from its own cause.

original: mi mthun pa dang rgyu med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang rgyu med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not occur without a cause or from a cause that is not concordant.

original: de yang dngos po'i rang bzhin bzhin du de las tha mi dad par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i rang bzhin bzhin du de las tha mi dad par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because it is established as not being different from that, like the nature of an entity.

original: grub pa yang byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: grub pa yang byed par mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not tenable that an existent is made,

original: rgyu ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the cause would not be stopped.

original: 'di snyam du dngos po 'di rang gi rgyu ko na las bdag nyid thams cad grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dngos po 'di rang gi rgyu ko na las bdag nyid thams cad grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you think that this entity is not established by its own cause as having all of its own nature,

original: de'i phyir rgyu gzhan gyis 'jig par brjod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan thob pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gzhan gyis 'jig par brjod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan thob pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and therefore it is said that it is destroyed by another cause and obtains another nature,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid ces bya ba //
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid ces bya ba //
translated: The nature of an entity

original: la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gang gis na cha shas kyis 'grub par 'gyur ba gcig gi rang bzhin la gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na cha shas kyis 'grub par 'gyur ba gcig gi rang bzhin la gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not the case that one nature has two parts, how could it be established by parts?

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i cha shas med pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i cha shas med pa kho na yin la /
translated: However, an entity is partless.

original: de yang rang gi rgyus bskyed pa na bdag nyid thams cad kyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rang gi rgyus bskyed pa na bdag nyid thams cad kyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, when it is generated by its cause, it is generated by its entire nature.

original: ji ltar de'i dus phyis rgyu gzhan gyis rang bzhin gzhan byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i dus phyis rgyu gzhan gyis rang bzhin gzhan byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could another nature be made later at another time by another cause?

original: gang zhig grub pa na gang ma grub pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig grub pa na gang ma grub pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not logical that when something is established, that which is not established is its intrinsic reality.

original: tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the defining characteristic of non-difference is that they are established and have the same nature.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig dus phyis skye ba'i 'jig pa'i dngos po de ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig dus phyis skye ba'i 'jig pa'i dngos po de ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, that which arises later, the thing that is destroyed, is its intrinsic reality.

original: gang na gang yin pa de yang ji ltar der 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang na gang yin pa de yang ji ltar der 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: And how could that which is in one place be in another?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is nothing at all.üîΩBut if the position is that it is a different object, then in that case, the cause of destruction does not do anything to the thing at all.

original: ci ste don gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de la yang 'jig pa'i rgyus ni dngos po la ci yang mi byed pa nyid do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ci ste don gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de la yang 'jig pa'i rgyus ni dngos po la ci yang mi byed pa nyid do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,

original: dngos po las ni tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: dngos po las ni tha dad pa'i //
translated: A different thing

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gzhan byed pa na phan btags pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan byed pa na phan btags pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: When something else is produced, it is not called ‚Äúbeneficial.‚Äù

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would be absurd.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i 'jig pa byed pa'i phyir dngos po la phan btags par 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i 'jig pa byed pa'i phyir dngos po la phan btags par 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that ‚Äúit is helpful to things because it is related to them and it causes their destruction.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation is not established.

original: 'di ltar tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba @227b med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba @227b med la /
translated: Thus, because they are accepted as different, there is no relation characterized by identity.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med de /
translated: Nor is there a relation characterized by origination,

original: de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the cause of destruction itself.

original: dngos po'i 'brel pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'brel pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other relation of a thing.

original: 'brel pa yod na yang dngos po gzhan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na yang dngos po gzhan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if there were a relation, because it is a different thing,

original: de kho na bzhin du 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow, absurdly, that it would be observed as an effect and so forth, just as it is.

original: dmigs pa nyid 'bras bu yin pas dmigs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid 'bras bu yin pas dmigs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Since observation itself is the effect, it is the effect of observation.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu 'dzi pa dang / rje ngar gcog pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu 'dzi pa dang / rje ngar gcog pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so forth‚Äù are meant to include such things as the breaking of the water pot and the breaking of the knee.

original: 'jig pa tha dad pa des bsgribs pa'i phyir dang / gegs byas pa'i phyir dmigs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa tha dad pa des bsgribs pa'i phyir dang / gegs byas pa'i phyir dmigs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is obscured by that different cessation, and because it is obstructed, it does not perform the function of an effect, such as being observed.

original: de'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩIt is not tenable that somethingüîΩthat does not impair or produce

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyams par mi byed pa'am /üîΩskyed par mi byed pa de la sgrib par byed pa'am /üîΩgegs byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyams par mi byed pa'am / skyed par mi byed pa de la sgrib par byed pa'am / gegs byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: the specific nature of an entityüîΩis an obstruction or an obstruction.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that something that does not impair or produce the specific nature of an entity is an obstruction or an obstruction because that would be a preposterous conclusion.

original: de lta bas na mdor ba sgrib pa med pa gegs byed pa med pa sngar gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i sgrib pa dang gegs byed pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na mdor ba sgrib pa med pa gegs byed pa med pa sngar gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i sgrib pa dang gegs byed pa mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that its obstruction or obstruction exists because its previous nature is unobstructed and unhindered.

original: 'di snyam du snga ma bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du snga ma bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the absurd consequence of being observed does not follow as before,

original: 'jig pa tha dad pa des dngos po 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa tha dad pa des dngos po 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because that different cessation causes the entity to cease,üîΩthen Aryadeva says:

original: 'jig pa'i ming can dngos po yis //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ming can dngos po yis //
translated: The entity that is called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction‚Äù is the disintegration of things.

original: 'jig pa dngos po'i 'jig pa byed pa na ci gzhan nam /
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos po'i 'jig pa byed pa na ci gzhan nam /
translated: If it causes the destruction of another,

original: gzhan ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'am /
translated: is it different from it?

original: yang na zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jig par byed pa na 'jig par byed ces 'di la yang tho ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa mtshungs pa nyid la'ang rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang na zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jig par byed pa na 'jig par byed ces 'di la yang tho ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa mtshungs pa nyid la'ang rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: Or, if it causes destruction through the characteristic of disintegration, then the analysis of the terms ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which is to be destroyed‚Äù is the same as the analysis of the terms ‚Äúthe hammer‚Äù and ‚Äúthe clay pot.‚Äù

original: de la yang nyes pa bshad zin pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa bshad zin pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The errors in this analysis have been explained and will be explained.

original: don de la yang zhes bya ba ni gang 'di 'jigs pas 'jig pa gzhan byed na de la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don de la yang zhes bya ba ni gang 'di 'jigs pas 'jig pa gzhan byed na de la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this regard‚Äù means that if destruction causes the destruction of another, then the analysis of the terms ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which is to be destroyed‚Äù is the same as the analysis of the terms ‚Äúthe hammer‚Äù and ‚Äúthe clay pot.‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig dngos por gyur pa mi byed do zhes bstan nas dngos po med par gyur pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dngos por gyur pa mi byed do zhes bstan nas dngos po med par gyur pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, first, it has been demonstrated that an existent does not cause destruction. Now, in order to demonstrate that a nonexistent also does not cause destruction, he says:

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that non-entityness is the nature of things,

original: dngos po'i rgyur 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyur 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: it would be the cause of an entity, not of a non-entity.

original: rang bzhin mtha' dag dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de la rgyu mtshan du bya ba bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo cung zad kyang med @228a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin mtha' dag dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de la rgyu mtshan du bya ba bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo cung zad kyang med @228a * //
translated: Since it is characterized by being devoid of all intrinsic reality, it has not the slightest nature of a product that could be a reason for it.

original: do ; / de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: do ; / de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Therefore, that non-entityness

original: dngos po bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa 'ga' zhig gis byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa 'ga' zhig gis byed pa ma yin te /
translated: is not produced by any destruction that has the nature of a negation of an entity,

original: bong bu'i rva bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-existent like the horn of an ass.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would be an entity like a sprout, etc., because it would be an effect.

original: sbyor ba ni gang 'bras bu yin pa de ni dngos po yin te myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang 'bras bu yin pa de ni dngos po yin te myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The argument is: Whatever is an effect is an entity, like a sprout, etc.

original: 'jig pa yang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Destruction is an effect. This is a natural inference.

original: 'di yi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di yi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to prove the pervasion, he says:

original: rgyu yi nus pas skyed phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu yi nus pas skyed phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the effect is produced by the potency of the cause.

original: rgyu'i nus pas thob pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang yin pa de nyid la 'bras bu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pas thob pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang yin pa de nyid la 'bras bu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is the special nature obtained by the potency of the cause is called the effect.

original: sgrub pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par nyid dngos po yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par nyid dngos po yin no //
translated: The special nature of the effect is a real entity.

original: don 'di la rigs pa can la sogs pa la yang rtsod pa med de /üîΩ'di ltar yod pa dang 'du ba 'am /
analyzed: don 'di la rigs pa can la sogs pa la yang rtsod pa med de / 'di ltar yod pa dang 'du ba 'am /
translated: There is no dispute with the NaiyƒÅyikas and others about this meaning.

original: rang gi rgyu dang 'du ba ni 'bras bu nyid du brjod la /üîΩ'jig pa la ni yod pa dang 'du ba 'am /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang 'du ba ni 'bras bu nyid du brjod la / 'jig pa la ni yod pa dang 'du ba 'am /
translated: Thus, existence or the combination of existence and its cause is called the effect.

original: rang gi rgyu la 'du ba med de /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la 'du ba med de /
translated: But destruction does not have existence or the combination of existence and its cause.

original: de ni rdzas la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa nyid dang rten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzas la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa nyid dang rten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would be a substance, etc., and would exist and be supported.

original: gal te de lta na 'jig pa dngos po nyid la rag mod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'jig pa dngos po nyid la rag mod /
translated: If that is so, then destruction is a real entity.

original: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: de ltar dngos med gang yin pas //
analyzed: de ltar dngos med gang yin pas //
translated: Because of that, whatever is a non-entity

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.üîΩMoreover, how does one prove non-existence?

original: yang ji ltar med pa sgrub par byed ces dgos pa la 'di skad du /
analyzed: yang ji ltar med pa sgrub par byed ces dgos pa la 'di skad du /
translated: The purpose is stated:

original: ma yin dgag rten zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma yin dgag rten zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The basis of negation.

original: ma yin bar dgag pa la rten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin bar dgag pa la rten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it is the basis of negation.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis dngos po 'ga' zhig las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i dngos po nyid dngos po med pa zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis dngos po 'ga' zhig las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i dngos po nyid dngos po med pa zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: By the power of the desire to express, a thing is expressed as non-existence, a thing that is not similar to the thing that is desired to be expressed.

original: de la yang sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa tha dad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de la yang sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa tha dad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Moreover, the previously explained faults, such as difference, also apply to that.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas ma yin par dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa dngos po med pa'i rgyu dag gis byed pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas ma yin par dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa dngos po med pa'i rgyu dag gis byed pa ni ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If one fears this fault, then the nature of negation is not the cause of non-existence, which is destruction.

original: med bar dgag pa'i bdag nyid do zhes khas len par byed na /
analyzed: med bar dgag pa'i bdag nyid do zhes khas len par byed na /
translated: Well then, if one accepts that the nature of negation is non-existence,üîΩthen

original: de la yang khyed cag gis 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad mi byed pa nyid gsal rab pa nyid du bstan to zhes bstan pa'i phyir /'on te dngos po mi byed pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la yang khyed cag gis 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad mi byed pa nyid gsal rab pa nyid du bstan to zhes bstan pa'i phyir /'on te dngos po mi byed pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, in order to teach that you clearly reveal that the cause of destruction does not perform the slightest function, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, If it does not perform the function of an entity, etc.

original: @228b 'di ltar med par dgag pa yin na dgag pa byed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir med pa byed pa ni dngos po mi byed do zhes bya ba bkag pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu byed pa po nyid ma yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @228b 'di ltar med par dgag pa yin na dgag pa byed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir med pa byed pa ni dngos po mi byed do zhes bya ba bkag pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu byed pa po nyid ma yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if it is a nonimplicative negation, because it is related to the performance of a negation, the performance of a nonentity is negated. Therefore, since the statement ‚Äúit does not perform the function of an entity‚Äù is negated, it is taught that the cause of destruction is not a performer.

original: gang yang byed pa po ma yin pa de ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang byed pa po ma yin pa de ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could that which is not a performer be a cause?

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore no cause of destruction exists.üîΩIf you assert that the proofs of the existence of a cause of destruction are valid cognitions,

original: 'di rna ma bug pas smras pa'i 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa la tshad ma dag bstan par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di rna ma bug pas smras pa'i 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa la tshad ma dag bstan par 'dod na /
translated: then you should state,

original: dngos po yod pa'i dus dag tu //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i dus dag tu //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of entities that exist,

original: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa'i dus su 'jig ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa'i dus su 'jig ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, destruction does not occur when a thing exists,

original: skad cig tsam yang gnas pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig tsam yang gnas pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that it would not endure even for a moment.

original: skyes pa las sngar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa las sngar yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it prior to arising,

original: ma skyes pa 'jig par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa 'jig par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical that what has not arisen should be destroyed.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa ma skyes pa nyid 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa ma skyes pa nyid 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The son of a barren woman and so on are not destroyed by not arising.

original: phyis yun ring po nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis yun ring po nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it later, after a long time,

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa rnams su zhig pa ni yang 'jig par mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa rnams su zhig pa ni yang 'jig par mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not possible that what has been destroyed in the third moment and so on should be destroyed again,

original: thal bar byas pa las 'bar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: thal bar byas pa las 'bar ba bzhin no //
translated: like what has been burned by fire.

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i de ma thag tu skad cig gnyis pa la 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i de ma thag tu skad cig gnyis pa la 'jig pa yin no //
translated: However, it is destroyed in the second moment immediately after the thing.

original: de ltar na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du dus nges pa'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba grub po /
analyzed: de ltar na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du dus nges pa'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba grub po /
translated: Thus, because it is limited to a particular time, like a sprout and so on, it is established that destruction possesses a cause.

original: dus nges pa zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus nges pa zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of limited to a particular time is that it is occasional.

original: 'di yis khyab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di yis khyab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to establish the pervasion, he says:

original: ltos pa med par 'gyur pa la //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ltos pa med par 'gyur pa la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With regard to that which occurs without dependence,üîΩWith regard to that which occurs without dependence,

original: ltos pa med pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not reasonable that it be occasional,

original: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would always exist and so forth.

original: de lta bas na res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, because it is occasional, it is established that it has a cause.

original: 'di las kyang 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is established by this, he says:

original: dngos po'i de ma thag byung phyir //
analyzed: dngos po'i de ma thag byung phyir //
translated: Because of the immediacy of the thing,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs gsum po 'di dag smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs gsum po 'di dag smras te /
translated: Therefore, these three reasons are stated in this way.üîΩDestructions have a cause,

original: 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: because they are things,üîΩlike a vase.

original: res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po skye pa'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du sangs rgyas pas kyang khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba'i bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir skad cig gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po skye pa'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du sangs rgyas pas kyang khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba'i bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir skad cig gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because it is sometimes seen, because it is accepted that it occurs immediately after the arising of a thing, and because it obtains the nature of non-existence, like another moment.

original: chos mi mthun pas ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pas ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is the horn of a rabbit, etc.

original: 'dir gsal byed pas smras pa'i rigs pa yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde 'di skad du smras te 'jig pa la rgyu med do zhes @229a * //
analyzed: 'dir gsal byed pas smras pa'i rigs pa yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de 'di skad du smras te 'jig pa la rgyu med do zhes @229a * //
translated: Here, the logician B·πõhatsphi·π≠a says, ‚ÄúMoreover, if you say that destruction is causeless, etc.‚Äù

original: smra ba la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
translated: He says this: ‚ÄúOne should investigate the statement that destruction is without cause.

original: ci rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa bzhin du 'jig pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa bzhin du 'jig pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that, like the sky-lotus, etc., there is no destruction because there is no cause?

original: 'on te rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa nyid gcig yin /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa nyid gcig yin /
translated: Or, like space, etc., is it that there is permanence because there is no cause?

original: khyed kyi phyogs la rgyu med pa gnyis dmigs te /
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs la rgyu med pa gnyis dmigs te /
translated: In your position, both the absence of a cause and the presence of a cause are observed.

original: rtag pa dang med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang med pa'o //
translated: Permanence and nonexistence.
