original: 'di ltar yod pa dang med pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa dang med pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med do //
translated: Because there is no other aspect apart from existence and nonexistence.

original: de la gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pa yin na /
translated: If you say that destruction does not exist because it has no cause,

original: de'i tshe dngos po thams cad rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po thams cad rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that all things are permanent,

original: 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not destroyed.

original: gzhan yang 'dus byas thams cad 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus byas thams cad 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, this assertion that all conditioned phenomena are destroyed would be causeless,

original: med pa la 'ong ba dang 'gor ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa la 'ong ba dang 'gor ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: because it is not tenable to say that what does not exist comes or goes.

original: ci ste rtag pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po 'jig pa dang lhan cig gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rtag pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po 'jig pa dang lhan cig gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is permanent, then things would endure together with destruction,

original: thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would endure in all ways.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because things and nonthings have the characteristic of mutually excluding each other.

original: 'on te yang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod na de'i tshe 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te yang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod na de'i tshe 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if you do not accept that they endure together, then the effect would not arise,

original: de'i sgrar gyur pa 'jig pa rtag tu gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrar gyur pa 'jig pa rtag tu gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the cause would be destroyed, and destruction always endures.

original: de lta yin dang ma skyes pa 'jig bar yang mi rigs te 'jig rten na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma skyes pa 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes grags pa ni med do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang ma skyes pa 'jig bar yang mi rigs te 'jig rten na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma skyes pa 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes grags pa ni med do //
translated: If that were so, it would not be logical for the non-arisen to be destroyed, because in the world it is well known that the non-arisen, such as the horn of an ass, is not destroyed.

original: des na ma skyes pa 'jig go zhes bya ba'i tshig rig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma skyes pa 'jig go zhes bya ba'i tshig rig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúthe non-arisen is destroyed‚Äù is not reasonable.

original: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad kyi lan 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad kyi lan 'debs pa yin te /
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, here‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Destruction is of two kinds:

original: sgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: that which has the characteristic of establishment and that which has the characteristic of negation.

original: 'di ltar skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin nyid kyi g-yo ba ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig par brjod pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin nyid kyi g-yo ba ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig par brjod pa 'am /
translated: Thus, the movement of the nature of phenomena that endure momentarily is destruction, and therefore it is called ‚Äúdestruction.‚Äù

original: yang na dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pa'i mtshan nyid zhig pa'i ming can gzhan gyis 'jig pa la 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pa'i mtshan nyid zhig pa'i ming can gzhan gyis 'jig pa la 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is the name of another thing, which has the characteristic of the negation of the intrinsic reality of a thing.

original: de 'jig pa snga ma la gal te ji skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa'i brgal zhing brtag pa 'di byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'jig pa snga ma la gal te ji skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa'i brgal zhing brtag pa 'di byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: If one analyzes and investigates whether that destruction has a cause, as was explained in the case of the prior nonexistence of a pot, then you are proving what is already established for us.

original: grub pa la sgrub pa de nyid dngos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa de nyid dngos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: This is shown by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThat very proof of what is already established . . .‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar khyed la 'jig pa rgyu med par grags she na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar khyed la 'jig pa rgyu med par grags she na /
translated: If that is so, how is it that you assert that destruction is commonly accepted to be without a cause?

original: gzhan @229b med phyir na rgyu med can //
analyzed: gzhan @229b med phyir na rgyu med can //
translated: Because there is no other, it is causeless.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gzhan med pa po las tha dad pa dus phyis kyi tho ba la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan med pa po las tha dad pa dus phyis kyi tho ba la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no other agent of destruction that is different from the thing itself, such as a hammer, that exists later,

original: rgyu med can du 'dod ces skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu med can du 'dod ces skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: it is asserted to be causeless.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'jig pa'i chos can 'di yang res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sngar ma byung ba'i bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gnyis grub po /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'jig pa'i chos can 'di yang res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sngar ma byung ba'i bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gnyis grub po /
translated: Since this which is a perishable thing in this way is sometimes, and since it obtains a self which did not exist previously, these two reasons are established.

original: dngos po'i de ma thag tu byung ba yang gal te spyir brjod par 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i de ma thag tu byung ba yang gal te spyir brjod par 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it is the intention to state in general that it arises immediately after a thing, then it is established,

original: dngos po 'di rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po'i de ma thag tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'di rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po'i de ma thag tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established immediately after a thing which is the cause of this thing.üîΩBut if it is the intention to state that it arises immediately after a thing which is a perishable thing, then the reason is not established.

original: ci ste 'di 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes ston ba ni /
analyzed: ci ste 'di 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes ston ba ni /
translated: To show this, he says,

original: dngos po'i de ma thag byung nyid //
analyzed: dngos po'i de ma thag byung nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising immediately after a thing‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de 'dra zhes bya ba ni dngos po g-yo ba'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra zhes bya ba ni dngos po g-yo ba'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike that‚Äù means not different from the nature of a moving thing.

original: gang gis 'di de ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba cha shas med pa'i dngos po la ni cha shas yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis 'di de ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba cha shas med pa'i dngos po la ni cha shas yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But for a partless thing, which is momentary, there is no division.

original: de'i rang bzhin bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i 'jig pa de grub na grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i 'jig pa de grub na grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like its intrinsic reality, its destruction, which is not different from it, is established when it is established.

original: de lta ma yin na de de'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de de'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be its intrinsic reality.

original: gang yang 'dus byas thams cad 'jig pa'i nges pa yang rgyu mtshan med pa can zhes smras pa de yang de nyid kyi phyir spangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang 'dus byas thams cad 'jig pa'i nges pa yang rgyu mtshan med pa can zhes smras pa de yang de nyid kyi phyir spangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: And what was said, ‚ÄúThe certainty of the destruction of all conditioned things is without a reason,‚Äù is also refuted by this, as is shown by the words

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that reason.‚Äù

original: dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos de ltar nges par byas pa'i lus can rnams ni blo de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa nyid thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos de ltar nges par byas pa'i lus can rnams ni blo de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa nyid thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodies of those who have ascertained that things abide momentarily are the reason for that cognition, so it does not follow that it is without a reason.

original: 'on te zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa'i chos can mngon par 'dod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs gsum char yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa'i chos can mngon par 'dod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs gsum char yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: zhig pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhig pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDisintegration itself,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ma thag tu byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni dngos po kho na la rten gyi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag tu byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni dngos po kho na la rten gyi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The properties of arising in the next moment and so on are based only on things, not on nonthings such as the horns of an ass.

original: zhig pa yang bdag med ba ste /
analyzed: zhig pa yang bdag med ba ste /
translated: Disintegration is also without self,

original: rang bzhin med pa de ji ltar 'di de ma thag tu byung ba la sogs pa srid par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa de ji ltar 'di de ma thag tu byung ba la sogs pa srid par 'gyur /
translated: that is, without intrinsic nature. How could it be possible for it to arise in the next moment and so on?

original: ma byung dngos po ldan pa'ang med //
analyzed: ma byung dngos po ldan pa'ang med //
translated: ‚ÄúNor does a non-arisen thing exist.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la 'ang gi sgras res 'ga' ba nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'ang gi sgras res 'ga' ba nyid gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúnor‚Äù is to be connected to the word ‚Äúever.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na zhig pa la de ma thag tu byung ba nyid med pa de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po zhig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa gang zhig mi 'gyur ba de 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dogs pa @230a * //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhig pa la de ma thag tu byung ba nyid med pa de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po zhig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa gang zhig mi 'gyur ba de 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dogs pa @230a * //
translated: If that is so, then since the disintegration of the thing does not occur immediately, how could the thing be disintegrated?

original: la ; zhig gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩzhig pa grub pa nyid du ston pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: la ; zhig gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / zhig pa grub pa nyid du ston pa yin mod kyi /
translated: In response to this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúThe disintegration of the thing,‚Äù and so on.üîΩHe is indeed teaching that disintegration is established.

original: 'o na kyang dngos po bkag pa nyid ston par byed gyi /
analyzed: 'o na kyang dngos po bkag pa nyid ston par byed gyi /
translated: However, he is teaching that the thing is refuted.

original: don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig sgrub pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'on te nag pa'i bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig sgrub pa ni ma yin no // 'on te nag pa'i bur 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not establishing any nature of the thing ultimately.üîΩBut in the case of the expression ‚Äúthe son of a barren woman,‚Äù the word ‚Äúis‚Äù is used.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur 'gyur ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir de la yang dngos po nyid sgrub bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur 'gyur ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir de la yang dngos po nyid sgrub bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: So isn‚Äôt he establishing the thing?

original: mi 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn the case of the expression,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po rnams la sgra sbyor ba tsam gyi rjes su byed pa'i yod pa dang med pa dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la sgra sbyor ba tsam gyi rjes su byed pa'i yod pa dang med pa dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Existence and nonexistence that follow mere application of terms to things do not exist.

original: de ni 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pas 'jig pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pas 'jig pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they are related to mere desire, they are destroyed.

original: / de lta ma yin na skyes bu 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis bong bu zhes bya ba'i ming sbyor bar byed pa na /
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na skyes bu 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis bong bu zhes bya ba'i ming sbyor bar byed pa na /
translated: If it were not so, then when the name ‚Äúdonkey‚Äù is applied to a certain person by the power of the desire of some person,

original: de la bong bu'i chos thams cad yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bong bu'i chos thams cad yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that all the qualities of a donkey would exist in him.

original: b'a le k'a dang r'a sa bha'i sgra dag ni bong bu'i rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: b'a le k'a dang r'a sa bha'i sgra dag ni bong bu'i rnam grangs dag go //
translated: The words ‚Äúdonkey‚Äù and ‚Äúbeast of burden‚Äù are synonyms.

original: gdon mi za bar 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand this without a doubt.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pa nyid yin gyi sgrub pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pa nyid yin gyi sgrub pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of things is only negated; there is not the slightest affirmation.

original: de lta ma yin na zhig pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan sgrub na dngos po la cung zad kyang skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhig pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan sgrub na dngos po la cung zad kyang skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were not so, then if the so-called ‚Äúdisintegration‚Äù were an affirmation of another thing, then because there is not the slightest arising of a thing,

original: dngos po de'i phyir ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po de'i phyir ldog par 'gyur /
translated: that thing would not disintegrate.

original: gang yang med pa yin na 'jig med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /üîΩdngos po'i ngo bo dang bral bas //
analyzed: gang yang med pa yin na 'jig med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la / dngos po'i ngo bo dang bral bas //
translated: If it is nothing at all, then the statement ‚Äúbecause it is not destroyed‚Äù and so on is meaningless.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated:üîΩIf it is devoid of the entityness of things,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As such, because it is devoid of the entityness of the nature of things,üîΩthe entityness of things that exists as the nature of things is refuted.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo log pa'i phyir ni med pa tsam ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo log pa'i phyir ni med pa tsam ste /
translated: Because the entityness that exists as the nature of things is refuted, it is mere nonexistence.

original: de ltar na dngos po thams cad rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po thams cad rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, all things would be permanent.

original: gal te 'di dag gi rang bzhin bkag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gi rang bzhin bkag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa med par gyur na /
translated: If the entityness of these things that is characterized by the refutation of intrinsic nature did not exist,

original: de'i phyir 'di dag rtag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag rtag par 'gyur na /
translated: then in that case they would be permanent.

original: ji srid du rang bzhin bkag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa rang nyid med pa'i ngo bo yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: ji srid du rang bzhin bkag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa rang nyid med pa'i ngo bo yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: But for as long as the entityness that is characterized by the refutation of intrinsic nature exists as the nature of things itself,

original: ji ltar rtag par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag par 'gyur /
translated: how could they be permanent?

original: 'dus byas thams cad 'jig par nges pa nyid kyis rgyu mtshan yang brjod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad 'jig par nges pa nyid kyis rgyu mtshan yang brjod pa kho na'o //
translated: Because all conditioned things are definitely destroyed, this is the only reason that is stated.

original: gang yang rtag pa nyid na 'jig pa dang lhan cig gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /üîΩ'di la rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gang yang rtag pa nyid na 'jig pa dang lhan cig gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la / 'di la rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: And what was said, ‚ÄúIf it is permanent, it would endure together with destruction,‚Äù etc.,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúHere, the nature of permanence,‚Äù etc.

original: ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis kyang zhig pa 'di la sgrub pa'i ngo bo ldog pa'i @230b ngo bo brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis kyang zhig pa 'di la sgrub pa'i ngo bo ldog pa'i @230b ngo bo brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And by the words ‚Äúit would be destroyed,‚Äù this destruction is not said to have the nature of an affirmation.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la sgrub pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la sgrub pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because here it does not have the nature of an affirmation in the least.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo skad cig las phyis rang bzhin 'jug pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo skad cig las phyis rang bzhin 'jug pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: The nature of an entity is prevented from continuing after the moment.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni gcig bu dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni gcig bu dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because this is the nature of an entity alone,

original: rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: it is not the basis for the conception of permanence.

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis rtag tu gnas pa'i ngo bor mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis rtag tu gnas pa'i ngo bor mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not tenable that the nature of things is permanent, since they always abide without intrinsic reality.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos dag ni rang bzhin la rab tu 'brel pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos dag ni rang bzhin la rab tu 'brel pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because permanent and impermanent phenomena are thoroughly related to intrinsic reality.

original: gang yang khyed cag gi rgyu med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang yang khyed cag gi rgyu med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, your claim that there are two types of causelessness,

original: rtag pa dang med pa'o zhes smra ba ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' mi shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang med pa'o zhes smra ba ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' mi shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: permanent and nonexistent, is simply a sign of ignorance of the tenets of others.

original: 'di ltar rigs pa smra ba sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rgyu med pa ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs pa smra ba sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rgyu med pa ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, Buddhists who advocate reasoning do not accept causelessness at all.üîΩAs the Transcendent Conqueror said:

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o
translated: The bodhisattva who abides observing phenomena after phenomena does not see any phenomenon that is not dependently arisen.

original: // bye brag tu smra ba gang dang nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos po yod pa nyid du rtog par byed pa de dag ni khyed cag gi phyogs su blan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: // bye brag tu smra ba gang dang nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos po yod pa nyid du rtog par byed pa de dag ni khyed cag gi phyogs su blan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Vaibhashika: You should not take the side of those who think that space and so on are real entities.

original: sh'akya'i sras ma yin ba'i phyir de dag gi lugs kyi dngos po ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras ma yin ba'i phyir de dag gi lugs kyi dngos po ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: Their system is not good, because they are not sons of the Shakyamuni.

original: de ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu thams cad cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu thams cad cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because all causes of disintegration do not perform any function at all, the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di las kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams cung zad kyang mi byed par brjod par bya ste /üîΩ'ji ltar dngos po rang gi rgyu las skye bzhin pa na rang bzhin gyis rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams cung zad kyang mi byed par brjod par bya ste / 'ji ltar dngos po rang gi rgyu las skye bzhin pa na rang bzhin gyis rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: We can also say that the causes of disintegration do not perform any function at all.

original: mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur grang /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur grang /
translated: When an entity is arising from its own cause, does it arise with a nature that is essentially disintegrating or does it arise with a nature that is essentially nondisintegrating?

original: gal te 'jig na de la 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang byas ba med de /
analyzed: gal te 'jig na de la 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang byas ba med de /
translated: If it disintegrates, then the cause of disintegration does not perform any function at all.

original: rang nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is destroyed by the very nature of its existence.

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni de 'dra bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni de 'dra bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever is the nature of something, that is how it arises from its cause.

original: yang de'i dngos po'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang de'i dngos po'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not depend on another cause for its existence.

original: dper na snang ba dang / zhu ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid du skyes ba slar yang snang ba la sogs pa nyid du skye ba rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di snyam du dper na sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i rang @231a * //
analyzed: dper na snang ba dang / zhu ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid du skyes ba slar yang snang ba la sogs pa nyid du skye ba rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no // 'di snyam du dper na sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i rang @231a * //
translated: For example, light, fluidity, heat, and solidity arise as their own natures and do not depend on another cause for their arising as light, and so on.üîΩYou may think, for example, that although a seed, etc.

original: bzhin yin na yang 'ba' zhig pa ni skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: bzhin yin na yang 'ba' zhig pa ni skyed par mi byed de /
translated: is the nature that produces a sprout, etc., it does not produce it alone,

original: chu la sogs rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu la sogs rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on another cause, such as water.

original: de bzhin du dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa na /
translated: In the same way, although an entity is the nature that is destroyed, its destruction depends on another cause.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: mtha'i gnas skabs thob pa nyid skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha'i gnas skabs thob pa nyid skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because you accept that it is the nature of the cause to generate the effect at the time when it is about to disintegrate.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of anything else.

original: des na gang 'di de'i rang bzhin yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa kho na yin gyi 'di gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang 'di de'i rang bzhin yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa kho na yin gyi 'di gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is its nature is only that which generates it, and it does not depend on anything else.

original: gang sbyang la sogs pa la gnas pa skyed par byed pa ma yin na de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gang sbyang la sogs pa la gnas pa skyed par byed pa ma yin na de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: If something does not generate the effect, such as the seed that exists in the present, it is not the nature of the cause.

original: rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de la yang rgyu zhes tha snyad du byas kyi dngos su ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de la yang rgyu zhes tha snyad du byas kyi dngos su ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cause, it is designated as the cause, but not in reality. Therefore there is no error.

original: ci ste mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: But if the position is that the nature of the effect is not destroyed,

original: de'i tshe yang 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na ste /
translated: then the cause of destruction does not do anything at all.

original: de ni sus kyang rang bzhin gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sus kyang rang bzhin gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because no one can change the nature of something else.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po de skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur na / de'i tshe phyis kyang de'i gnas skabs gnas pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin de nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po de skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur na / de'i tshe phyis kyang de'i gnas skabs gnas pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin de nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: As such, if that thing that has arisen does not disintegrate, then later also, because its nature is to endure,

original: gang gis 'jig par 'gyur ba de la 'jig pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig par 'gyur ba de la 'jig pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: what would cause it to disintegrate?

original: yang ci'i ste ji ltar zangs la sogs pa sra ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang me la sogs pa dang phrad pa las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ci'i ste ji ltar zangs la sogs pa sra ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang me la sogs pa dang phrad pa las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: What if you say, ‚ÄúJust as copper and so on have a hard nature, but through contact with fire and so on, they transform into another state,

original: de bzhin du dngos po yang mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang 'jig pa'i rgyus rnam pa gzhan nyid du byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po yang mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang 'jig pa'i rgyus rnam pa gzhan nyid du byed de /
translated: in the same way, even though things have a nature that does not disintegrate, the cause of disintegration transforms them into another state.

original: des na 'jig pa'i rgyu thob nas 'jig par byed do snyam pa de 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i rgyu thob nas 'jig par byed do snyam pa de 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, having obtained the cause of disintegration, they disintegrate.‚Äù

original: de nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct, because that very thing does not transform into another.

original: rnam pa gzhan nyid ni rang bzhin gzhan skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan nyid ni rang bzhin gzhan skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another state has the characteristic of the arising of another nature.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci dngos po las don gzhan yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci dngos po las don gzhan yin nam /
translated: Thus, what is called ‚Äúanother aspect‚Äù is it a different object from the thing?

original: 'on te dngos po nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po nyid yin /
translated: Or is it the thing itself?

original: re zhig dngos po nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the thing itself,

original: de ni rang gi rgyu kho na las sngar grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi rgyu kho na las sngar grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is already established from its own cause.

original: ci ste don gzhan yin pa de lta na dngos po mi 'pho ba'i chos can de kho na bzhin du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: ci ste don gzhan yin pa de lta na dngos po mi 'pho ba'i chos can de kho na bzhin du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But if it is a different object, then the thing, which has the nature of not being transferred, remains just as it is, so there is no change in its aspect.

original: zangs ma la sogs pa'i dpe yang ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: zangs ma la sogs pa'i dpe yang ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The example of copper, etc. is not established.

original: 'di ltar zangs ma la sogs pa'i sngar gyi skad cig sra ba la sogs pa rang gi rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i phyir 'jig pa @231b na rang gi nye bar len pa dang / me la sogs pa'i lhan cig spyod pa las tshogs pa gzhan zhu bar brjod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan nyid skye ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zangs ma la sogs pa'i sngar gyi skad cig sra ba la sogs pa rang gi rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i phyir 'jig pa @231b na rang gi nye bar len pa dang / me la sogs pa'i lhan cig spyod pa las tshogs pa gzhan zhu bar brjod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan nyid skye ba kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the previous moment of copper, etc. ceases by itself, and because of the destruction of its own nature, the other collection of its own nature arises from the simultaneous operation of the cause of its own appropriation, fire, etc. It is said that it melts.

original: slar yang zhu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi dang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa na rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang / grang ba la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan las sra bar brjod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan nyid skye ba'i phyir gcig la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slar yang zhu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi dang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa na rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang / grang ba la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan las sra bar brjod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan nyid skye ba'i phyir gcig la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and again, the nature of the request, etc. is destroyed by its own cessation. When it is destroyed, another nature, called ‚Äúsolidity,‚Äù is produced from another cause, its own substantial cause, and from another cooperative cause, cold, etc. Therefore, it is not the case that one thing becomes another.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad du 'di la 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad du 'di la 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the cause of destruction does not do anything at all to this [nature], the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in the similar instance.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate,

original: sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been established earlier.

original: 'di snyam du dper na nam mkha' lus can nyid du gzhan la ltos pa med pa de lta yin na nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du dper na nam mkha' lus can nyid du gzhan la ltos pa med pa de lta yin na nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúFor example, space is not dependent on another as having a body. If that were so, it would not be ascertained,‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dngos po byas pa yin na 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig par nges par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po byas pa yin na 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig par nges par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, if things are produced, it is not certain that they will be destroyed.

original: gzhan gyis mi rtag par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa'i byas pa de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi rtag par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa'i byas pa de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not correct, because there is no production that is not accepted as impermanent by others.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that everything that has a cause is impermanent.

original: de dag nyid 'dir phyogs su byas kyi gzhan ni ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid du ga las 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag nyid 'dir phyogs su byas kyi gzhan ni ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid du ga las 'gyur /
translated: Since only those are taken as the position here, and not others, how could it be indeterminate?

original: gang dag byas pa nyid yin na yang mi 'jig pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa /
analyzed: gang dag byas pa nyid yin na yang mi 'jig pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa /
translated: Some think that even if something is produced, it is permanent because it does not disintegrate.

original: de dag don dam par ma byas pa'i phung por 'dus pa nyid kyis de bkag par shes par bya ba yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de dag don dam par ma byas pa'i phung por 'dus pa nyid kyis de bkag par shes par bya ba yin pas skyon med do //
translated: But since they are included in the aggregates that are ultimately unproduced, they should be understood as refuted by that, so there is no fault.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa lus can nyid la sogs pa'i chos la ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa lus can nyid la sogs pa'i chos la ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub ste /
translated: Space and so on are not established as not dependent on other phenomena such as corporeality.

original: gang la chos gang med pa de ni de la ltos pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang la chos gang med pa de ni de la ltos pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
translated: Whatever is not a property of something is only related to it.

original: dngos po rnams kyi thob pa'i chos la 'ga' zhig ltos pa med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi thob pa'i chos la 'ga' zhig ltos pa med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-acquisition of entities is not posited as something that is not related to anything.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: ma thob pa nyid la yin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub po //
analyzed: ma thob pa nyid la yin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub po //
translated: Since it is non-acquisition itself, the example is not established.

original: da ni ma byas pa'i phung po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni ma byas pa'i phung po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, with regard to the unproduced aggregates, he says,

original: gang dag nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúSpace and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te nam mkha'i sogs pa dngos po yin par grub par gyur na de'i tshe de dag la skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi bsam pa 'jug pa 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i sogs pa dngos po yin par grub par gyur na de'i tshe de dag la skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi bsam pa 'jug pa 'gyur na /
translated: If space and so on were established as entities, then at that time the consideration of their properties, such as momentariness, would be applicable.

original: chos rnams rang dbang du byas grub pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams rang dbang du byas grub pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But entities are not established as independent.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag gi chos nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //üîΩnam @232a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag gi chos nyid nyams par 'gyur ro // nam @232a * //
translated: If that were not so, their reality would be undermined.

original: mkha' la sogs pa ma byas pa'i chos can du grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mkha' la sogs pa ma byas pa'i chos can du grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Space and so on are not established as unproduced phenomena.

original: de dag ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are objects of the convention ‚Äúnonexistent,‚Äù just like the son of a barren woman, due to their total lack of capacity.

original: sbyor ba ni gang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de ni dngos po med pa yin te mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //üîΩnam mkha' la sogs pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sam /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de ni dngos po med pa yin te mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no // nam mkha' la sogs pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sam /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is empty of all capacity is a non-thing, like the son of a barren woman.üîΩSpace, etc., are empty of all capacity.

original: dngos su khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos su khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: This is a reason of nature, or a non-observation of a pervader.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: med pa'i tha snyad ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes phyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro // ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes phyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: The convention of non-existence is based on just that reason.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in the similar instances.

original: yang ci'i phyir dngos po med pa la skad cig dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug ce na /üîΩskad cig mar gnas ngo bo yi //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dngos po med pa la skad cig dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug ce na / skad cig mar gnas ngo bo yi //
translated: The idea of momentariness does not apply to non-entities,üîΩbecause they do not have the nature of enduring for a moment, etc.üîΩThe idea of non-momentariness does not apply to non-entities,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: because they do not have the nature of enduring for a moment, etc.

original: gsal byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: gsal byed pas smras pa /
translated: The Elucidator says:

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ldan pa'i don mi 'thad de /
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ldan pa'i don mi 'thad de /
translated: The meaning of possession is not tenable in the case of momentariness.

original: 'di ltar gal te nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis ni zad pa ni skad cig go //üîΩde 'di la yod pas na skad cig ma'o zhes sgrub na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis ni zad pa ni skad cig go // de 'di la yod pas na skad cig ma'o zhes sgrub na /
translated: Thus, if one proves that it is momentary because it has exhaustion,

original: de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not reasonable,

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the difference in time.

original: gang gi tshe zad pa de'i tshe zad pa can med pa'i phyir dus tha dad pa dag la ni ldan pa'i don ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zad pa de'i tshe zad pa can med pa'i phyir dus tha dad pa dag la ni ldan pa'i don ma mthong ngo //
translated: When there is exhaustion, at that time there is no possessor of exhaustion, so possession is not seen in things that are different in time.

original: yang ci ste dngos po nyid de ma thag tu 'jig pas khyad par du byas pa la skad cig ces rjod pa de lta na yang de de nyid kyis de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ldan pa'i don mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang ci ste dngos po nyid de ma thag tu 'jig pas khyad par du byas pa la skad cig ces rjod pa de lta na yang de de nyid kyis de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ldan pa'i don mi rigs so //
translated: Moreover, if a thing is called ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù because it is qualified by destruction immediately after its arising, then even so, it is not tenable that it possesses that, because it is not that itself.

original: 'on te skad cig tu gnas pa'i dus ni skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig tu gnas pa'i dus ni skad cig ma ste /
translated: But if the time of abiding for a moment is a moment,

original: thams cad kyi mtha'i dus ni skad cig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi mtha'i dus ni skad cig go //
translated: and the time at the end of everything is a moment,

original: de gang la gnas pa de dag ni skad cig ma yin na 'di yang mi rigs te ming tsam du dus khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gang la gnas pa de dag ni skad cig ma yin na 'di yang mi rigs te ming tsam du dus khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and those that abide for a moment are momentary, this is also untenable, because time is accepted as mere name.

original: ming tsam dngos po'i khyad par nyid du mi rigs so zhe'o //
analyzed: ming tsam dngos po'i khyad par nyid du mi rigs so zhe'o //
translated: It is not tenable that mere name is a specific thing.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i //
translated: That which does not abide immediately after arising

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: is called ‚Äúmomentary.‚Äù

original: dngos po skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni skad cig ces bya ba la de gang la yod pa de ni skad cig ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni skad cig ces bya ba la de gang la yod pa de ni skad cig ma yin no //
translated: The nature of a thing that is destroyed immediately after arising is called ‚Äúmomentary.‚Äù That which possesses that is momentary.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag thob ma thag tu 'jig pa ni skad cig go //
analyzed: bdag thob ma thag tu 'jig pa ni skad cig go //
translated: The self is momentary because it is destroyed immediately upon being obtained.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni skad cig ma'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni skad cig ma'o zhes bshad do //
translated: That which has this is momentary.

original: 'on te de lta na yang rang bzhin don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de 'di la yod do @232b zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa mi 'thad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na yang rang bzhin don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de 'di la yod do @232b zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa mi 'thad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But even if this is so, since the nature is not a different object, is it not the case that the cognition that has the basis of the difference, ‚ÄúThis exists in that,‚Äù is not tenable?

original: don la tha dad med na yang //
analyzed: don la tha dad med na yang //
translated: Even though the object is not different,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says.üîΩFor example, even though there is no difference in entity in such things as the nature of space and the body of mercury, a difference is made in terms of the difference that is imagined by the mind.

original: dper na nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos bo tha dad pa med na yang blos kun du brtags pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di la yang
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos bo tha dad pa med na yang blos kun du brtags pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di la yang
translated: In the same way, this is also so.

original: 'gyur ro // tshigs dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // tshigs dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The word is not a reflection of the nature of the entity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: smra ba bo'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba bo'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
translated: It is a reflection of the desire of the speaker.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu'i don la smra ba bo rnams kyi ji snyed cig sbyar ba'i sgra de snyed pa de ni don de la brda'i dbang gis rtogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu'i don la smra ba bo rnams kyi ji snyed cig sbyar ba'i sgra de snyed pa de ni don de la brda'i dbang gis rtogs par byed kyi /
translated: Moreover, whatever words the speakers apply to the object, that many words are applied to that object by the power of convention.

original: don dam par rang bzhin nam rkyen ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin nam rkyen ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, there is no intrinsic reality or condition.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang mkhas pa rnams kyis skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i dngos po tsam la sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang mkhas pa rnams kyis skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i dngos po tsam la sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù is used by the wise to refer to the mere fact that things do not remain after they have arisen.

original: de la de lta bur gur pi dngos po la skad cig ma'i sgras brjod bar 'dod pa na rkyen dang bcas pa skad cig ma'i sgra 'am rkyen dang bral ba yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la de lta bur gur pi dngos po la skad cig ma'i sgras brjod bar 'dod pa na rkyen dang bcas pa skad cig ma'i sgra 'am rkyen dang bral ba yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In that case, when one wishes to express the fact that things are momentary, one should use the word ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù with the suffix or without the suffix.

original: kho bo cag ni 'dod pa tsam gyi ngor byed pa'i brda tsam gyi tshig 'di la shin tu gus pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'dod pa tsam gyi ngor byed pa'i brda tsam gyi tshig 'di la shin tu gus pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: We do not have great respect for these words, which are mere conventions used according to one‚Äôs wish.

original: skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù in the line ‚Äúmere non-enduring after arising‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù in the line ‚Äúthus, they are momentary‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: This is what is meant by the term ‚Äúmomentary.‚Äù

original: rkyen dang lhan cig ldan pa'i don gyis 'jug pas na rkyen bcas so //
analyzed: rkyen dang lhan cig ldan pa'i don gyis 'jug pas na rkyen bcas so //
translated: The term ‚Äúalong with‚Äù means that the object is engaged in conjunction with conditions.

original: de ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa byas pa nyid du khas blangs ba na nges pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa byas pa nyid du khas blangs ba na nges pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated that if space and so on are accepted as produced, they are the objects of indeterminate verbal conventions,

original: da ni yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa na 'di dag skad cig ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa na 'di dag skad cig ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: now, in order to prove that if they are accepted as existent, it follows that they are momentary, he says, ‚ÄúIf space and so on are existent,‚Äù and so on.

original: byas pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni byas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byas pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni byas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the produced‚Äù means ‚Äúas in the case of the produced.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di zur gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di zur gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This indirectly presents the reason, ‚Äúbecause they exist.‚Äù

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever exists is momentary.

original: dper na de ma thag tu bsgrub pa'i skad cig ma'i dngos po rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de ma thag tu bsgrub pa'i skad cig ma'i dngos po rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the things that are momentary entities that are being established right now.

original: khyed cag gis dngos por 'dod pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa yang yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: khyed cag gis dngos por 'dod pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa yang yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The space, etc. that you assert to be entities also exist. This is a reason from the nature of things.

original: de ltar grub ces bya ba na'i skad cig ma @233a * //
analyzed: de ltar grub ces bya ba na'i skad cig ma @233a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way, it is established‚Äù means in terms of momentariness.

original: nyid du'o // 'dis ni bsgrub bya ma tshang ba'i dpe yin par dogs bar mi bya bar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: nyid du'o // 'dis ni bsgrub bya ma tshang ba'i dpe yin par dogs bar mi bya bar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the example is not incomplete with respect to the probandum, because it has already been established.

original: khyed kyis yong bar 'dod ces bya ba 'dis ni 'di thal bar sgrub pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: khyed kyis yong bar 'dod ces bya ba 'dis ni 'di thal bar sgrub pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat you assert to be existent‚Äù shows that this is an argument by reductio.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be the case that any reason would be unestablished.

original: yang ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di'i khyab pa grub ce na /üîΩskad cig ma dang bral ba na //
analyzed: yang ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di'i khyab pa grub ce na / skad cig ma dang bral ba na //
translated: How is the pervasion of this reason established?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf it is free from momentariness . . .‚Äù

original: 'di la don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di la don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod la /
translated: Here, the existence that has the characteristic of being able to perform a function is asserted to be the reason.

original: de yang skad cig ma log pa na ldog ste /
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma log pa na ldog ste /
translated: Moreover, when the moment ceases, it ceases.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams don bya ba byed pa na rim gyis byed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams don bya ba byed pa na rim gyis byed dam /
translated: In this way, when things perform a function, do they perform it gradually?

original: cig car du byed /
analyzed: cig car du byed /
translated: Or do they perform it all at once?

original: rim dang cig car dag las rnam pa gzhan srid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag las rnam pa gzhan srid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for there to be a mode other than gradual and all at once,

original: de dag ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di yang mngon sum nyid kyis grub ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mngon sum nyid kyis grub ste /
translated: This is also established by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar bum pa sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa dang de las gzhan pa'i rdzas dag tha mi dad par ma 'dres par rim gyis 'dzin pa dang / rang gi shes pa dang chu 'dzin pa cig car byed par mngon sum nyid kyi yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa dang de las gzhan pa'i rdzas dag tha mi dad par ma 'dres par rim gyis 'dzin pa dang / rang gi shes pa dang chu 'dzin pa cig car byed par mngon sum nyid kyi yongs su gcod do //
translated: In this way, directly perceiving the vase as gradually holding honey, water, and so on, and as not mixing with other substances, and directly perceiving the cognition that apprehends the water as occurring all at once, it is ascertained.

original: de la gang gi tshe bum pa 'am rdza mkhan 'bras bu'i khyad par kham phor dang blugs ma la sogs pa rim gyis byed pa dmigs pa de nyid kyi tshe de dag cig car skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe bum pa 'am rdza mkhan 'bras bu'i khyad par kham phor dang blugs ma la sogs pa rim gyis byed pa dmigs pa de nyid kyi tshe de dag cig car skyed par mi nus so //
translated: In that case, when a pot or a potter is observed to gradually produce a specific effect, such as a bowl or a saucer, at that very time they are not able to produce them simultaneously.

original: gang kho na'i tshe rang gi yul can gyi shes pa la sogs pa cig car skyed par dmigs pa de kho na'i tshe de dag rim gyis ma yin no zhes 'di thams cad mngon sum nyid kyis nges so //
analyzed: gang kho na'i tshe rang gi yul can gyi shes pa la sogs pa cig car skyed par dmigs pa de kho na'i tshe de dag rim gyis ma yin no zhes 'di thams cad mngon sum nyid kyis nges so //
translated: When it is observed that the object-possessor, such as consciousness, is able to produce its object simultaneously, at that very time they are not produced gradually. All of this is ascertained by perception itself.

original: de'i phyir rim pa ni cig car rnam par gcad pa nyid kyis yongs su gcod pa'i phyir dang / cig car yang rim pa rnam par gcad pa nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig 'jug pa na gnyis las gzhan yongs su gcod cing de las gzhan mi mthun pa rnam par gcod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rim pa ni cig car rnam par gcad pa nyid kyis yongs su gcod pa'i phyir dang / cig car yang rim pa rnam par gcad pa nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig 'jug pa na gnyis las gzhan yongs su gcod cing de las gzhan mi mthun pa rnam par gcod la /
translated: Therefore, since gradualness is determined by the exclusion of simultaneity, and simultaneity is determined by the exclusion of gradualness, when one valid cognition engages, it determines the exclusion of the other, and it excludes the incompatible with that.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang med par ston pa yin pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyis nges te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang med par ston pa yin pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyis nges te /
translated: Since it shows that there is no other mode, it is ascertained by the valid cognition of perception.

original: 'di dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
translated: These are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive.

original: des na phung po gsum pa med pa'i phyir rim dang cig car dag gi don byed pa la khyab la /
analyzed: des na phung po gsum pa med pa'i phyir rim dang cig car dag gi don byed pa la khyab la /
translated: Therefore, since a third possibility does not exist, the pervasion is established that sequential and simultaneous performance are mutually exclusive.

original: de yang bstan pa'i dngos po rnams la rang gi khyab par byed pa ldog pa na de'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa bzlog bzhin par ldog par byed pa'i phyir khyab pa grub @233b po ;
analyzed: de yang bstan pa'i dngos po rnams la rang gi khyab par byed pa ldog pa na de'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa bzlog bzhin par ldog par byed pa'i phyir khyab pa grub @233b po ;
translated: Moreover, when the property that pervades is eliminated in regard to the things that are the substrata of the teaching, the property that is pervaded is eliminated because it is characterized by that.

original: / dus kyi dngos po tha dad pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rim dang cig car ba nyid ma grub ces bya ba 'di ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: / dus kyi dngos po tha dad pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rim dang cig car ba nyid ma grub ces bya ba 'di ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the sequential and simultaneous performance of things is not established because the different temporal entities are not accepted.

original: kho bo cag ni dngos po rnams kyi rim dang cig car don gzhan du gyur ba'i dus kyi dngos pos byas par mi smra'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni dngos po rnams kyi rim dang cig car don gzhan du gyur ba'i dus kyi dngos pos byas par mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that the sequential and simultaneous performance of things is produced by a different temporal entity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de lta de ltar skyes pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta de ltar skyes pas byas pa yin te /
translated: It is produced by the arising of things in that way.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe gcig yod pa nyams su myong ba de kho na'i tshe gzhan gang yin pa yang de bzhin du de'i rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe gcig yod pa nyams su myong ba de kho na'i tshe gzhan gang yin pa yang de bzhin du de'i rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, when one of them is experienced, then the other one which is present at that time is also experienced in the same way.

original: de dag thams cad nyid de bzhin du skye ba na rim ma yin pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad nyid de bzhin du skye ba na rim ma yin pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: All of them are the basis for the convention of non-simultaneity, since they arise in that way.

original: 'di lta ste dper na tshogs pa'i tshogs las myu gu mang po skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na tshogs pa'i tshogs las myu gu mang po skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, many sprouts arise from a collection of causes.

original: bzlog pa ni rim pa'i tha snyad la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni rim pa'i tha snyad la brten pa yin te /
translated: The opposite is the basis for the convention of sequence.

original: myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a sprout, a stalk, leaves, and so on.

original: 'di dag kyang mngon sum nyid kyis grub la /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang mngon sum nyid kyis grub la /
translated: These are established by direct perception,

original: skye bo rnams kyis kyang de kho na bzhin du tha snyad du byed do //üîΩde lta bur gyur pa'i don gyi yul gyi dngos po yang rgyu'i bya ba yin la /
analyzed: skye bo rnams kyis kyang de kho na bzhin du tha snyad du byed do // de lta bur gyur pa'i don gyi yul gyi dngos po yang rgyu'i bya ba yin la /
translated: and people make conventions in accordance with them.üîΩThe object of such a thing is the activity of the cause,

original: de'i yul yin pa nyid kyis rim dang cig car dag gi tha snyad kyi byed pa yin pas rtsod pa 'di med do //
analyzed: de'i yul yin pa nyid kyis rim dang cig car dag gi tha snyad kyi byed pa yin pas rtsod pa 'di med do //
translated: and since it is the object of that, it is the basis for the conventions of sequence and simultaneity. Therefore, there is no dispute.

original: 'on te brten pa'i dngos po grub par gyur na de'i tshe de la rim dang cig car log na don byed par nus pa ldog par 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te brten pa'i dngos po grub par gyur na de'i tshe de la rim dang cig car log na don byed par nus pa ldog par 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if the basis of the dependent were established, then at that time, if it were refuted either gradually or instantaneously, would it not be established that the capacity to perform a function is refuted?

original: dper na chos can gyi phyogs 'ga' zhig tu shing log na shing sha pa ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chos can gyi phyogs 'ga' zhig tu shing log na shing sha pa ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, if a tree is refuted in some part of the locus, then a bilva tree is refuted.

original: de lta ma yin te chos can sa phyogs ma grub na gang du shing sha pa med par rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te chos can sa phyogs ma grub na gang du shing sha pa med par rtogs par byed /
translated: If that were not so, if the locus, the ground, were not established, then in what would one understand that a bilva tree does not exist?

original: 'di grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not established either,

original: de nyid dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is just that which is to be refuted.

original: ci ste yang grub par khas len na 'o na de spang bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: ci ste yang grub par khas len na 'o na de spang bar mi rigs te /
translated: But if you accept that it is established, then it is not right to refute it,

original: de chos can gyi ngo bor grub par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de chos can gyi ngo bor grub par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that it is established as the nature of the locus.

original: de lta yin dang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na yin te /
translated: If that were so, then this reason, ‚Äúbecause it exists,‚Äù would be indefinite,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'ang 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'ang 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because it would also apply to the discordant side.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: kho bo cag gis rang rgyud kyi tshad ma nyid kyis bkag pa sgrub par byed pa'i khyab byed mi dmigs pa 'di sbyor bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rang rgyud kyi tshad ma nyid kyis bkag pa sgrub par byed pa'i khyab byed mi dmigs pa 'di sbyor bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not employ this reason, the nonobservation of a more extensive phenomenon, to prove that something is refuted by our own valid cognition.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we use it for?

original: gzhan la thal ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la thal ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: We use it to prove the absurd consequence for the opponent.

original: gal te khyed cag 'di dag brtan pa'i dngos po nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe don byed nus pa yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag 'di dag brtan pa'i dngos po nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe don byed nus pa yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: If you accept that these things are stable entities, then you cannot accept that they are able to perform functions.

original: de la rim dang cig car dang ldan pa de'i khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyab par @234a * //
analyzed: de la rim dang cig car dang ldan pa de'i khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // khyab par @234a * //
translated: This is because sequential, simultaneous, and inhering are the pervaders of that.

original: byed pa log pa na khyab par bya ba gnas par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa log pa na khyab par bya ba gnas par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When the pervader is refuted, the pervaded cannot remain.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then they would not be the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de lta na yin dang don byed par nus par log na de dag gi yod pa yang khas blang par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yin dang don byed par nus par log na de dag gi yod pa yang khas blang par mi bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then when the ability to perform a function is refuted, their existence cannot be accepted.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i thabs 'dis de dag med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i thabs 'dis de dag med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Because the definition of existence is the ability to perform a function, this method teaches that they are nonexistent.

original: chos mi mthun pa can gyi dpe yang gdon mi za bar dngos por gyur pa'i chos la brten par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa can gyi dpe yang gdon mi za bar dngos por gyur pa'i chos la brten par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And a dissimilar example does not necessarily depend on a phenomenon that is an entity,

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba log na sgrub par byed pa ldog pa tsam bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba log na sgrub par byed pa ldog pa tsam bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely taught that when the probandum is reversed, the proof is reversed, and it is desired to teach that.

original: de yang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos dag khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub na /
analyzed: de yang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos dag khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub na /
translated: And that is established as the pervasion of the property of the probandum and the property of the reason, and

original: chos can gyi khyab par yongs su bzung ba med pa nyid du spyir khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba yang med par 'gyur ro zhes tshig tsam nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos can gyi khyab par yongs su bzung ba med pa nyid du spyir khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba yang med par 'gyur ro zhes tshig tsam nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: when the pervader is absent, the pervaded is necessarily absent. This is understood merely by the words, ‚ÄúIf there is no tree, there is no shinshapa.‚Äù

original: dper na shing med na shing sha pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing med na shing sha pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúIf there is no tree, there is no shinshapa.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de'i phyir chos mi mthun dpe la //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mi mthun dpe la //
translated: Therefore, in the case of an example of a dissimilar instance,

original: nges par 'di la gzhi mi 'dod //
analyzed: nges par 'di la gzhi mi 'dod //
translated: a basis is not admitted in this case.üîΩBecause it is understood from the statement,

original: de dag med na de med ces //üîΩbrjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir //
analyzed: de dag med na de med ces // brjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúIf those do not exist, this does not exist,‚Äù

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is like that.

original: re zhig bstan pa'i dngos po rim gyis don byed par rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni ;
analyzed: re zhig bstan pa'i dngos po rim gyis don byed par rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni ;
translated: To show that it is not reasonable for the things that are taught to function gradually, he says,

original: rgyu rnams nye ba ma yin phyir //
analyzed: rgyu rnams nye ba ma yin phyir //
translated: Because the causes are not present,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: 'bras bu rang gi 'dod pas yod pa dang med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rang gi 'dod pas yod pa dang med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The existence and nonexistence of the effect is not according to one‚Äôs desire.

original: 'on kyang de'i yod pa dang med pa dag ni rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i yod pa dang med pa dag ni rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
translated: However, its existence and nonexistence follow from the existence and nonexistence of the cause.

original: de la gal te brtan pa gcig bu'i ngo bo 'di thams cad du 'bras bu 'di thams cad kyi skyed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bos gnas pa yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir de yod pa tsam don du gnyer ba 'bras bu thams cad cig car skyed par mi byed
analyzed: de la gal te brtan pa gcig bu'i ngo bo 'di thams cad du 'bras bu 'di thams cad kyi skyed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bos gnas pa yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir de yod pa tsam don du gnyer ba 'bras bu thams cad cig car skyed par mi byed
translated: If the nature of a single enduring entity is the cause that produces all these effects in every way, then why does it not produce all effects simultaneously, just by its presence?

original: / gang gis na rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: / gang gis na rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could it arise in sequence?

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGoing‚Äù means to remain.

original: des na de'i 'bras bu phyis 'byung par 'gyur ba yang dang po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de'i 'bras bu phyis 'byung par 'gyur ba yang dang po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the effect that arises later would exist at the very beginning,

original: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no snyam du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no snyam du dogs pa'o //
translated: because the cause would be unobstructed in its power, like the effect that is desired.üîΩBut if, etc.

original: 'on te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi las kyi dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi las kyi dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: is a response to the objection of the other party.

original: brtan pa'i dngos po thams cad 'bras bu thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du nye ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: brtan pa'i dngos po thams cad 'bras bu thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du nye ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although all enduring things are the cause of all effects,

original: 'on kyang de'i lhan cig byed pa rim gyis nye bar @234b 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i lhan cig byed pa rim gyis nye bar @234b 'gyur te /
translated: nevertheless, its cooperating conditions arise in sequence.üîΩTherefore, in dependence on that, it gradually produces its effect.

original: de'i phyir 'di de la ltos nas 'di rim gyis 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na de legs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di de la ltos nas 'di rim gyis 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na de legs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: To that, the response is: ‚ÄúThat is not so, etc.

original: rtag pa de la lhan cig byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa de la lhan cig byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äù That permanent thing has no cooperating conditions at all.

original: 'di ltar dper na sa bon bang ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la sogs pa lta bur khyad par byed pa'i lhan cig pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na sa bon bang ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la sogs pa lta bur khyad par byed pa'i lhan cig pa yin nam /
translated: For example, it is like the conditions that create the specific states of a seed, such as being in a granary, etc.

original: ji ltar phye ba tsam gyis gzugs mthong ba la mig dang gzugs la sogs pa lta bur don gcig byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar phye ba tsam gyis gzugs mthong ba la mig dang gzugs la sogs pa lta bur don gcig byed pa yin /
translated: Or, like the eye and form, etc., it is a single object that is seen by the mere opening of the eye.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first possibility is not so,
