original: 'di ltar khyad par 'di de'i lhan cig byed pa dag gis byed pa na res 'ga' rang bzhin de las tha mi dad par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par 'di de'i lhan cig byed pa dag gis byed pa na res 'ga' rang bzhin de las tha mi dad par gyur pa'am /
translated: because when the specific states of the seed are created by its cooperative conditions, sometimes it is not different from its nature,

original: tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: tha dad pa'am /
translated: sometimes it is different,üîΩor, like the sky-clad, it is both,

original: yang na nam mkha'i gos can pa dag smra ba bzhin du gnyi ga 'am /üîΩgnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin zhes bya ba phyogs bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha'i gos can pa dag smra ba bzhin du gnyi ga 'am / gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin zhes bya ba phyogs bzhi'o //
translated: or it is neither.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first possibility is not so,

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa nyid kyis de yang rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir dang / yod pa yang byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa nyid kyis de yang rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir dang / yod pa yang byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be permanent, like its own nature, because it would always exist, since it is not different from that, and because it is not logical that what exists is produced.

original: de byed na yang de kho na bzhin du dngos po yang byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byed na yang de kho na bzhin du dngos po yang byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it were produced, then it would follow that the thing itself would be produced in just the same way.

original: de lta bas na rtag pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa nyid nyams so //
translated: Thus permanence is undermined.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe khyad par kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir dngos po rgyu nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe khyad par kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir dngos po rgyu nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the second alternative is that the thing itself is the cause, then it follows that the thing itself is not the cause, because the effect arises from the specific property alone.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the permanent thing.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni de yod pa na 'bras bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni de yod pa na 'bras bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis itself‚Äù is clarified by ‚Äúwhen it exists, the effects,‚Äù and so on.

original: de yod pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par yod pa na'o //
analyzed: de yod pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par yod pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it exists‚Äù means when the specific property exists.

original: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the specific property.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus is because it follows the concomitance and reverse concomitance there.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: But, etc. introduces the doubt of others about this.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang ngo //
translated: That, etc. is the distinction.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la'o //
translated: And that, etc. is the permanent.

original: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad do ;
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad do ;
translated: The answer to that is given by That connection, etc.

original: /'brel pa gang yin te /
analyzed: /'brel pa gang yin te /
translated: What connection is there?

original: cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: None at all is the meaning.

original: 'brel pa ni gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gnyis kho na ste /
translated: There are only two kinds of connection:

original: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'o //
translated: identity and origination from it.

original: de la re zhig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: First, the characteristic of identity is not the case,

original: tha dad du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because difference is accepted.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin @235a * //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin @235a * //
translated: Nor is the characteristic of origination from it the case,

original: te ; lhan cig byed pa dag kho na las de skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; lhan cig byed pa dag kho na las de skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises only from the co-operating causes.

original: ci ste de las de skye ngar khas len par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste de las de skye ngar khas len par byed na /
translated: If you accept that the effect arises from that cause,

original: de'i tshe de tsam de las byung ba yin pas khyad par rnams cig car nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de tsam de las byung ba yin pas khyad par rnams cig car nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then since it arises from just that, the differences would arise simultaneously.

original: de lta yin dang 'bras bu thams cad cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'bras bu thams cad cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would follow that all effects would arise simultaneously,

original: khyad par dang ldan pa'i rgyu thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa'i rgyu thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause possessing the differences would always be present.

original: ci ste khyad par skyed pa de la yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir khyad par rim gyis skyed pas 'bras bu rnams cig car 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: ci ste khyad par skyed pa de la yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir khyad par rim gyis skyed pas 'bras bu rnams cig car 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na ni mi rigs te /
translated: But if you think that since the arising of the differences depends on the cooperative conditions, the differences arise sequentially and the effects do not arise simultaneously, that is illogical.

original: de lta na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because in that case there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa rnams khyad par gzhan byed pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa rnams khyad par gzhan byed pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Thus, because the cooperative conditions would have to be stated as the cooperative conditions for the arising of the other differences.

original: khyad par de yang tha dad pa nyid yin na 'brel ba grub bo //
analyzed: khyad par de yang tha dad pa nyid yin na 'brel ba grub bo //
translated: And if that difference is different, then the connection is established.

original: de las byung ba yin na cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba yin na cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arises from that, then it follows that it would arise simultaneously.

original: de la yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos so snyam pa 'di nyid yang 'jug go //
analyzed: de la yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos so snyam pa 'di nyid yang 'jug go //
translated: If you think that it depends on the cooperating causes, then this very same question will arise again.

original: de lta yin dang thug pa med pa yin na res 'ga' yang khyad par dang lhan cig ste 'brel pa grub par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang thug pa med pa yin na res 'ga' yang khyad par dang lhan cig ste 'brel pa grub par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If that were the case, there would be an infinite regress, and the difference would never be established, i.e., never be related to the effect.

original: de ma grub na de las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma grub na de las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin te /
translated: If that is not established, then the effect does not arise from that.

original: khyad par nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect arises from the difference itself.

original: ci ste yang de ni khyad par dang lhan cig de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang de ni khyad par dang lhan cig de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you think that the difference does not have the relation of arising from that, which is related to the difference,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: de ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: It is the relation of inherence.

original: rtag pa'i chos can de la khyad par de 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos can de la khyad par de 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference inheres in the permanent thing.

original: de 'dir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'dir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this is not reasonable here, he says,

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd in that case, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar min zhes bya ba ni phan par byed pa ma yin pa de la de'i 'du bar byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar min zhes bya ba ni phan par byed pa ma yin pa de la de'i 'du bar byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot so‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthat which does not benefit is not its basis.‚Äù

original: de la phyogs dang po la phan 'dogs pa ni phan gdags par bya ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de las byung pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa de nyid khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la phan 'dogs pa ni phan gdags par bya ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de las byung pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa de nyid khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: In the first case, since the benefit is not different from the one who is benefited, the relation of origination would have to be accepted as the characteristic of the basis.

original: de yang de ma thag tu bsal zin to //
analyzed: de yang de ma thag tu bsal zin to //
translated: But that has just been refuted.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyi 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyi 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the second case is accepted, then everything would be the basis of everything, because there would be no difference.

original: de ston par byed pa ni gal te de ni 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa ni gal te de ni 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is not a basis because it does not benefit, then it is not a basis even in this case.‚Äù

original: de nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin du phan mi 'dogs pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin du phan mi 'dogs pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù means that there is no difference in not benefiting, just like the entity that is not desired.üîΩNow, with regard to the fourth alternative, which is neither, he says,

original: tha dad @235b tha dad med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad @235b tha dad med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text states, ‚Äúdifferent, not different, and so on.‚Äù

original: phyogs re re bsal ba nyid kyis gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs kyang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: phyogs re re bsal ba nyid kyis gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs kyang bsal ba yin te /
translated: The position that is the nature of both is also refuted by the refutation of each of the two positions.

original: de las ma gtogs pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no position that is the nature of both apart from those two.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gcig len pa dang gtong ba dag ni de las gzhan gyi rnam pa gtong ba dang len pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gcig len pa dang gtong ba dag ni de las gzhan gyi rnam pa gtong ba dang len pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the two positions of accepting and rejecting are not tenable because accepting and rejecting are not tenable apart from the other.

original: dngos po yod pa la ni gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la ni gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that an existent thing has the nature of both or neither.

original: gcig la gcig gi tshe sgrub pa dang dgag pa phan tshun 'gal ba gnyis rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig gi tshe sgrub pa dang dgag pa phan tshun 'gal ba gnyis rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable that the two mutually exclusive actions of affirming and negating are performed with regard to a single basis,

original: gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that singularity would be undermined.

original: 'di yang gang zag la sogs pa brtag par bstan zin pa dang / de ston pa ni gang zag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gang zag la sogs pa brtag par bstan zin pa dang / de ston pa ni gang zag la sogs pa'o //
translated: This has already been taught in the examination of the person and so on, and the teacher of that is the person and so on.

original: ci ste don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa la de'i lhan cig byed pa yin no zhes phyogs gnyis pa la brtan pa yin na ji skad du kha cig 'di lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa la de'i lhan cig byed pa yin no zhes phyogs gnyis pa la brtan pa yin na ji skad du kha cig 'di lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ma yin la /
translated: But if the second position is maintained, that is, that it is the cause of a single action, then how could it be a co-operating cause?

original: lhan cig byed ba dang bral ba la 'bras bu'i byed pa po yang med de /
analyzed: lhan cig byed ba dang bral ba la 'bras bu'i byed pa po yang med de /
translated: And if it is not a co-operating cause, then it is not an agent of the effect.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu mtha' dag nye ba na mtha'i rgyu bzhin du byed pa po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu mtha' dag nye ba na mtha'i rgyu bzhin du byed pa po yin gyi /
translated: For, if all the co-operating causes are present, then the cause is an agent, like the final cause.

original: 'ga' zhig pa ni ma yin pa de'i rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba thog ma med pa nas grub pa yin no //üîΩdes na de yod na yang thams cad du 'bras bu skyed par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de 'dir ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig pa ni ma yin pa de'i rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba thog ma med pa nas grub pa yin no // des na de yod na yang thams cad du 'bras bu skyed par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de 'dir ston par byed pa ni /
translated: But if some of the co-operating causes are absent, then it is not an agent. This is the nature of the cause, which has existed since beginningless time.üîΩTherefore, even if it exists, it does not follow that it always produces an effect.

original: rtag pa lhan cig byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa lhan cig byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is what is being shown by the statement: ‚ÄúIf it is permanent, it is not a co-operating cause.‚Äù

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni byed pa po zhes bya ba 'di dang sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni byed pa po zhes bya ba 'di dang sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot‚Äù is to be construed with ‚Äúagent.‚Äù

original: mtha' rgyu bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: mtha' rgyu bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The example of the potter is a dissimilar example.

original: yang na 'og gi byed pa po nyid yin zhes bya ba 'di dang sbrel la chos mthun pa'i dper bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'og gi byed pa po nyid yin zhes bya ba 'di dang sbrel la chos mthun pa'i dper bya'o //
translated: Or else, this should be connected with ‚Äúthe agent is below‚Äù and it should be taken as a similar example.

original: bzhin ni drug pa'i mtha' can du bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin ni drug pa'i mtha' can du bya'o //
translated: The suffix -in should be added to the root bh≈´.

original: de yod nyid na zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin de yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: de yod nyid na zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin de yod na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it exists‚Äù means if the intrinsic reality of things exists.

original: de lta yin mod ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de lta yin mod ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if that is so‚Äù and so forth responds to that.

original: de ltar brtag pa de yin du chug mod /
analyzed: de ltar brtag pa de yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if that analysis is so,

original: 'on kyang 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: nevertheless, this should be investigated here:

original: de'i lhan cig byed pa tshang ba'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid ci ma tshad ba'i gnas skabs yin nam /
analyzed: de'i lhan cig byed pa tshang ba'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid ci ma tshad ba'i gnas skabs yin nam /
translated: Is that very intrinsic reality of the state in which its cooperating conditions are complete the intrinsic reality of the state in which they are not complete,

original: 'on te gzhan yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin /
translated: or is it different?

original: gal te de nyid yin na de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa rnams dang rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de nyid yin na de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa rnams dang rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is that very intrinsic reality, then at that time it would always have cooperating conditions.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de 'brel rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de 'brel rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf it is related to that intrinsic reality,‚Äù and so on.

original: lhan cig byed pa @236a * //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa @236a * //
translated: and the co-operating causes.

original: de dag dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod ces tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod ces tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The nature of that which is related to those is the nature of the effect.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa rnams te /üîΩlcags su bcug pa'i skyes bu bkug na /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa rnams te / lcags su bcug pa'i skyes bu bkug na /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the co-operating causes.

original: lcags kyang bkug pa bzhin du de dag kyang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lcags kyang bkug pa bzhin du de dag kyang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as when a man is pulled by being hooked with a goad, the iron is also pulled, so too, they are engaged.

original: de lta yin na ni de nyid rang bzhin snga ma ma btang bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin mi 'dor na de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ma dor ba na shugs kyis lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang mi 'dor te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni de nyid rang bzhin snga ma ma btang bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro // gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin mi 'dor na de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ma dor ba na shugs kyis lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang mi 'dor te /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the nature of the effect would be engaged without relinquishing its prior nature.

original: 'brel pa can nyid ni gnyis pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can nyid ni gnyis pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the nature of the effect is related to the co-operating causes and does not relinquish that, then it follows that it does not relinquish the co-operating causes, because the related itself depends on the second.

original: de lta ma yin na de nyid de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de nyid de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then it would not be its nature.

original: 'on te gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: But if the position is that the effect is different from the co-operating causes,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: then we reply:

original: gal te ma tshang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te ma tshang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you say that it is incomplete, etc.

original: gal te 'di'i lhan cig byed pa ma tshang pa'i ngo bo gzhan yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /üîΩde'i tshe rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i lhan cig byed pa ma tshang pa'i ngo bo gzhan yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na / de'i tshe rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the nature of the effect is incomplete in the cause,

original: ngo bo dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta bas na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos pa yin na yang bstan pa /
analyzed: ngo bo dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro // de lta bas na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos pa yin na yang bstan pa /
translated: then it follows that it is impermanent, because the nature is not different from the thing.üîΩTherefore, even if it is dependent on the cooperating causes, it is not reasonable

original: rim gyis don byed par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rim gyis don byed par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: that the effect is produced gradually.

original: cig car yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: cig car yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: And it is not produced all at once, as is shown by the following.

original: de yi 'bras bu cig car du //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu cig car du //
translated: The effect of that is not all at once,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: gzhan gyis rtag pa'i dngos po'i 'bras bu cig car ba nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtag pa'i dngos po'i 'bras bu cig car ba nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: Others do not accept that the effect of a permanent thing is produced all at once.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa dag gi 'bras bu ni 'di dag yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa dag gi 'bras bu ni 'di dag yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the effect of the permanent is said to be the following:

original: bdag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: one‚Äôs own pleasure, pain, etc.

original: nam mkha'i ni sgra'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ni sgra'o //
translated: The effect of space is sound.

original: yid kyi ni shes pa rim pas 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: yid kyi ni shes pa rim pas 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: The effect of mind is the gradual engagement of consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi ni rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rags pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi ni rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rags pa rnams so //
translated: In the case of atoms, the gross objects are produced by the gradual addition of a second atom and so on.

original: dus dang phyogs dang dbang phyug rnams kyi ni skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad do //
analyzed: dus dang phyogs dang dbang phyug rnams kyi ni skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad do //
translated: In the case of time, place, and God, all things that are produced are produced.

original: 'di dag kyang rim gyis skye bar mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang rim gyis skye bar mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
translated: And these are also produced gradually, as is established by perception itself.

original: de'i phyir de ltar cig car bar khas blangs na mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang / khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar yang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar cig car bar khas blangs na mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang / khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar yang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if you accept that things are produced all at once, you contradict both perception and your own beliefs.

original: da ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the contradiction with inference, he says:

original: gal te 'bras bu mtha' dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mtha' dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the effect were produced all at once,üîΩthen the nature of the cause would be reversible,üîΩor else, it would not produce the effect later on.üîΩIf the effect were produced all at once, then by what would the cause produce the effect later on?

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu mtha' dag cig car byas nas gang gis dus phyis kyang 'bras bu dag skyed par mi byed pa de'i don byed pa'i rang @236b bzhin te ldog pa yin nam /üîΩ'o na te rjes su 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu mtha' dag cig car byas nas gang gis dus phyis kyang 'bras bu dag skyed par mi byed pa de'i don byed pa'i rang @236b bzhin te ldog pa yin nam /üîΩ'o na te rjes su 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the nature of the cause would be reversible, or else, it would not produce the effect later on.

original: de la gal te ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: If the position is that it will cease,

original: de'i tshe de'i skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid grub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid grub ste /
translated: then the momentariness of its disintegration is established,

original: skad cig re re ra rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir dang / snga ma snga ma'i rang bzhin rang gi dang gis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re ra rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir dang / snga ma snga ma'i rang bzhin rang gi dang gis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced with a different nature at each instant and because the prior nature is destroyed by itself.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis la rten par byed na de'i tshe de'i ngo bo nus pa'i bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa na yang 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis la rten par byed na de'i tshe de'i ngo bo nus pa'i bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa na yang 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is maintained that it is based on both positions, then when it is engaged in the nature of potentiality, it will produce an effect,

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du sngar gyi rang bzhin ma dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du sngar gyi rang bzhin ma dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not discard its prior nature, as it was before.

original: de ltar yin dang de nyid rim gyis skyed pa yin pa'i phyir cig car bar khas blangs pa rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de nyid rim gyis skyed pa yin pa'i phyir cig car bar khas blangs pa rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: If that were so, it would be produced gradually, and the assertion that it is produced all at once would contradict inference.

original: ci ste yang de rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa ma yin du chug mod /
analyzed: ci ste yang de rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa ma yin du chug mod /
translated: But even if it is not tenable that it performs a function gradually or all at once,

original: de lta na yang 'di nus pa yod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di nus pa yod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it does have the capacity,

original: cung zad mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cung zad mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: It does not perform even the slightest function.

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'bras bu skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'bras bu skyed pa yin na /
translated: The reason for positing the capacity of things is that they produce effects.

original: gang yang cung zad kyang mi byed pa de nus par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang cung zad kyang mi byed pa de nus par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But how could that which does not perform even the slightest function have the capacity?üîΩIf it were otherwise, then why would you not also posit that a sky flower has the capacity?

original: de lta ma yin na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir nus par rnam par mi 'jog / gal te 'di snyam du 'di la nus pa ldog pa de lta na yang yod pa nyid ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir nus par rnam par mi 'jog / gal te 'di snyam du 'di la nus pa ldog pa de lta na yang yod pa nyid ldog pa med do //
translated: But if you think that although the capacity is eliminated in this way, existence is not eliminated,

original: de lta yin dang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du sems na /üîΩskad cig ma yin thams cad med //
analyzed: de lta yin dang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du sems na / skad cig ma yin thams cad med //
translated: and if you think that the reason ‚Äúbecause it exists‚Äù is not indeterminate,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: All things are momentary and nonexistent.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta bu yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta bu yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The definition of a thing is this:

original: don byed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: don byed par nus pa'o //
translated: It is that which is able to perform a function.

original: gla te de ldog na ji ltar de'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po nyid de dag la gnas pa rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gla te de ldog na ji ltar de'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po nyid de dag la gnas pa rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: If it is stopped, how could it be found to exist as the entity characterized by that?

original: de'i phyir de ltar skad cig ma nyid ma yin par 'dod pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed par nus pas stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skad cig ma nyid ma yin par 'dod pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed par nus pas stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in this way, space and so on, which are asserted not to be momentary, are empty of the ability to perform a function either sequentially or non-sequentially.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po ;
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po ;
translated: Therefore, it is established that they are suitable to be designated as nonexistent, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: / ci ste yang gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid don byed par nus pa kho na yin par gyur na de'i tshe 'di thams cad mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: / ci ste yang gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid don byed par nus pa kho na yin par gyur na de'i tshe 'di thams cad mdzes pa yin no //
translated: But if the characteristic of a thing is only the ability to perform a function, then at that time this is all very nice.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na dngos po'i mtshan nyid gzhan gang yin pa brjod dgos te /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na dngos po'i mtshan nyid gzhan gang yin pa brjod dgos te /
translated: But if that is not so, then you must state what the characteristic of a thing is.

original: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dngos po med par 'dod pa de la rgyu mtshan @237a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dngos po med par 'dod pa de la rgyu mtshan @237a * //
translated: In this way, whatever is asserted to be a nonexistent thing, such as the horn of a rabbit, is not suitable to be a cause.

original: ni don byed par nus pa dang bral ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: ni don byed par nus pa dang bral ba kho na yin te /
translated: It is only devoid of the ability to perform a function.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because things and non-things are essentially mutually exclusive.

original: shugs kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid las bzlog pa don byed par nus pa kho na'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du gnas so snyam du dgongs pa'o ;
analyzed: shugs kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid las bzlog pa don byed par nus pa kho na'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du gnas so snyam du dgongs pa'o ;
translated: The meaning is that the definition of non-thing is implicitly the opposite of that, and the definition of thing is only that which is able to perform a function.

original: /'di la gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: /'di la gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Here, anticipating an objection by another, he says,

original: gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If the definition of thing is . . .

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid don byed par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid don byed par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The definition of thing is not the ability to perform a function.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩyod pa dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / yod pa dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: Well then, what is it?üîΩIt is the connection with existence.

original: yod pa dang 'du ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa dang 'du ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with the conjunction with existence.

original: de min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that is not so,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: the remainder is ‚Äúit is not logical as the definition of thing.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'du ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni yod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'du ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni yod pa gzung ngo //
translated: because the collection, etc. are not established. The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes existence.

original: gal te yod pa'am yod pa dang 'du ba grub par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po'i mtshan nyid yod pa dang 'du ba yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'am yod pa dang 'du ba grub par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po'i mtshan nyid yod pa dang 'du ba yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If existence or the collection were established, then at that time the characteristic of a thing would be existence or the collection.

original: gang gi phyir de dag nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But because it is the occasion to prove just those, and because there is a valid cognition that refutes them, as will be explained.

original: yang na sngar bshad pa nyid kyis gnod par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yod pa'i phyir 'du ba ma grub po //
analyzed: yang na sngar bshad pa nyid kyis gnod par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yod pa'i phyir 'du ba ma grub po //
translated: Or, because of the refutation explained previously, there is a valid cognition that refutes them. Therefore the collection is not established.

original: yod pa ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'brel pa ma grub pa de ni phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'brel pa ma grub pa de ni phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Existence is not established as related to anything at all, because it is not something to be benefited.

original: phan tshun du phan mi 'dogs pa dag ni 'brel par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun du phan mi 'dogs pa dag ni 'brel par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that those which do not benefit each other are related,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: gzhan yang yod pa dang 'du ba de dag ni mtha'i khyad par dag gi yang dngos po nyid la mtshan nyid gang yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa dang 'du ba de dag ni mtha'i khyad par dag gi yang dngos po nyid la mtshan nyid gang yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be said that existence and assemblage are the characteristics of that which is a thing, in terms of the distinction of limit.

original: 'du ba dang khyad par dag la yod pa dang 'du ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'du ba dang khyad par dag la yod pa dang 'du ba ma yin zhing /
translated: An assemblage and a distinction are not an existence or an assemblage,

original: yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not an existence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnams la ste /
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnams la ste /
translated: They are substances, qualities, and actions.

original: dngos po gsum yod par byed pa ni yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung gi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gsum yod par byed pa ni yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung gi phyir ro //
translated: The existence that causes the existence of the three things is an existence.

original: de ltas na dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'di ni mi la khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltas na dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'di ni mi la khyab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this characteristic of a thing is not universal.

original: yod pa la sogs pa grub pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa grub pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if the existence and so on are established,

original: de lta na yang yod pa dang 'du ba mtshan du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang yod pa dang 'du ba mtshan du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: still it is not logical that existence and assemblage are characteristics because

original: don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are different objects.

original: gang gis de de'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba don gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de de'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba don gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: That which is a different object is not the nature of another, by which it would be its characteristic.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma shes pas blo gros blun po tshad ma dang ldan pa la @237b gang gis dngos po de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid 'ga' zhig las ldog par rtogs pa
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma shes pas blo gros blun po tshad ma dang ldan pa la @237b gang gis dngos po de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid 'ga' zhig las ldog par rtogs pa
translated: Thus, because of not understanding the nature of things, the foolish think that the nature of things is apprehended by valid cognition, and that the nature of things is somehow stopped.

original: mtshan nyid nyid du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid nyid du brjod par bya ste /
translated: The nature of things is said to be their characteristic.

original: dper na sra ba nyid kyis sa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sra ba nyid kyis sa bzhin no //
translated: For example, solidity is the characteristic of earth.

original: dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of another thing,

original: gzhan nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then follow that it would not be different from that thing.

original: de ji ltar de'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar de'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: How could it be the characteristic of that thing?

original: mtshan nyid kyi sgras ni rang bzhin rjod par byed pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sgras ni rang bzhin rjod par byed pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúcharacteristic‚Äù is used in this context to refer to the nature of a thing.

original: kha cig na re gang dang gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig ma yin no zhes thams cad nye bar bsdu ba'i khyab pa 'di grub par 'gyur ba dngos po gang zhig tha na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang skyed par byed par mi byed pa
analyzed: kha cig na re gang dang gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig ma yin no zhes thams cad nye bar bsdu ba'i khyab pa 'di grub par 'gyur ba dngos po gang zhig tha na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang skyed par byed par mi byed pa
translated: What thing does not generate even the wisdom of omniscience?

original: de ni de 'dra ba yod pa nyid la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod /
analyzed: de ni de 'dra ba yod pa nyid la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod /
translated: What is the valid knowledge that contradicts the existence of such a thing?

original: de yongs su ma shes pa na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nyams pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yongs su ma shes pa na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nyams pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If that is not fully understood, omniscience is not impaired,

original: de ni shes bya mtha' dag kho na la dbang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni shes bya mtha' dag kho na la dbang ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is only the power of all objects of knowledge.

original: shes par rung ba'i dngos po ma shes na /
analyzed: shes par rung ba'i dngos po ma shes na /
translated: If a thing that is suitable to be known is not known,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur na /üîΩde ni shes bya ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur na / de ni shes bya ma yin te /
translated: one is not omniscient.üîΩBut that is not an object of knowledge,

original: de ni shes pa skyed pa la yang mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //üîΩde la bshad pa don byed don //
analyzed: de ni shes pa skyed pa la yang mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro // de la bshad pa don byed don //
translated: because it is not able to generate consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚ÄúThe object that performs a function‚Äù and so on.

original: don dngos po tsam la yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid du spyod pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni don byed pa don du gnyer bas yin gyi chags pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dngos po tsam la yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid du spyod pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni don byed pa don du gnyer bas yin gyi chags pas ni ma yin te /
translated: All of this is for the sake of the functioning of things, not for the sake of attachment,

original: gzhan du na smyon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na smyon par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise one would be insane.

original: des na dngos po'i tshigs gang kho na don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'ga' zhig la ci ltar dngos sam brgyud pas yul 'ga' zhig tu dus res 'ga' nye bar sbyor ba de nyid la rtogs pa dang ldan pa dngos po nyid du rnam par 'jog pa
analyzed: des na dngos po'i tshigs gang kho na don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'ga' zhig la ci ltar dngos sam brgyud pas yul 'ga' zhig tu dus res 'ga' nye bar sbyor ba de nyid la rtogs pa dang ldan pa dngos po nyid du rnam par 'jog pa
translated: Therefore, when one who seeks the functioning of things sometimes applies himself to some object, directly or indirectly, at some time, that very thing is posited as a thing by the wise,

original: rigs pa yin gyi / gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa yin gyi / gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not otherwise.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir dang dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir dang dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because there would be no reason and no purpose.

original: sogs pa smos pas me dang chu la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par dag la spyod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas me dang chu la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par dag la spyod pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the functioning of things such as fire and water.

original: de lta yin dang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis gang kho na don byed pa de kho na dngos po yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de grub po //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis gang kho na don byed pa de kho na dngos po yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de grub po //
translated: If that is so, then it is established that only that which performs a function is a real entity, as those who proceed with reasoning say.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi don bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo de nyid kho bo cag gis skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi don bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo de nyid kho bo cag gis skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub ste /
translated: We prove that very nature of performing a function to be momentariness.

original: de na don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //üîΩde lta bur gyur @238a * //
analyzed: de na don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do // de lta bur gyur @238a * //
translated: There is no error because we clearly assert that the characteristic of being able to perform a function is the reason.üîΩThe establishment of the pervasion that includes everything

original: pa'i gtan tshigs de la bsgrub par bya bas thams cad nye bar sdud pas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i gtan tshigs de la bsgrub par bya bas thams cad nye bar sdud pas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in that kind of reason is because the probandum is included in everything.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba ma byas par spyir gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad nye bar bsdu ba'i khyab pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba ma byas par spyir gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad nye bar bsdu ba'i khyab pa'o //
translated: The pervasion that includes everything is the teaching of the pervasion of the reason in general without distinguishing the concordant and discordant classes.

original: ci ste don byed par nus pas stong na yang ci'i phyir dngos po nyid du mi 'dod ce na /üîΩnus pa mtha' dag gis stong gang //
analyzed: ci ste don byed par nus pas stong na yang ci'i phyir dngos po nyid du mi 'dod ce na / nus pa mtha' dag gis stong gang //
translated: But if it is empty of the capacity to perform a function, why is it not accepted as a non-thing?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs la yang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs la yang //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThat which is empty of all capacities . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the mind of the Omniscient One‚Äù is statedüîΩ.

original: yang gi sgra ni rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig dang / chu skyor ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //üîΩngo bo 'bras sogs ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig dang / chu skyor ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o // ngo bo 'bras sogs ma mthong phyir //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is not only a similar type of moment and the result of a water-wheel, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa can gyi gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa can gyi gtan tshigs te /
translated: The argument ‚Äúbecause the nature, result, etc. are not seen‚Äù is a reason that is without a basis.

original: ngo bo ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù refers to its essence.

original: 'bras ni de'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras ni de'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúResult‚Äù refers to its effect.

original: sogs pa'i sgras de'i yul dang dus dang / gnas skabs kyi khyad par yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras de'i yul dang dus dang / gnas skabs kyi khyad par yang gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes its object, time, and context.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo de ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dag las khyad par 'ga' yang med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo de ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dag las khyad par 'ga' yang med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that such a nature is not different in any way from the horns of a rabbit, etc.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po de la skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs pas don byed pa don du gnyer ba la dgos pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po de la skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs pas don byed pa don du gnyer ba la dgos pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: But if one proves that such an entity is momentary, there is no need for one who seeks to accomplish a purpose,

original: de ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag tu phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag tu phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable for a seen or unseen entity to obtain benefit or harm, to obtain or abandon.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: don byed nus pa ma yin la //
analyzed: don byed nus pa ma yin la //
translated: If it is not able to perform a function,

original: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya //üîΩma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
analyzed: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya // ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
translated: what is the point of asserting it?üîΩWhat is the use of the lustful

original: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //üîΩzhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan // zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: examining whether a eunuch is handsome or ugly?

original: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma de la 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas brgal zhing brtag pa'i phyir rgol bas byed pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma de la 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas brgal zhing brtag pa'i phyir rgol bas byed pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs argument that ‚Äúhow is this understood in a moment?‚Äù and so on is a refutation because it is pointless to posit an effect of an action,

original: de ni rgol bas skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub par bya ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rgol bas skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub par bya ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opponent does not assert that it is to be proven that it is momentary.

original: da ni gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Now, it is also illogical that the capacity for the performance of function is the characteristic of things,üîΩbecause it is too broad.

original: ha cang khyab ches pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: ha cang khyab ches pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'on te nam mkha'i padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha'i padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: But the sky-lotus, etc.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa las nam mkha'i padma nam mkha'i padma snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa la nus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa las nam mkha'i padma nam mkha'i padma snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa la nus pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the sky-lotus, etc. are the capacity for the performance of function characterized by the production of consciousness such as ‚ÄúThe sky-lotus is the sky-lotus.‚Äù

original: de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But they do not exist ultimately.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i @238b mtshan nyid ni nus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di khyab ches pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i @238b mtshan nyid ni nus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di khyab ches pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this assertion that the characteristic of things is capacity is too broad.

original: 'di la lan du /
analyzed: 'di la lan du /
translated: In response to this, he says:

original: nam mkha'i padma la sogs la //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma la sogs la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With respect to the sky-lotus, etc.

original: nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa rnams la don byed par nus pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa rnams la don byed par nus pa ma grub ste /
translated: The capacity for the performance of function is not established with respect to the sky-lotus, etc.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni rang gi rnam bar rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa tsam kho na las skye bas dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni rang gi rnam bar rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa tsam kho na las skye bas dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conceptual thoughts of those are produced from the mere ripening of their own habitual tendencies of conceptual thought. Therefore, they do not have an object.

original: ci ste nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa las skye ba la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa las skye ba la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúWhat is the valid knowledge that refutes the production of such things as a sky flower?‚Äù

original: med ba rgyu nyid yin na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med ba rgyu nyid yin na ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If nonexistence were a cause,üîΩthen everything would be produced from nonexistence.

original: nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa med pa rgyu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa med pa rgyu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Such things as a sky flower do not exist. That which has a cause that is nonexistent is called ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That is its nature.

original: de yod na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa'i shes pa de thams cad du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yod na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa'i shes pa de thams cad du 'byung ba ste /
translated: If it exists, then the consciousness of such things as a sky flower would arise everywhere.

original: skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would be produced.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the complete cause is permanent.

original: gang gis rgyu ma tshang bas res 'ga' mi skyed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba gzhan gyi phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa de ni ltos par rigs pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gis rgyu ma tshang bas res 'ga' mi skyed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba gzhan gyi phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa de ni ltos par rigs pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: It is not tenable to say that it is not a different object that is to be benefited, but that sometimes it does not generate a result due to the incompleteness of causes.üîΩ

original: / skad cig ma yi dngos rnams la //
analyzed: / skad cig ma yi dngos rnams la //
translated: It is not tenable that that which is not to be benefited by another is dependent on another, since it would be said that sometimes it does not generate an effect due to the incompleteness of its causes.üîΩThe Bhadanta‚Äôs system of the YogƒÅcƒÅra

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas btsun pa sbyor ba'i sde'i lugs dogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas btsun pa sbyor ba'i sde'i lugs dogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: is refuted by ‚ÄúThings that are momentary . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The Bhadanta says:

original: dngos po rnams skad cig ma yin na yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig ma yin na yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even though things are momentary, it is contradictory that they function sequentially or simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar de dag rang nyid nus par 'gyur ram mi nus /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag rang nyid nus par 'gyur ram mi nus /
translated: In that case, are they themselves capable or not?

original: gal te nus na de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nus na de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they are capable, then they would not depend on the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: nus pa ni 'ga' la yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa ni 'ga' la yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that that which is capable depends on anything.

original: ci ste mi nus pa de lta na yang de dag gi de la ltos pa de rigs pa dang mi ldan pa gsal rab pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste mi nus pa de lta na yang de dag gi de la ltos pa de rigs pa dang mi ldan pa gsal rab pa nyid de /
translated: But if they are not capable, then it is clear that it is illogical that they depend on that.

original: 'di ltar tshogs pa dang po'i nang du chud pa'i lus gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun du khyad par thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshogs pa dang po'i nang du chud pa'i lus gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun du khyad par thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the body included in the first collection does not cause the attainment of a difference among themselves.

original: skyes ba dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag gis yod pa dang med pas phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes ba dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag gis yod pa dang med pas phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in the states of having arisen and not having arisen, there is no benefit or harm, and no one to be benefited or harmed.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po'i gnas skabs la de dag gis khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po'i gnas skabs la de dag gis khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, then because they would not be different from the state of the thing,

original: de las khyad par can skad cig gzhan skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las khyad par can skad cig gzhan skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: a different moment would not arise from that.

original: khyad par med pa de dag las skad cig gzhan gyi khyad par skye na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa de dag las skad cig gzhan gyi khyad par skye na /
translated: If a difference in another moment arises from those that are undifferentiated,

original: 'bras bu yang ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed /
translated: why would it not also produce an effect?

original: khyad par can de dag ni tshogs pa snga ma las byung ngo zhes brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can de dag ni tshogs pa snga ma las byung ngo zhes brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that those that are different arise from the previous collection,

original: tshogs pa de'i nang du gtogs pa rnams kyang de nyid kyi @239a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa de'i nang du gtogs pa rnams kyang de nyid kyi @239a * //
translated: because those included in that collection are also

original: phyir phan tshun khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir phan tshun khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from each other.

original: de dag kyang khyad bar gzhan las skye na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang khyad bar gzhan las skye na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if they arise from another difference, there is an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir de ltar khyad par med pa'i phyir de ji ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa khyad par med pa las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar khyad par med pa'i phyir de ji ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa khyad par med pa las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference in that way, how could an effect arise from a collection of causes that is not different?

original: khyad par med pa las kyang skye na thams cad thams cad las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa las kyang skye na thams cad thams cad las 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it arises from what is not different, then everything would arise from everything.

original: de lta yin dang rim dang cig car dag gis de ltar don byed pa mi 'gal na yang ji ltar de dag don bya ba byed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rtag pa yang yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag gi skad cig ma nyid la rten pa
analyzed: de lta yin dang rim dang cig car dag gis de ltar don byed pa mi 'gal na yang ji ltar de dag don bya ba byed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rtag pa yang yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag gi skad cig ma nyid la rten pa
translated: If that were so, then there would be no contradiction in the performance of function in that way, either sequentially or simultaneously. But just as they perform a function, so too would that which is permanent exist. Therefore, the momentariness of those is

original: don med do //
analyzed: don med do //
translated: meaningless.

original: des na yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma nges pa nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma nges pa nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason ‚Äúbecause it exists‚Äù is uncertain.

translated: It is not logical to say that the effect arises from the continuum, because it arises from the special state of the continuum.üîΩIt is not logical to say that the effect arises from the continuum, because it arises from the special state of the continuum.üîΩIt is not logical to say that the effect arises from the continuum, because it arises from the special state of the continuum.üîΩIt is not logical to say that the effect arises from the continuum, because it arises from the special state of the continuum.
