original: gal te rang gi nye bar len pa tsam dang ldan pa'i khyad par du 'gyur na de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa kho nar skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi nye bar len pa tsam dang ldan pa'i khyad par du 'gyur na de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa kho nar skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not logical to say that the effect arises from the continuum, because it arises from the special state of the continuum.üîΩIt is not logical to say that the effect arises from the continuum, because it arises

original: gzhan yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas rgyun la thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas rgyun la thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because of the reasoning explained above, there is no difference in the continuum.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams la gyo mo la sogs pa'i khyad par skye bar mi srid pa'i phyir rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa gal te rgyu med pa can du 'gyur na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams la gyo mo la sogs pa'i khyad par skye bar mi srid pa'i phyir rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa gal te rgyu med pa can du 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for a vase and so on to generate a difference such as a shard and so on. If destruction, which is characterized by the interruption of a continuum of similar moments, were causeless,

original: de'i tshe ltos pa med pa'i phyir dang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ltos pa med pa'i phyir dang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would occur from the beginning, because it would not depend on anything else.

original: 'on te dang po mi 'gyur na phyis kyang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te dang po mi 'gyur na phyis kyang mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it did not occur from the beginning, it would not occur later,

original: snga ma bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference from the previous state.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po rnams kyis 'jig pa la rang gi rgyu las tha dad pa gzhan rgyur mi 'dod na de'i tshe me la sogs pa dang grang ba la sogs pa rnams la ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po rnams kyis 'jig pa la rang gi rgyu las tha dad pa gzhan rgyur mi 'dod na de'i tshe me la sogs pa dang grang ba la sogs pa rnams la ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if things do not assert that destruction has a cause that is different from itself, then how could heat and so on be incompatible with cold and so on?

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni 'gal bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni 'gal bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that something that does not perform any function at all is incompatible.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is too broad.

original: de lta na ni thams cad thams cad dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad thams cad dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be the contradictory of everything.

original: de lta yin dang @239b 'gal ba'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang ches 'brel par dka'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang @239b 'gal ba'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang ches 'brel par dka'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If that were so, it would be very difficult to establish the application of nonapprehension through the contradictory and the presentation of killing and so on.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The response to this is given in the line if it were possible for something to arise from something . . .

original: nus pa kho na las 'bras bu skye zhing lhan cig byed pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa kho na las 'bras bu skye zhing lhan cig byed pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: An effect arises only from that which is able to give rise to it, and it is not the case that the cooperating causes are meaningless.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In this way there are two types of cooperating causes:

original: don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa dang / phan tshun phan pa byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa dang / phan tshun phan pa byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: those that perform the same function and those that are mutually beneficial.

original: de la bar du ma chod pa'i 'bras bu la ltos nas don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de la bar du ma chod pa'i 'bras bu la ltos nas don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: In this regard, the causes that perform the same function are so called in terms of their relation to the effect that is not obstructed.

original: phan tshun du phan pa byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun du phan pa byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not mutually beneficial.

original: skad cig gcig la cha med pa nyid kyis khyad par bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la cha med pa nyid kyis khyad par bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to generate a difference in a single moment, because of the absence of parts.

original: chod pa'i 'bras bu la ltos na ni phan tshun du khyad par can gyi skad cig gong nas gong du skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chod pa'i 'bras bu la ltos na ni phan tshun du khyad par can gyi skad cig gong nas gong du skye ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is in dependence on the effect of obstruction, then, because of the generation of a difference in the subsequent moments,

original: rgyun la ltos nas phan tshun du phan 'dogs pas chod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i phyir phan tshun phan pa byed pa'i phyir mtshan nyid lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyun la ltos nas phan tshun du phan 'dogs pas chod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i phyir phan tshun phan pa byed pa'i phyir mtshan nyid lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: in dependence on the continuum, because of the mutual assistance in the generation of the effect of obstruction, the characteristics are co-operating causes because of the mutual assistance.

original: de la dang po'i gnas skabs su byung ba rnams la gal te yang phan tshun khyad par med pa de lta na yang de dag gis lhan cig byed pa 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la dang po'i gnas skabs su byung ba rnams la gal te yang phan tshun khyad par med pa de lta na yang de dag gis lhan cig byed pa 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
translated: In that regard, even though there is no difference in the mutual assistance of those that occur in the first moment, there is no contradiction in their being co-operating causes.

original: don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they perform the same function.

original: de dag ni de ma thag tu khyad par can gyi skad cig skye ba la khyad par med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni de ma thag tu khyad par can gyi skad cig skye ba la khyad par med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not without difference in the generation of the subsequent moments that have a difference.

original: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen snga ma dag kho na las rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu'i tshogs skyed pa na nus pa rnams so sor skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen snga ma dag kho na las rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu'i tshogs skyed pa na nus pa rnams so sor skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When a collection of effects of that type is generated from its own prior causes and conditions, the potencies are generated individually.

original: rgyu dang rkyen de dag kyang rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag las yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen de dag kyang rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag las yin la /
translated: Those causes and conditions also arise from other causes and conditions.

original: de dag kyang gzhan dag las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan dag las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And those also arise from others.

original: rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it is accepted that the continuum of causes is beginningless,

original: thug pa med kyang sun mi phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thug pa med kyang sun mi phyin pa nyid do //
translated: there is no infinite regress, and there is no fault.

original: nus pa so so yin na yang gzhan 'di dag don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa so so yin na yang gzhan 'di dag don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Even though the potencies are individual, these other things are not pointless,

original: rang gi rgyu'i stobs kyis de dag de ltar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i stobs kyis de dag de ltar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise in that way through the power of their own causes.

original: de dag tha dad pa'i do bor yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa'i do bor yod pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not exist as the objects of distinct things,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the state of being a cause of that type does not exist.

original: phyis kyi skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa logs shig tu skyed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis kyi skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa logs shig tu skyed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not generated separately from the collection, because they are momentary.

original: skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i tshogs pa re re skyed pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i tshogs pa re re skyed pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that each collection that arises in the second moment has the ability to generate that.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa smos pa ni dang po'i gnas skabs su byung ba'i lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i nye bar sbyor ba 'gegs pa lhur len pa yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩrang gi nye bar len pa @240a * //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa smos pa ni dang po'i gnas skabs su byung ba'i lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i nye bar sbyor ba 'gegs pa lhur len pa yin par blta bar bya'o // rang gi nye bar len pa @240a * //
translated: The specification of ‚Äúits own appropriation‚Äù should be seen as intending to refute the application of the first moment‚Äôs co-arisen causes.

original: tsam las byung ba'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tsam las byung ba'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is any effect that arises from its own appropriation alone,

original: thams cad ni tshogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni tshogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all arise from a collection.

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'ga' yang gcig las gcig ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gcig las gcig ma yin //
translated: Nothing arises from one thing alone;

original: thams cad tshogs pa nyid la 'byung //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩde las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni dus phyis skad cig gnyis pa nas bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad tshogs pa nyid la 'byung // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // de las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni dus phyis skad cig gnyis pa nas bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: everything arises from a collection.üîΩBeginning from that means beginning from the second moment onward.

original: des byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus byas pa'o //
analyzed: des byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus byas pa'o //
translated: That which is produced by it means that which is produced by the special cause produced by the co-arisen causes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the nature of that.

original: de rnams te de'i ngo bo khyad bar lhan cig byed bas byas pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de rnams te de'i ngo bo khyad bar lhan cig byed bas byas pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: They are the nature of that, which is generated by the cause that is the distinctive feature that is produced by the distinctive feature that is produced by the cooperative conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has such a nature is called that.

original: de la nyer sbyor zhes bya ba ni /üîΩde yi ngo bo'i rang bzhin phyir //
analyzed: de la nyer sbyor zhes bya ba ni / de yi ngo bo'i rang bzhin phyir //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúapplication‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: is connected with the statement, ‚Äúbecause they are the nature of that.‚Äù

original: de la nyer sbyor te zhes bya ba 'dir dang gi sgra mi mngon par byas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la nyer sbyor te zhes bya ba 'dir dang gi sgra mi mngon par byas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this context, the term ‚Äúand‚Äù is not explicitly stated.

original: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is as follows.

original: de las gnas skabs gsum par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i khyad par gang dag rgyu'i dngos pos nye bar sbyor te /
analyzed: de las gnas skabs gsum par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i khyad par gang dag rgyu'i dngos pos nye bar sbyor te /
translated: The effect that arises in the third moment is applied to the cause that arises in the second moment by the state of being a cause.

original: de la nye bar sbyor ba de dag kyang lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus bskyed par byas pa'i 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyor ba de dag kyang lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus bskyed par byas pa'i 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The application of those is the nature of generating the effect that is generated by the cause of the particular that is made by the cooperative cause.

original: de'i phyir skad cig gsum pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i khyad par nges byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig gsum pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i khyad par nges byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the particular of arising in the third moment and so on is ascertained.

original: 'di dag gi nges pa 'di yang ji ltar 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nges pa 'di yang ji ltar 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the ascertainment of these?

original: nus nges zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nus nges zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe nature of things is ascertained by their capacity.‚Äù

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of things is not suitable to be disputed.

original: me'i sreg bar byed pa mi rtogs ba nyid lta bur de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa ni rang gi rgyu dang rkyen brgyud pas bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i sreg bar byed pa mi rtogs ba nyid lta bur de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa ni rang gi rgyu dang rkyen brgyud pas bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their nature is just generated by their own causes and conditions, like the burning of fire is not understood.

original: gang gi phyir de dag rkyen gzhan dang gzhan gyi sbyor bas skad cig re re la nus pa tha dad par skye ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag rkyen gzhan dang gzhan gyi sbyor bas skad cig re re la nus pa tha dad par skye ste /
translated: Because they are generated by the application of other and other conditions, they arise with a different capacity in each moment.

original: de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa 'ga' zhig las 'dra bar shes par byed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa 'ga' zhig las 'dra bar shes par byed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is only in some similar cases that one can understand the similarity.

original: 'on kyang 'di dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: But their natures are different.

original: des na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, one is the cause of the other,

original: thams cad thams cad kyi ni ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi ni ma yin /
translated: but not everything is the cause of everything.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Why is it not so?

original: 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúarising‚Äù means ‚Äúcoming into existence.‚ÄùüîΩAnd the opponent says:

original: gang yang / gal te 'jig pa rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: gang yang / gal te 'jig pa rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: If destruction were causeless,

original: zhes smras pa de la bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de la bshad pa /
translated: then the objection is stated:

original: rgyun @240b chad ngo bo gang yin pas //
analyzed: rgyun @240b chad ngo bo gang yin pas //
translated: By what nature is the continuum severed?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: 'jig pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of destruction:

original: rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo dang / rgyun mi 'dra bar skye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo dang / rgyun mi 'dra bar skye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the nature of the severance of the continuum and the characteristic of the arising of a different continuum.

original: de la gal te rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo'i 'jig pa'i dbang du byas nas smra na /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo'i 'jig pa'i dbang du byas nas smra na /
translated: If the opponent argues from the perspective of the destruction that is the nature of the severance of the continuum,

original: de mi rigs te /
analyzed: de mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: de ni mthar yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni mthar yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it does not exist even at the end.

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has no intrinsic reality,

original: de ni mthar yang ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni mthar yang ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be at the end?

original: zhes bya ba de ci ste rjod par byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ci ste rjod par byed /
translated: Why is this said?

original: de lta bas na 'di ni res 'ga' yang yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang po dang mthar dngos po med par thal ba gang yin pa de 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni res 'ga' yang yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang po dang mthar dngos po med par thal ba gang yin pa de 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, since it is not accepted that it exists at any time, the consequence that things would be nonexistent at the beginning and the end is irrelevant.

original: de bzhen du tshe rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig gzhan mtshams sbyor bas skye ba 'byung ba de la bkag pa 'ba' zhig yin te /
analyzed: de bzhen du tshe rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig gzhan mtshams sbyor bas skye ba 'byung ba de la bkag pa 'ba' zhig yin te /
translated: In the same way, the arising of the origination of a life through the connection with another moment of a similar life is refuted.

original: bum pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba na /
translated: In the case of a pot, etc.,

original: de nyid mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don yin gyi /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúit does not occur again,‚Äù

original: de la cung zad sgrub par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la cung zad sgrub par ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not established in the least.

original: ci ste mi 'dra ba'i skad cig skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa gnyis pa mngon par 'dod na de ni rgyu med pa nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'dra ba'i skad cig skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa gnyis pa mngon par 'dod na de ni rgyu med pa nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: But if you assert that the second cessation, which has the characteristic of the origination of a dissimilar moment, is not established as causeless.

original: dngos su de ni tho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su de ni tho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is actually accepted that it arises by the power of causes such as the hammer.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dang por mi skye ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dang por mi skye ste /
translated: For that very reason, it does not arise in the beginning,

original: rang gi rgyu tho ba la sogs pa de'i dus su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu tho ba la sogs pa de'i dus su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its own cause, the hammer, etc., does not exist at that time.

original: 'gal ba'i rnam par gzhag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rnam par gzhag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the contradiction,

original: skad cig ma yi dngos rnam gnyis //
analyzed: skad cig ma yi dngos rnam gnyis //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThings that are momentary are of two kinds,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos po kha cig 'ba' zhig gi nyam chung ba dang / che ba dang / ches cher chung ba'i skad cig skyed pa'i rim gyis bskum pa gang yin pa de la rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po kha cig 'ba' zhig gi nyam chung ba dang / che ba dang / ches cher chung ba'i skad cig skyed pa'i rim gyis bskum pa gang yin pa de la rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: That which is the cause of the decrease of some things, which is the gradual decrease of their weak, strong, and very weak moments that are produced,

original: dper na grang ba la sogs pa'i me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grang ba la sogs pa'i me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: is like fire, etc., for cold, etc.

original: gzhan ni de lta min pa ni 'grib pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni de lta min pa ni 'grib pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ste /
translated: Another is not like that, and is not the cause of decrease.

original: 'di lta ste dper na du ba la sogs pa rnams kyi me la sogs pa de dag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na du ba la sogs pa rnams kyi me la sogs pa de dag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, those same things, fire, etc., are for smoke, etc.

original: de la dang por bstan pa'i bskum pa'i rgyu dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na yang shes pa'i snang ba mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs bzhin pa'i 'jig rten 'gal ba nyid du mngon par rlom mo //
analyzed: de la dang por bstan pa'i bskum pa'i rgyu dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na yang shes pa'i snang ba mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs bzhin pa'i 'jig rten 'gal ba nyid du mngon par rlom mo //
translated: First, although the causes of the taught contraction are the entities of cause and effect, the world, which is obscured by the cataract of ignorance, conceives of them as contradictory.

original: rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba ni grang ba dang 'gal ba me dang / sgron ma'i rlung dang / snang ba'i mun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba ni grang ba dang 'gal ba me dang / sgron ma'i rlung dang / snang ba'i mun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: ‚Äú Many kinds‚Äù means that they are distinguished as, for example, cold and fire, a lamp and wind, and light and darkness.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams la gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yong pa ni ma yin te /üîΩyod pa ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis grub pas rang bzhin gzhan @241a * //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams la gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yong pa ni ma yin te / yod pa ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis grub pas rang bzhin gzhan @241a * //
translated: In reality, entities are not established as the entities of that which is to be harmed and that which harms.

original: du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which exists is established by all of its own entities, it is not possible for it to be transformed into another nature.

original: de ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pas brtags pa na gnyi ga ltar yang byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pas brtags pa na gnyi ga ltar yang byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because when it is examined as being different or not different, it is impossible in either case.

original: med na yang dngos po ma yin pa nyid kyis cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir gnyi ga ltar yang 'gal ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: med na yang dngos po ma yin pa nyid kyis cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir gnyi ga ltar yang 'gal ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: If it does not exist, then because it is not a thing, it does not perform any function at all. Thus, there is no contradiction at all in either case.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs so zhes bshad de /
translated: For this very reason, the Acarya says, ‚ÄúWhen the cause is complete, it is understood to be contradictory because it does not exist when the other exists.‚Äù

original: 'gal bar rtogs pa ni 'gal bar nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gal bar rtogs pa ni 'gal bar nges pa yin gyi /
translated: The understanding of contradiction is the ascertainment of contradiction;

original: 'gal ba de kho na nyid ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba de kho na nyid ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: it is not the reality of contradiction.

original: yang gi sgras ni dang gi don dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni dang gi don dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúand‚Äù and is applied in a different order.

original: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be read after ‚Äúfor this very reason.‚Äù

original: 'on te de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis skad cig ma 'jig par dam bcas pa mngon sum gyis gnod pa nyid kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis skad cig ma 'jig par dam bcas pa mngon sum gyis gnod pa nyid kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúIf it is that very thing‚Äù anticipates the objection that the thesis of momentariness and cessation is undermined by perception.

original: 'di ltar ri dang lus dang khang bzangs la sogs pa la de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i mngon sum gyis byed pa'i mjug thogs su ngo shes par brjod pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma 'jig pa 'joms par byed pa skye'o
analyzed: 'di ltar ri dang lus dang khang bzangs la sogs pa la de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i mngon sum gyis byed pa'i mjug thogs su ngo shes par brjod pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma 'jig pa 'joms par byed pa skye'o
translated: Thus, in the wake of the direct perception that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is that very thing,‚Äù in regard to a mountain, a body, a house, etc., there arises a valid cognition of direct perception that is called ‚Äúrecognition,‚Äù which refutes the disintegration of the momentariness of things.

original: // bregs nas yang skyes pa'i sen mo dang skra dang rtsva la sogs pa la ngo shes par mthong ba yin mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang rdo rje la sogs pa'i yul can gyi ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: // bregs nas yang skyes pa'i sen mo dang skra dang rtsva la sogs pa la ngo shes par mthong ba yin mod kyi / 'on kyang rdo rje la sogs pa'i yul can gyi ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par dmigs pa yin te /
translated: It is true that one sees the recognition of nails, hair, and grass, etc., that have been cut and then grown again.

original: gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the recognition of the object, such as a diamond, is not a valid cognition, because it is an object of deception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩg-yo ba med cing gnod med pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / g-yo ba med cing gnod med pa'i //
translated: For that very reason,üîΩit is said,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not moving and it is not deceptive.‚Äù

original: rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig gis bskyed pa'i skra shad kyi shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i dmigs pa yin pa de tsam gyis tha mal pa'i mig gis bskyed pa'i bden pa'i skra shad kyi yul can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yang tshad ma ma
analyzed: rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig gis bskyed pa'i skra shad kyi shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i dmigs pa yin pa de tsam gyis tha mal pa'i mig gis bskyed pa'i bden pa'i skra shad kyi yul can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yang tshad ma ma
translated: It is not reasonable for a clear-minded person to say that just because the consciousness of floating hairs produced by an eye impaired by ophthalmia is a nonvalid cognition, the visual consciousness of a normal person that has true floating hairs as its object is also a nonvalid cognition.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.

original: yin no zhes sems rnal du gnas pas brjod par rigs pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes sems rnal du gnas pas brjod par rigs pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: He thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.

original: de la g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis the tshom med pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa yin te ;üîΩde nyid 'di yin nam 'on te gzhan yin zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bu'i the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnod pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci ma log par bstan to //
analyzed: de la g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis the tshom med pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa yin te ; de nyid 'di yin nam 'on te gzhan yin zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bu'i the tshom med pa'i phyir ro // gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci ma log par bstan to //
translated: He thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.üîΩHe thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.

original: do shes pa'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: do shes pa'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He thinks that the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù indicates the absence of error, and the statement ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù indicates the absence of error.

original: de la re zhig 'di ni mngon sum nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'di ni mngon sum nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: He thinks that the statement ‚Äúnon

original: @241b 'di ltar dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyis brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i shes pa rnams mngon par brjod pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: @241b 'di ltar dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyis brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i shes pa rnams mngon par brjod pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, because the intrinsic identity of a thing cannot be indicated by a sign, the consciousnesses that apprehend it are not associated with verbalization.

original: 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i don sgra dang lhan cig sbyar nas 'dzin par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i don sgra dang lhan cig sbyar nas 'dzin par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to apprehend an object that is not related to a word, by connecting it with a word.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ni yod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang bral ba dang / tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'khrul par 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ni yod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang bral ba dang / tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'khrul par 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, since direct perception is the subject that has the intrinsic identity of an existent object, it must be free from thought and must be nonerroneous because it is a valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis /
translated: For this very reason, the wise

original: mngon sum rtog bral ma 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog bral ma 'khrul pa'o //
translated: have said that direct perception is free from thought and nonerroneous.

original: zhes bya ba rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba 'di mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du rjod par byed do ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba 'di mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du rjod par byed do ;
translated: This statement, which accords with reason, is the definition of direct perception.

original: / ngo shes pa ni rtog pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / ngo shes pa ni rtog pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Recognition is not free from thought.

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is reasonable to say that it is just that, and because it is not mistaken.

original: ma 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not mistaken,

original: tha dad pa la tha mi dad par nges par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa la tha mi dad par nges par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages in the nondiscriminated as if it were discriminated.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di ni sngar rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThis is the prior cognition,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te 'di sngar dmigs pa'i don gyis yul can yin par gyur na de'i tshe sngar nyid du skye par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di sngar dmigs pa'i don gyis yul can yin par gyur na de'i tshe sngar nyid du skye par 'gyur te /
translated: If this were the subject of the prior object, then it would arise prior to that,

original: de yul yin pa nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir sngar gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de yul yin pa nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir sngar gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it would be the cause of that, just like the prior cognition.

original: de don can phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni sngar rig pa'i dngos po don yul du gang la yod pa de ni don can de'i dngos po ni de'i don can nyid do //
analyzed: de don can phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni sngar rig pa'i dngos po don yul du gang la yod pa de ni don can de'i dngos po ni de'i don can nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it has that as its object‚Äù means that it has as its object that thing which was previously cognized.

original: de lta yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni thal ba las bzlog pa 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni thal ba las bzlog pa 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not like that‚Äù means that the reverse of the reductio is stated.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang du ma tshang ba med pa yod na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang du ma tshang ba med pa yod na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: if something is not incomplete with regard to something else, and if it does not change, then it is not the object of that .

original: dper na ma tshang ba med pa'i gzugs yod na yang de la rna ba'i rnam par shes ba mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ma tshang ba med pa'i gzugs yod na yang de la rna ba'i rnam par shes ba mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, even if form is not incomplete, auditory consciousness does not arise with regard to it.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa'i shes pa de'i dus su ngo shes pa yang ma tshang ba med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa'i shes pa de'i dus su ngo shes pa yang ma tshang ba med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cognition of a diamond, etc., is not incomplete, because it arises when the object is present. This is the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rdo rje la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pa med pa rtag pa nyid yin na de'i yul can gyi shes pa ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir sngar nyid du 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rdo rje la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pa med pa rtag pa nyid yin na de'i yul can gyi shes pa ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir sngar nyid du 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if a diamond, etc., were permanent, not dependent on another, the cognition of that would be prior, because its cause would not be incomplete. But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na 'di mi rtag pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di mi rtag pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is impermanent.

original: de lta yin dang tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par nges pas 'jug pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i ri lu 'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma tshang ba med pa nyid yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir gnod pa @242a * //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par nges pas 'jug pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i ri lu 'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma tshang ba med pa nyid yin no // de nyid kyi phyir gnod pa @242a * //
translated: If that were so, then because it engages in ascertaining non-difference in the case of different things, it is mistaken, like the consciousness of a mirage.

original: med pa'i yul can yang ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i yul can yang ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the subject is not established as non-deceptive.

original: 'khrul pa nyid du grub pa ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs las gnod pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid du grub pa ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs las gnod pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established as mistaken, as explained by the reason, the subject is deceptive.

original: 'di yang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: This is also not a valid cognition because it apprehends what has already been apprehended,

original: dran pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir grub zin pa don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dran pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir grub zin pa don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: like memory. To explain this, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not a valid cognition of a previously unestablished object,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gang kho na gzhal ba'i bya ba grub pa la khyad par can gyi phan 'dogs par byed pa de kho na grub par byed pa dam pa'i byed pa po tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang kho na gzhal ba'i bya ba grub pa la khyad par can gyi phan 'dogs par byed pa de kho na grub par byed pa dam pa'i byed pa po tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is that which assists in the activity of measuring what has already been measured, it is the supreme agent that establishes, and is called a valid cognition.

original: gal te ngo shes pa tshad ma snga mas bzung zin pa don gyi yul can du gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ngo shes pa tshad ma snga mas bzung zin pa don gyi yul can du gyur na /
translated: If the subsequent cognition that recognizes the object is one whose object is that which was previously apprehended by the earlier valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe gzhal bar bya ba grub pa'i don la 'jug pas sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar tshang ma nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhal bar bya ba grub pa'i don la 'jug pas sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar tshang ma nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then at that time, since it engages an object that has already been established, it is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that establishes anything.

original: gzhan du na dran yang tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dran yang tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, memory would be a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma'i dngos por gyur pa ma yin na gnod par byed pa nyid du rtog pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i dngos por gyur pa ma yin na gnod par byed pa nyid du rtog pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition, then it is not even conceived to be a refutation.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would be absurd.

original: 'di snyam du 'di logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du ma gyur mod ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'di logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du ma gyur mod ;
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúAlthough this is not a valid cognition in a different way,

original: de lta na yang snga ma'i don yul yin pa nyid kyis 'di skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par byed pa nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta na yang snga ma'i don yul yin pa nyid kyis 'di skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par byed pa nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: nevertheless, since it has the same object as the earlier one, it is a refutation of the disintegration of the thing at the second moment,‚Äù

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: 'di la don dam par snga ma'i yul yin pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don dam par snga ma'i yul yin pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because in reality it does not have the same object as the earlier one.

original: brjod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is described.

original: yul med na yang 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis sngar mthong ba'i don la nges pa skye ba'i phyir nges pa'i dbang gis sngar mthong ba'i don yul yin no zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad ngo //
analyzed: yul med na yang 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis sngar mthong ba'i don la nges pa skye ba'i phyir nges pa'i dbang gis sngar mthong ba'i don yul yin no zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad ngo //
translated: Even if the object does not exist, the power of error generates ascertainment with regard to the object that was previously seen. Therefore, it is said that the object that was previously seen is the object by the power of ascertainment.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa'i ngo shes pa 'di las skad cig ma 'jig pa sel bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa'i ngo shes pa 'di las skad cig ma 'jig pa sel bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could this consciousness that is essentially erroneous eliminate the destruction of momentary things?

original: da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyis bzung zin pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis ma grub par ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyis bzung zin pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis ma grub par ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Existence at the time of the present, etc.,‚Äù demonstrates that the system of Kumarila is not established by the apprehension of what has already been apprehended.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: mngon sum snga mas don da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid du rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum snga mas don da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid du rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The former perception does not understand the object to exist at the time of the present.

original: de ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it apprehends the aspect ‚ÄúThat is this.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na ngo shes pa 'di la dran pa las khyad par yod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngo shes pa 'di la dran pa las khyad par yod do //
translated: Therefore, recognition is different from memory.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: snga rol gzhan pa tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snga rol gzhan pa tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is merely the prior perception of another,‚Äù and so on.

original: dran pa ni de'o snyam pas shes pa snga ma'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'jug la /
analyzed: dran pa ni de'o snyam pas shes pa snga ma'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'jug la /
translated: Memory engages by apprehending the aspect of the prior cognition with the thought ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: ngo shes pa ni 'di'o snyam pa de lta bu'i tha dad par yang don gyi rnam par 'dzin pa skye ste /
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni 'di'o snyam pa de lta bu'i tha dad par yang don gyi rnam par 'dzin pa skye ste /
translated: Recognition arises as the apprehension of the aspect of the object with the thought ‚ÄúThis is it,‚Äù which is a different cognition.

original: de'i phyir dran @242b ba las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dran @242b ba las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is different from memory.

original: bye brag can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bye brag can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a specific type of cognition.

original: de lta bas na gang dag the tshom dang phyin ci log yin pa de dag la gnod par byas nas ngo shes pa tshad ma nyid du thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang dag the tshom dang phyin ci log yin pa de dag la gnod par byas nas ngo shes pa tshad ma nyid du thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it is established that memory and recognition are different, then, since they are different, it is established that recognition is valid knowledge, having overcome doubt and error.

original: gang las 'di dag la gnod pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu bshad pa ni /üîΩrtogs pa la ni yod min phyir //
analyzed: gang las 'di dag la gnod pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu bshad pa ni / rtogs pa la ni yod min phyir //
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúFrom what are they different?‚Äù he explains the reason:

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it does not exist in the case of recognition.

original: rtogs pa'i don la de dag med pa'i phyir me 'bar ba'i tshogs chen po dang ldan pa'i dus su grang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don la de dag med pa'i phyir me 'bar ba'i tshogs chen po dang ldan pa'i dus su grang ba lta bu'o //
translated: Because the object of realization is devoid of those, it is like the absence of cold at the time of a great conflagration.

original: 'on te ji lta bu la sogs par rtogs pa'i sngo bsangs la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs pa'i don la dus gzhan yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di la yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te ji lta bu la sogs par rtogs pa'i sngo bsangs la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs pa'i don la dus gzhan yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di la yang ma yin nam /
translated: But just as the object of inference, such as being blue, is not contradicted by direct perception at another time, is it not the same for this?

original: gal te ngo shes pas rtag pa nyid kyi don grub pa de lta na yan dus phyis de'i 'bras bu'i rim pas de'i rim pa rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te ngo shes pas rtag pa nyid kyi don grub pa de lta na yan dus phyis de'i 'bras bu'i rim pas de'i rim pa rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin na /
translated: If the object of permanence is established by recognition, then it is not the case that it becomes another object by the inference that establishes its sequence through the sequence of its effects at another time.

original: de ji ltar skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid la gnod par byed ces dogs pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid la gnod par byed ces dogs pa la /
translated: How does that contradict momentariness?

original: cig shos kyis no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cig shos kyis no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that doubt is ‚ÄúThe other is not.‚Äù

original: cig shos kyis zhes bya ba ni dper na de ni sngo bsangs yin te /
analyzed: cig shos kyis zhes bya ba ni dper na de ni sngo bsangs yin te /
translated: The other is not means, for example, ‚ÄúThat is blue.‚Äù

original: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because he is the son of that man.

original: de'i bu snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dag gis so //üîΩmngon sum gyis ni gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i bu snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dag gis so // mngon sum gyis ni gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: Like the son of a lamp.üîΩBy direct perception, there is a change.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur bas gzhan du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur bas gzhan du ste /
translated: By becoming direct perception, there is a change.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gzhal ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gzhal ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it becomes the opposite of the aspect that is cognized by inference and so on.

original: bcas pa zhes bya ba ni yul du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcas pa zhes bya ba ni yul du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Prescribed means taken as an object.

original: cig shos skye ba srid pa min //
analyzed: cig shos skye ba srid pa min //
translated: The arising of the other is not possible.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las cig shos kyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa nyid du skye ba srid pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las cig shos kyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa nyid du skye ba srid pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning is that the arising of the other, inference and so on, is not possible as a refutation of direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad ma'i thu bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i thu bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe chief of valid cognitions,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su grub pa'i don la mngon sum gyis gzhan nyid du byed pa zhes bya ba ni rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su grub pa'i don la mngon sum gyis gzhan nyid du byed pa zhes bya ba ni rigs te /
translated: Because it is not logical to say that direct perception establishes the meaning of a subsequent proof,

original: de ni tshad ma thams cad kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni tshad ma thams cad kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is the chief of all valid cognitions.

original: / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas mngon sum gyi grub pa'i don gzhan nyid bya bar nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas mngon sum gyi grub pa'i don gzhan nyid bya bar nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Inference and so on cannot establish the meaning established by direct perception,

original: da dag stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da dag stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are weak.

original: brtan po yis zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang / phyin ci log dag dang dral bas so //
analyzed: brtan po yis zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang / phyin ci log dag dang dral bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúFirm‚Äù means free from doubt and error.
